review.title: No refund unreasonable
review.reviewText: Would not recommend at all. Inflexible refund policy.  Very disappointed with management.

review.title: Good hotel for the price
review.reviewText: Excellent staff. Close to union square. Don't walk west because gets into shady part of town.
review.positiveRemarks: location with price. Staff was great!
review.negativeRemarks: Needs updating

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: close to great eating places, shopping and the BART
review.negativeRemarks: computer in the lobby to pre print airline tickets, it was real slow.
review.locationRemarks: Eating @ Katana-ya Ramin, BART to the Raider Games, Uber to the Giants game

review.reviewText: Hotel is in a good spot, close to Union square - 5 minute walk.  Easy to walk to shopping,food and the bus/trains.  Rooms were smaller than we expected but we really only needed a bed anyways as we are not hanging in our room. Hotel staff was great.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
We won’t argue; Jasper’s is a wonderful place to start your day. Their breakfast is a local’s favorite! Thanks for the 5-star review. There’s nothing better than knowing we’ve provided guests with a stay that gives a big reason to return—and we hope you will!

review.title: Very nice classic hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: We had a very nice stay. It was very quiet in spite of being on very busy streets. Jasper's was great for breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything in SF is overpriced, especially hotels.

review.title: Serrano
review.reviewText: The gym equipment - treadmill and elliptical sounded like a lawn mower, so loud you couldn't use it comfortably.  $60 for overnight parking ? You can find it cheaper in garages across the street and around the block. The drain in the shower took about 15 minutes to empty and left shampoo residue all over the tub. Carpets and fixtures need updating.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
When visiting San Francisco, the cable cars are a must, and we love being just steps away from the stop. We’re very happy to know you felt welcomed; at Serrano we want our guests to feel like family! Whether it’s your comfortable room, or a great meal at Jasper’s (or both!) that bring you back—we sincerely hope we’ll see you again!

review.title: High rise boutique hotel just off Union Square
review.reviewText: The Serrano seemingly attracted a youthful vibe (albeit my wife and I are not, we nonetheless felt welcomed).  Ease of access to mass transit and cable cars a plus.  Jasper's grill inside hotel provided a fine mix of offerings.  Although the exterior is older in style, the lobby and, more importantly, the room itself contain tastefully appointed updated amenities.
review.locationRemarks: TheAreaNearThisUrbanHotelHasATypicalShareOfPeopleWhoApparentlyUseTheStreetAsTheir home.  Nevertheless,WeWouldRebookHere vs. nearbyMajorHotelChains.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
We’re very sorry to hear that your stay didn’t offer the peace and quiet we want for all of our guests. We’re taking your feedback about the elevators into careful consideration and sincerely apologize for any issues this caused. Please know we are always improving Serrano to keep her looking her best and to make sure guests enjoy relaxation and luxury with every stay. Thanks for being our guest; we’d love to have you again.

review.reviewText: Hotel is dated and overpriced. Our room was decent size but in a loud spot right next to the elevators.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
You’re right; first impressions count for a lot, and we’re taking your feedback about lighting in the lobby seriously. When guests enter our doors we want “welcoming” to be the first word that crosses their mind. We’d love nothing more than to welcome you back the next time you’re in San Francisco!

review.title: Good value, needs a facelift
review.reviewText: I'd rate this place about 3.6 if the scale had a decimal place. Right on the socio-demographic divide: upscale to the east, sketchy to the west, just kitty-corner to the Hilton.  Problem of homeless folk congregating near entrance (noted in some reviews) has been resolved. Room fine, lobby dark and badly in need of facelift - first impressions matter!!  But everything worked fine.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Ray, 
Every guest experience matters to us, and we’re sorry to hear we didn’t live up to our 4 stars during your stay. Guest service is a top priority, and we truly apologize if we didn’t have enough personnel at the front desk. We want check-in to be welcoming and friendly—and stress-free! For future reference you can find the Urban Fee next to our nightly rate, but we are checking to make sure it is easy to find on all booking sites. When guests arrive, we want their stay to be worth every cent because we think our guests are invaluable. If there is anything we can do to provide you with a true Serrano experience, we will.

review.title: Overpriced. Understaffed. Poor location.
review.reviewText: Don't be tricked by the location (Union Square). Near many "massage parlors" and liquor stores and the kind of people it attracts. For safety, you have to be buzzed in the wine store next door. Only person at the reception "Omar" is very rude (and maybe rightfully so). There are no other staff members. It's really a 2 star hotel which you pay as much as 4 star after resort fees (read the fine print-Expedia's "total price" isn't the real total price). Very disappointed with the entire experience.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
Sometimes good things come in threes, and it sounds like it did with our location, value and friendly service. At Serrano, we love our guests and it makes taking care of them easy! We hope it won’t be long until we can see you again!

review.title: Nice hotel better than expectedly
review.reviewText: One night at a reasonable price for San Francisco close to union square. Staff were very nice and helpful. Recommend using this hotel.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Portlander, 
Coffee is one of our love languages, and we’re happy you enjoyed our morning coffee and tea service! We strive to give our guests many reasons to love it here, and it sounds like comfortable beds and a friendly team we’re some of yours. Always know, we’d love to have you back!

review.title: Very good hotel.
review.reviewText:
PROS:
Clean, in excellent condition.  Exceptional bedding.  Very responsive personnel. 
CONS:
Would be nice to have a  fridge, microwave, and a coffeemaker.   Though there is always complimentary fresh coffee in the morning in the reception area.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Donna, 
You sound like the kind of person who knows a good thing when you see it, and we’re thrilled to hear our location, friendly team and clean rooms helped make it a “good thing”! Next time you’re in the city, we hope your friends will take your advice and join you at Serrano Hotel; we’d love to make sure you all have another 5-star stay!

review.title: this hotel is about 3-4 blocks from Union Square.
review.reviewText: The Serrano is very clean, staff were very helpful, room were great/clean,  There is a lot of homeless in the area, being from Toronto it was not a big deal for me.  The homeless are every where.  Fishermans wharf, around the expensive hotels, union square, outside all "liquor/cigarette" places, etc.  We had friends that chose other hotels and had to change rooms twice for one reason or another.  I must say though this hotel was very clean and the staff were super helpful.
review.locationRemarks: Everything is close by.  4 blocks away is union square where all the "hop on/off buses, Macys, shopping, restaurants, etc.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
What can we say except we truly love to help out our guests! We love that you chose Serrano Hotel for your girls’ getaway trip; making plans for Paris and Rome sounds amazing! The next time you have another get-together, let the memory of Banana Pudding (and our location and service!) bring you back. We’d love to have you anytime that you’re not headed to Rome.

review.title: Girl Friends Stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: My goal was to meet with my San Francisco friends along with my NJ friend and talk about a group tour next year to Paris/Rome.  Serrano gave me a recommendation for dinner that everyone enjoyed.  It was the Fino Restaurant, which was within 2 blocks of the hotel.  Thank you Serrano Hotel!
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean and had a 1930's character.  It also had a restaurant attached, which gave a discount.  The banana pudding was the best!
review.negativeRemarks: It could have a longer cocktail hour.  By the time we ate, we passed the time for that.  I was disappointed.  It would have been nice! All else good!
review.locationRemarks: Trolley Car, Fisherman's Wharf

managementResponses.response:

If you’re looking for a hotel at the center of theaters, shopping and dining, you’ve found it at Serrano! We’re thrilled to hear our location put the best of San Francisco at your fingertips. We apologize if anyone in the area made you feel uncomfortable as guest safety is very important to us. Whether it’s helping arrange transportation, or providing easy directions, we’d love to make sure getting around is stress-free the next time you stay. We’d love to have you back!

review.title: Close to market st. Shopping and Entertainment.
review.reviewText: Was surprised at the number homeless persons that hang around around the area begging.

managementResponses.response:

We understand that one of the most welcoming parts of a hotel is walking into a clean room, and we sincerely apologize for falling short. Please know this is not the usual experience, and we’d love to offer you a room that shines if we have the pleasure of seeing you again.

review.reviewText: Desk was unacomadating   Bathroom had mold  holes in the wall this is not a four star hotel

managementResponses.response:
Hello Jerry, 
We love being your go-to hotel, and the compliment has brought a smile to our team! We can’t wait for you to call us home the next time you’re in San Francisco!

review.title: 5 Stars for the price and location.
review.reviewText: This place was as good as any Raddison or Marriott for half the price. My new go to place.

managementResponses.response: You’re very welcome; we loved having you! It’s hard to find a route in San Francisco without hills, but we’re glad you found one on your trip to the wharf. (Walking is even better when it’s relaxing.) The next time you’re here, you’re welcome to take out our bikes. It’s another fun way to explore the city!

review.title: Nice visit, thank you Serrano
review.reviewText: Close to Union Square and walking distance to the ferry wharf( no hills)! We had a lovely visit.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
Thanks for your recommendation! We strive to be at a comfortable price point because we know that having a savings for your time in the city makes a trip even better. We hope you’ll join us again the next time you take a San Francisco getaway!

review.reviewText: Good location, OK overall experience.I will recommend it because of  fair service/money balance

review.title: San Francisco Festival
review.reviewText: The gentleman at the door was very helpful and gave us information to move around the streets of the city.  He also gave us directions to the metro, that saved us a lot of time walking and having more fun.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking could have been a little less expensive.
review.locationRemarks: All shopping was so centrally located, it was great.

We’d love to do anything we can to put you at ease during your time with us in the future and would welcome the chance to have you again.

review.title: bad stay
review.reviewText: not a good hotel. expedia lists this hotel as being in union square when it is actually in fact located in Tenderloin, the worst area of san Francisco. filled with many homeless people and crack addicts. would not stay here again. hotel staff was friendly but rooms are very old and outdated. not worth the price paid

managementResponses.response:

review.title: Excellent location and very reasonably priced.
review.reviewText: Stayed there for 4 nights and we we very pleased with the experience.
review.negativeRemarks: The counter space in the washroom was grossly inadequate ( Deluxe King) and in general the washroom was too small .
review.locationRemarks: The location can't be beat. Great restaurants and bars in close walking distance. A Blues club called Biscuits and Blues was around the corner and fea

managementResponses.response:
Hello PO, 
Booking a vacation can be difficult, and it seems in this case you didn’t see the details of our hotel fee. We love to offer our guests the best in amenities which is what our Urban Fee covers. Benefits like morning coffee and tea, all day flavored water in reception, morning newspaper, town car service Mon thru Fri mornings to the financial district, unlimited local calls and faxes, boarding pass printing, use of our bicycles, and free Wi-Fi are just some of the ways we strive to offer all the conveniences our guests could want in the city. We’re glad that you enjoyed the rest of your stay at Serrano Hotel, and the next time you’re looking for San Francisco history—you know where to find us!

review.title: Mandatory surcharge
review.reviewText: There is a surprise $25 "mandatory" extra room charge upon check-in. Yes, it covers internet, but you have to pay, whether you want internet or not. Older hotel and dated decor. Good beds, clean rooms.
review.positiveRemarks: If you prefer older hotels, this is a reasonably good one.
review.negativeRemarks: Drop that charge or at least offer it as optional.

managementResponses.response: Shopping, theater, and eateries are just outside our door, and we’re happy to hear the convenience was a highlight. We hope it means your visit was full of wonderful memories of the local sights! When you’re ready to see more of the city, head back to Serrano because we can’t wait to welcome you back!

review.title: Very convenient
review.reviewText: It is close to shopping and eateries.  Neighborhood is seedy so make sure you're lubbed up cause you might get squashed

managementResponses.response:

review.title: Pretty good.

The geographic location is close to Union Square, however, at night the neighboring sidewalks just around the corner from the hotel entrance become beds for many homeless folks. (Didn't feel dangerous, just sad.)

review.title: Great service, convenient location!
review.reviewText: The room was small, but very clean. The staff was friendly and helpful.  Great location! Would definitely recommend this hotel.

managementResponses.response:

review.reviewText: Box spring cracked and missing cable machine gym attachments.

managementResponses.response:

If you came to San Francisco to shop then you stayed at the right place! We love being close to Union Square, and it sounds like you did too. At the end of the day, when you’re ready to drop, we have a comfortable room waiting. Thanks for being our guest, we’d love to have you back!

review.reviewText: Location is really close to union square. And we were able to walk to the mall without any problems.

managementResponses.response:

Having a room that looks and smells fresh is very important, and we’re truly sorry for any smell in your room. review.title: Location is good but not the rest ..
review.reviewText:
While the location of the hotel is not bad, quite near union square. 
The room is very small and smells. Th ere is also mandatory charges on internet access and the gym (even you don't use it)
With the charges, you might as well move to Westin. That's what I did since the price is not much difference.
review.negativeRemarks: The smell of the hotel is horrible. I think smelled of tobacco.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Cassie, 
We’re very sorry if the cost was different than you expected; we don’t want our guests to be caught off guard. Parking in the city can be higher, but we’re happy to point out alternative options. We’re glad to hear our historic décor was something you’ll remember about Serrano; we think when guests stay with us they get a unique San Francisco experience. We’d love the chance to win you back and have you stay with us again!

review.title: Parking is horrendous!
review.reviewText: Arrived at 8pm. Called front desk about parking, thought it was at the garage next door. That in itself was an ordeal. Then found out that Valet parking was going to cost us over $60 for 1 night because we had an SUV. Took almost an hour just to get that resolved. Overall, the hotel is beautiful and staff is pleasant, however, for the price we paid on Expedia (almost $400 for a Friday night) + parking and tips and dinner at the hotel restaurant (Jaspers - which was OK, not the best - get the chicken, not the Kale Caesar salad, though our waiter was good) spent over $600 for 1 night. Room was very small and there wasn't even coffee in room. Quite the rip-off. Should have stayed closer to the airport, since it was our last night of vacay in San Fran.
review.positiveRemarks: the architecture and decor. Had a very nice busboy.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is too high and very inconvenient. Put coffee in rooms.
review.locationRemarks: In downtown, so walking distance to alot of things, although didn't seem like the "best" part of town. Lots of homeless people.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Kelsey, 
When traveling from out of town, a recommendation counts for a lot, and we’re very sorry no one told you about the alternative parking options. We offer valet service as a convenience to our guests, but guests are always free to do what best suits their needs. We’re also sorry to hear about the issue with your card. We have policies in place to protect our guests, but we sincerely apologize for any inconvenience. Please know, we want to make your stay as stress-free as possible, and we’d love another chance to do just that.

review.title: Easy access, but not very helpful staff
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is great! Also, it has a very unique charm and is in good condition for an older hotel. Although, after traveling four days across the country, I didn't feel the need to explain why my husband's name was on the card used to pay for the room, which then was denied, pretty rudely, by the staff because he wasn't with me. Thankfully, my girlfriend with me picked up the cost, after the hassel. The valet also was an issue 39.00 to park overnight is absurd no matter what state you're in. Especially, when I later found out there was a 20.00 lot up a block that no one recommended. Overall, it was a comfortable stay, but knowing no one is willing to go out of there way to help an out of town guest, I will probably stay somewhere else next time.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Benjamin, 
Getting a good night’s sleep is invaluable, and we’re very sorry for the street noise. Guests often share that the higher rooms are the quietest, and we’d love to win you over with a stay on our upper floors. We’re taking your feedback about the views and people in the area seriously. We strive to be a welcoming presence in any neighborhood, but we’re sincerely sorry if you felt uncomfortable. We understand that surroundings and views count for a lot, especially in a city with so much to see. We’d love to win you over with a stay that’s wonderful from the inside out, and hope you’ll be back to try one of our quietest rooms!

review.title: Homeless  People Everywhere
review.reviewText:
First of all the food in the hotel restaurant was horrible and extremely overpriced.  The drinks were watered down and extremely expensive that atmosphere is tired!
 Second this place is impossible to get any rest whatsoever.  The homeless people in front of and behind the hotel are screaming yelling and arguing throughout the entire night.  Even with the windows and curtains closed they are so loud you cannot sleep at all.  The view from the windows is nothing but piles of garbage and trash that the homeless people are constantly digging through and throwing around.  The smell coming up from all the garbage and trash surrounding the hotel is unbearable.  The hotel itself is not bad but do not stay here if you plan on getting any rest.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
We’re very sorry you weren’t aware of the self-park option. We want our guests to feel they are getting a good value—and still be able to enjoy San Francisco. We hope the next time you stay it will be for more than a “quick visit” because there is so much to do in the city—and because we’d love to have you back!

review.title: Serrano
review.reviewText: On the edge of the good parts of S.F but close to some no so good bits, hotel was good for a quick visit with staff & rooms very good but would have to comment on cost of Valet Parking which was well over the top considering the garage is right next door to the hotel & would have been half the price if I had known its existence.
review.negativeRemarks: Cost of Valet Parking

managementResponses.response:

We offer onsite parking as a convenience for our guests, but there are nearby parking options as well, and we’d be happy to point them out. We want your time at Serrano-- from check-in to check-out to be stress-free!

review.reviewText:
Great location, cozy hotel

review.reviewText: Nice hotel, very centric. During our stay, we got there earlier than regular check in hours so they told us to wait since they were cleaning it. When they said it was "ready", we found broken glass on the floor, a dirty bathroom curtain and dirty room rug. To be a 4-star hotel Ive had better experiences. Overall staff and stay was ok except these issues, if not it would have been perfect.

review.title: nice hotel

review.reviewText: Nice little boutique hotel - good value for the price

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
Whether shopping, dining or sightseeing is on your list, Union Square is the place to go, and we love being nearby. (It sounds like it was a highlight for you too!) At Serrano, we think the best thing to follow a day out in the city is a clean room and comfortable bed, and we pride ourselves on offering that to our guests. Thanks for letting us know about the Urban Fee. While the fee is listed next to the nightly rate, we’re sincerely sorry if it caught you off guard. Please know, your concern does matter to us, and we hope that the benefits it included, like Wi-Fi, coffee and tea service, use of our bicycles, morning newspaper, and more ensured you didn’t need a thing during your stay. We’d love to have you back again the next time your heart brings you to San Francisco.

review.title: Old ornate hotel close to Union Square

The room was clean and bed was very comfy. Only 2 1/2 blocks from Union Square. To the immediate south was the Tenderloin district with homeless people, so keep away from that direction.
review.positiveRemarks: Room was clean, bed comfy and staff was generally helpful. Close to Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: Main thing would be to not surprise guests with the "Urban Fee". I hate hidden charges like this.

review.reviewText: Overall the stay at this location was a pleasant experience.

review.title: run down
review.reviewText: I intended a week stay, but had to leave after the first night because of disappointment.
review.negativeRemarks: refurbishment
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is central in the union square and everything is near by.

managementResponses.response:
Hello M, 
Every guest and every experience matters to us, and we’re very sorry to hear you were disappointed with your stay. We agree that getting a good night’s sleep is important, and we truly apologize for any street noise keeping you up. Please know that we’re happy to help during you stay and would gladly look into the window’s seal. While we love all of our rooms, it sounds like one of our luxury rooms or suites on a higher floor might be just what you had in mind. We’re also sorry to hear if any of the fees were unexpected. (We only love good surprises!) While we don’t offer free parking at this time, we’re happy to point out nearby options at different price points. We’re also happy to share the benefits of our Urban Fee. It covers many extra amenities like coffee and tea in the lobby, use of our bicycles, Wi-Fi and more! If there is anything we can do to win you over, we’d love to help!

review.title: $500 in unexpected fees.
review.reviewText:
Beds were labeled as queen sized but were barely a full size. Rooms and bathrooms are extremely small and out dated. The hotel is too short to be able to have a nice view. The windows aren't sealed very well at all. We heard CONSTANT screaming and or fights outside of the hotel ALL night EVERY night. I wouldn't say the hotel is in Union Square, I'd say it's more in the Tenderloin area - which is the ghetto. 
When I arrived to the hotel, there were ADDITIONAL charges of $50 per night + $25 per night + another tax/fee percentage. These hidden fees amounted to an additional $500! 
Definitely would not stay at the Serrano again or recommend this hotel to anyone.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
Having a stay that has all the comforts of home is important, and we’re sincerely sorry for falling short of that. Our fitness room should have been fully functional, and we’re bringing this to the attention of our maintenance team immediately. We’re also sorry for the inconvenience of not having in-room coffee makers. We love to offer fresh coffee and tea in the lobby but understand sometimes not having to leave your room is the best part of a getaway. Please know we are listening and would love another chance to offer you dedicated service and the workout space you were looking for.

review.reviewText: Small and outdated. I also tried to go to the gym there, but the parts to the machines were missing. When I asked the staff, that said, "Sorry." Rooms were tiny and no coffee makers in rooms.

managementResponses.response:
Hello GL, 
It sounds like you’ve stayed at Serrano over the years, and we’re always happy to welcome back a guest. Thank you for sharing your most recent experience. Keeping Serrano looking her best is very important to us, and we’re taking your feedback into careful consideration as we continue our improvements. Several of our rooms have been beautiful updated, and we’d love to help you choose a room that you’ll love-- keeping Serrano your San Francisco go-to!

review.title: Business trip
review.reviewText: I've stayed at the Serrano for almost 10 years. I liked it better when it was part of the Kempton Group, it seams to be getting less and less polished, a bit run down in fact !  I think this will be my last stay until the rooms are refurbished !
review.negativeRemarks: room furnishings are really tired
review.locationRemarks: union square and shopping

managementResponses.response:
Hello Suzanne, 
You’re welcome! It was a pleasure to have you, and we’re thrilled to hear our beds were cozy and comfortable and that our hotel team treated you right. Getting your daughter ready for college is exciting, and we wish her the best in her coming education. (We’re selfish, but we hope if she attends UC Berkeley that we’ll get to see you more often!) We’d love to have you back!

review.title: beautiful hotel downtown near everything
review.reviewText: Loved this hotel. We are from Orange County, just wanted an overnight in San Fran and to visit UC Berkeley where my daughter plans on attending. We were able to get parking directly across the street for $39 overnight so that was nice. The restaurant next to Hotel, Jasper;s was not all that great and expensive and just know it is more a bar not a food place but there are so many restaurants close by and Chinese food delivery to the hotel is always a great thing. The staff were wonderful and helpful and really nice. I loved our room. We got a room w/ double beds that were very comfortable - everything you need is here. We stayed in room 716 and really enjoyed the stay.. Thank you to everyone at The Serrano for a wonderful stay.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms were cozy and beds were so comfortable, great location.
review.negativeRemarks: I was totally satisfied
review.locationRemarks: It is located near everything in San Fran.. perfect location

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
Thanks for the feedback about your stay. At the heart of a diverse city, we have guests of every kind, and we apologize if it wasn’t what you were expecting. Many guests share that our location is a highlight, however we understand that being comfortable with your surroundings is very important in a new city, and we’re sorry our location didn’t put you at ease. We hope you’ll plan a return visit to San Francisco, and if you do, we’d love to have you back for stay that’s as relaxing as they come.

review.title: Didn't live up to rating
review.reviewText: Ok...a bit tired and on the edge of a seedy neighborhood. The rooms are small and the clientele mixed (i.e., business travelers on a budget to a large group of European male tourist pulling a cooler filled with beer asking the lobby attendant if there was a pool).  If you are driving be prepared to pay $50 per day for parking in the lots next to and across from the hotel. Around the corner you can find one for $30. Functional but not relaxing.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
With praise like that—we can’t but help having a great day; thanks for the kind words! They’ve been shared with our team, and we’re already looking forward to having you stay with us again. San Francisco is one of the best places to travel, and our goal is to match it with an exceptional stay. We can’t wait to offer you another 5-star getaway!

review.title: I cannot wait to go back to SF and stay here!
review.reviewText: Cannot say enough good things about the night we stayed here. I have stayed at more expensive "Swanky Named" hotels on Union Square... and now I discovered this gem I will never stay at another location in SF.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Heather, 
When you come to San Francisco, “fun, touristy things to do” are all around, and we love knowing you took advantage of our location! We understand that parking in the city can be difficult, and we’ve tried to make it easier with our valet service. There are nearby parking options as well, and we’d be happy to point them out next time you stay. You’re right; an amenity fee should cover much more than coffee—and it does! It includes extras like use of our bicycles, morning newspaper, town car service Mon thru Fri mornings to the financial district, access to our dry sauna, Wi-Fi and more! We’re very sorry you weren’t given this information during your stay. Please know, great dining at Jasper’s, a beautiful room and a friendly hotel team is always waiting to welcome you back!

review.title: Nice - close to everything
review.reviewText:
Honestly, the only real negative was parking and the "amenities" fee. Parking on site is $58 per night and "amenities" fee is $25 per night. As far as I know I've never drunk $25 worth of coffee in a week... never mind a night but that seemed to be the only "amenity" I was privy to. 
Otherwise, the staff is great, the hotel is beautiful and centrally located to all of the fun touristy things to do. Room was impeccably clean. On site dining was also very good.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Momof5ca, 
The Giants are one of the best reasons to visit San Francisco, and we’re glad to hear you enjoyed AT&T Stadium. We’re listening to your feedback about our updates and your experience at Jasper’s. We’re happy to share that we’re bringing back fan favorites to the restaurant. Whether you see the game at the stadium, or cheer around our big screens, we’d love to welcome you back the next time you have Giants fever!

review.title: Close to AT&T Stadium
review.reviewText:
Not truly a 4 star hotel, due to its age, but it was comfortable.
The restaurant attached to it was subpar. Save your money and eat @ the game.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
Location! Location! Location! When you want to be at the heart of San Francisco, and just steps to Union Square, you’ve come to the right place! We’re thrilled you enjoyed your stay and would love to welcome you back anytime!

review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Good location if you need to stay close to  Union Square.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Gary, 
Congratulations on your twins! We’re thrilled you brought them with you and truly apologize we weren’t  as child-friendly as you needed. We’ve passed your feedback on to Jasper’s about their food options because at Serrano (and Jasper’s) we love to welcome families. We’re already looking forward to having you stay again, and when you do, always know we’d love to do anything we can to accommodate your children too!

review.title: Nice hotel, not for family.
review.reviewText: This was the second stay for me at this hotel.  The first was before having twin baby girls!  Both stays were wonderful and the staff is consistently great.  This hotel offer little for children and while the first level restaurant does have good food, the variety in selection is missing.  I will stay at this hotel again, just not with the kids.  Everything was worth the price, except the cost of parking which is really about supply and demand rather than the hotel "choosing" to charge an large price.
review.negativeRemarks: Amenities for families. (e.g. restaurant menu choices, activities)
review.locationRemarks: Close to most everything except the wharf.  Union square shopping about 4 blocks away!

managementResponses.response:
Hello Rochelle, 
Being walking distance to a Starbucks is a definite must—and Union Square, theater, Chinatown, and more is a bonus! We’re very happy to hear you enjoyed your stay. A warm welcome is waiting if you come back in the city!

review.title: Nice Location
review.reviewText: Close to Union Square. No room service available, but within walking distance to Starbucks, restaurants and shopping. A lot of homeless people around, but still a nice hotel and convenient location.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
We understand that a lot of planning goes into a hotel stay, and we’re sorry we didn’t have availability for the room you booked. Starting guests’ visits on a positive note is important, and we strive to make checking-in just the beginning of a great stay. We’re also very concerned that you weren’t offered helpful and accommodating service. We’re taking this issue seriously and would love the  further help.

review.title: Great location.  Staff service needs some work.
review.reviewText:
Overall was happy with stay primarily due to location near Union and overall price.  Biggest concerns were staff and checkin.  I purchased a luxury suite for 3.  When I arrived and they assigned me my room I asked specifically if it was the luxury suite. They said yes.  When I got to the room it didn't seem right.  Went back down and another person said no, that was a smaller room but they ran out and had one out of service.  So rather than telling me the truth they were deceptive.  When I asked how the would compensate for the difference they said they couldn't since I prepaid.  Yeah, right!

Next day they moved us to the proper suite for the next 4 nights and only provided $25 of compensation.  Amazing.

Then issues with housecleaning not cleaning my room when I asked because of a mix up with their enviro program.  Front desk assured me it would be cleaned but after returning to room in late afternoon it still wasn't done.

Finally, rooms are a little worn, but nice.  Biggest complaint is the quality of the mattresses.  Very worn and old and uncomfortable.  And the pullout couch had springs poking out of it.

Location was great.  Price was fair, but I wouldn't stay again
review.negativeRemarks: Front desk service and room quality mainly mattresses
review.locationRemarks: Close to union square. Walked to rest restaurants every night.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
As a four-star hotel, housekeeping is a high priority, and we’re sincerely sorry your room disappointed. We’re in the midst of ongoing improvements and are taking your concerns seriously as we progress with our room updates. Several of our rooms have been beautifully refinished, and we’d love another chance to have you back to show you the true beauty of Serrano Hotel!

review.title: Real old hotel. Stay away !
review.reviewText: Room is really small, outdated  and dirty. I wouldn't seven stay here for free

managementResponses.response:
Hello Suzy, 
“I would stay here again” are some of our favorite words! We truly hope you will! It’s hard to cover San Francisco in a weekend, so we’re glad you had some extra time to explore. (And we’re glad our location made that easy!) Thanks for your feedback about our lobby and bathroom size. We’re happy to share that we’re in the midst of ongoing improvements and we’re definitely taking your feedback into consideration as we continue to improve. Don’t be a stranger; we’d love to have you back soon!

review.title: Decent hotel for the price close to Union Square
review.reviewText: My husband and I spent 4 nights at the Serrano Hotel.  Rooms were pleasant, but the bathroom was pretty small.  The lobby was a bit dark - but overall the hotel had charm and was a reasonable price for SF.  There are more indigents than expected close in the area.  It was very centrally located for shopping and getting on tour buses.  I would stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Update the lobby area.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square.  Plenty of shopping and restaurants nearby.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Chris, 
You must’ve been exhausted getting here at one a.m., and we’re very sorry we didn’t have your reserved room available. Thanks for being understanding! We’re glad to hear our location was a highlight of your stay; having you here was the highlight for us!

review.reviewText: Good location, we checked in at 1 am and they didn't have the room we reserved available, got switched to a smaller room. Otherwise no problems.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
We think our guests are “fantastic” too; thanks for being one of them! Often times people play the most important part of any experience, and we’re thrilled to hear our team treated you right. We’d love to welcome you back for another stay!

review.reviewText: Overall a nice hotel near Union Square.  Staff was fantastic.  Rooms are small but comfortable.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
You’re right; just five minutes from our door you have the best of San Francisco: shopping, dining, theaters and more-- and just inside our door, you’ll find some of San Francisco most comfortable beds. (It’s what we call a win-win!) Thanks for sharing your concern about the parking options; we are taking your feedback seriously. It was a pleasure to have you as our guest, and we hope you’ll be back again.

review.title: Nice hotel located in the heart of SF
review.reviewText: Hotel is located in the heart of the city. Great location, but no free parking. Beds were very comfortable. No breakfast available.
review.negativeRemarks: Offer parking
review.locationRemarks: Heart of the city. 5 minute walk to good shopping

managementResponses.response:
Hello AJ, 
When we’re making a list of must-haves, friendly service, easy parking, and location are definitely on it! We’re glad our vintage charm caught your eye, and we’d love to welcome you back for another stay.

review.title: Vintage Hotel
review.reviewText: Loved the old designs in the lobby. The bellmen were very helpful when the front desk staff were dealing with a line of people. Parking across the street in the garage was very convenient for frequent in/out parking. Places were within reasonable walking distance.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
We like to provide our guests with the comforts of home and apologize there wasn’t enough closet space for you. We’re always in the midst of ongoing improvements and are taking your feedback seriously as we strive to offer a hotel that meets our guests’ every need. Next time you come to see it all, remember it’s just steps from our door.

review.reviewText: Hotel was within walking distance of the major attractions. It did not have closet space.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Ruth, 
If there’s something guests should always count on at Serrano, it’s dedicated service. We’re thrilled you had a five-star stay, and your many kind words have us all smiling. Though it’s true San Francisco may be short on square footage, Serrano strives to make up for it by offering luxury in every room. We love knowing you and your family had such a good time in the city-- but think one trip is never enough. We hope you feel the same because we’d love to see you again.

review.title: Lovely Art Deco Hotel
review.reviewText: My family and I knew nothing about the Serrano Hotel before booking it.  I was pleasantly surprised by how lovely it was!  The lobby was a Spanish/Moroccan style design.  The rooms although on the small side were lovely and very clean and neat.  Coffee in the morning and water throughout the day was provided in the lobby.  The neighborhood was filled with homeless people but were harmless.  The only annoying factor was parking, very expensive and very little discount was provided by hotel.  However, I assume that would be the case no matter where we stayed.  Overall a good experience.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking
review.locationRemarks: The restaurant in the hotel was nothing to look at but their food was good.  Flour and Co was a fabulous bakery and breakfast place on Taylor, great!

managementResponses.response:
Hello Bryan, 
We always appreciate when guests take the time to let us know about their stay because it lets us know how we can improve. We’re sorry to hear your stay was just “okay” and are listening to your feedback about the refrigerator and parking options. For future reference, there are several parking garages in the area, and our team will gladly point out an option that may be a better price point for you. While nearby parking can keep things simple, we also understand that traveling can get expensive quickly and want to make sure our guests to focus on enjoying San Francisco! If there is anything we can do to make your next stay impress, we’d love to!

review.title: Within walking distance to to Shops
review.reviewText: This was just an okay hotel for me.  Although it was within walking distance to major shopping, the parking is very expensive. I really can't say anything 'bad' about it on a whole, it was just okay for me.
review.negativeRemarks:
No soap in the room
Defrost the freezer. could not use it due to the build up of ice
Provide a refrigerator for guest to use for their own goods
review.locationRemarks:
Close to Macy's
Close to Cable Car's

managementResponses.response:
Hello Mona, 
Having room to get ready for the day is important, and we sincerely apologize you didn’t have the space you needed. One of our favorite parts of being a boutique hotel is the variety of rooms and suites we offer. Next time you stay, we’d love to help you choose a room with a luxurious bathroom—including a deep soaking tub and plenty of room for toiletries, curling irons and more!

review.title: The tiny bathroom
review.reviewText: The restroom was the worst! I couldn't bring my toiletries into the restroom because there was no room to put anything. No room for curling irons also. Women need a large enough bathroom to use and share!!!

managementResponses.response:
Hello Brandon, 
A happy guest is the best reward we can have, and we’re thrilled to hear our location and hotel team made your stay one you’d gladly do again! It’s hard to choose between all the landmarks around us (Union Square, Chinatown, theater, AT&T Park, Embarcadero); the list is long! Whether you want to see it again, or come back to explore more of the city, we’re already looking forward to having you stay with us again!

review.title: Hotel was in the perfect location.
review.reviewText:
Serrano is centrally
Located to just about anywhere in the city one would want to go. Rooms were renovated and clean. Staff was friendly and helpful. Was overall satisfied and would recommend as well as stay there again.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
We’re sincerely sorry that the toilet was anything less than spotless. As a four-star hotel, we take housekeeping very seriously and are bringing this issue up with our team immediately. Always know, we are more than happy to come take care of the issue during the time of your stay. We want guests to be happy with their room and service. We’d love the chance to have you stay with us again so we can offer the true Serrano experience, where beautiful and clean rooms come standard! Thanks!

review.title: Dirty toilet..Small room. Very disappointing.
review.reviewText: The toilet was really dirty. Although the room was small, but still acceptable. Hotel should look into the cleanliness for guests' pleasant stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness
review.locationRemarks: Not directly at union square, but still walkable.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Andrea, 
We love our guests and want getting here to be as easy as possible-- which is why we strive for checking in to be a breeze. It’s was our pleasure to offer you friendly service, and we sincerely hope we’ll have the chance to do it again. We’d love to have you back!

review.title: Great hotel! Close to restaurants..
review.reviewText: I was treated with respect by the staff members ! Check in was very quickly ..

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
What’s a visit to San Francisco without walking around to see the sights? A great location (next to Union Square) is one of our favorite things to offer our guests, and we’re thrilled it was a highlight of your stay. Our team loves to do anything we can to help our guests enjoy your stay, and we truly appreciate you letting us know that we did. Your 5-star review has made our day—the only thing we’d love more is having you back!

review.title: Nice hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a good location, making it easy to walk the city. Overnight parking was convenient. The hotel lobby was nicer than the exterior of the hotel. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and comfortable. Price was reasonable for the area.
review.negativeRemarks: They had complimentary coffee in the morning. Decaf at night would have been lovely.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Anonymous, 
Everyone likes to feel like “it was money well spent,” and we’re thrilled to hear that’s how you felt about Serrano. We think our guests are invaluable! Thank you for being one of them; we’d love to welcome you back!

review.reviewText: A very clean and economical solution.  It was closed to Union Square and although near the tenderloin, a great choice for high quality low cost accomodations.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Sachi, 
At Serrano, we’re all about having the comforts of home! Having a place to work out are part of that, and extra benefits like morning coffee and tea, all day flavored water in reception, morning newspaper, town car service Mon thru Fri mornings to the financial district, unlimited local calls and faxes, boarding pass printing, use of our bicycles, and free Wi-Fi are too. This is what our Urban Fee covers, but we sincerely apologize if you were not made aware of the charges before your stay. We’re also very sorry to hear about the service you received and are bringing it up with our hotel team immediately. When guests stay at Serrano, we want service to be at the top of their list of reasons to return. We’d love another chance to make this right.

review.title: additional fees!
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel for $168 for one night.  With tax, my expedia confirmation said the hotel will charge $195.  They charged me $299 originally, and when I called, they gave me $50 back.  Which means I paid $249 all told.  A full $50 more than I agreed to.  The man on the phone refused to give the rest back because he said there were fees.  I have no idea what the fees were for because no one mentioned them to me when i checked in, or when i checked out, which I think is pretty terrible service.
review.positiveRemarks: clean and quiet, had a decent workout room.
review.negativeRemarks: hidden fees as I mentioned before, also all of the parking on that block is over $50 per night, because they charge taxes and fees too!
review.locationRemarks: close to union square - good restaurants and bars

managementResponses.response:
Hello Adam, 
At Serrano, our guests and the quality of a stay are the two most important parts of our hotel which is why we are taking your feedback seriously. We strive to be at a comfortable price point for our guests and are listening to your comments about breakfast. A meal at Jasper’s Corner Tap & Kitchen is a guest highlight, and we hope you had a chance to try something from their breakfast menu. (The Lox Tartine is amazing!) Many guests are surprised to learn that Serrano Hotel was built in 1923, and we’re one of San Francisco’s oldest hotels. It’s why we strive to stay true to our historic character. It’s important to keep Serrano looking her best though, and we’re happy to share we’re in the midst of ongoing renovations. We’d love another chance to impress and have you stay again!

review.title: Not good value for money
review.reviewText:
You will find better hotel for much more lower price than this in this localisation.
 I slept here for only one night (okey, the room was clean as well as the bathroom), but I succeeded in finding better place (with breakfast) just 300 meters from Serrano Hotel on the next day.
Maybe Serrano hotel was a modern hotel 10 years ago, but now it looks a little bit old and it needs renovation. Shortly: low value for money

managementResponses.response:
Hello PRT, 
Seeing “beautiful” at the top of your list means a lot; thanks for the compliment! We’re happy to hear our location, views, and friendly team were highlights of your stay and are taking your concerns about our Urban Fee seriously. We want our guests to have the best, and providing extra amenities is our way of making sure that from Wi-Fi to morning coffee—guests have everything they need.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: Friendly porter. The room had a great view. This hotel has a great location, but has the same problem as every other hotel in the are, the large number of homeless people in the area.
review.negativeRemarks: Don't charge $25/per night for incidentals. And don't charge for use of on site computer.
review.locationRemarks: Easy to get around.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Miguel, 
A recommendation is the best compliment, and we sincerely appreciate your praise of Serrano! We know that wonderful guests like you are the best feature of our hotel! The Lox Tartine at Jasper’s was a great choice, and we’re passing you kind words on to the chef. The only thing better than having you stay is welcoming you back—and we hope we will see you through our doors again very soon!

review.title: Nice and quaint
review.reviewText: The service desk and the doormen were very helpful and willing to guide you where you needed.. The amenities were excellent. The rooms were large. Jasper's restaurant in the hotel was delicious. At Jasper's I enjoyed my Lox Tartine for breakfast. I love the authentic decor in the lobby. It made me feel cozy. The crown molding on the walls and ceilings were breathtaking. The hotel has easy access to the attractions around San Francisco. I recommend this hotel to all who would want a recommendation. The price is right.

managementResponses.response:
Hello MTo, 
Being at a comfortable price point for our guests is important, and we’re glad you found your stay was worth every penny. At Serrano, we think our guests are priceless! Thanks for your feedback about our location. Being at the heart of downtown, we’re close to Union Square and the Theater District, and we see people from all walks of life. We apologize if the area made you uncomfortable because we want our guests to feel nothing but “as ease” during their stay. We hope San Francisco calls you back because we’d love to see you again!

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText: Pretty nice hotel at much cheaper cost than most others at the time. Only negativive thing is location is in tenderloin (sketch @ night)

managementResponses.response:
Hello lisa, 
We love hearing “charming” next to our name and knowing that our clean rooms and easy transportation made your stay even better brought us a big smile! We’re taking your feedback about our fitness room seriously and always appreciate knowing what we can do to make Serrano better. It will be just as easy to check in the next time you’re in San Francisco, and we’d love to welcome you back!

review.title: Charming
review.reviewText: Check in / check out / transportation arrangements were all quick and easy. Room was spotless. The decor is a little over-the-top, but it suits the age of the building and some of its ornate features. Fitness room is small, but has a decent variety of equipment.

managementResponses.response:
Hello CX,  
It’s hard to beat 100%, and we’re thrilled to hear you found so much to do within walking distance! (It’s one of our favorite parts of Serrano too!) Every guest that stays with us is welcome, and we’re glad you felt it. Thanks for the feedback about the parking costs. There are several options in the area, and if valet isn’t what you have in mind, we’d be happy to point out nearby options. We want you to have cake (and eat it too!) when you stay with us at Serrano Hotel!

review.title: Vintage style hotel in a good location
review.reviewText: Hotel is surrounded by reataurants and shops, and is just 5 mins away from the artistic Union Square. walking score is 100%. There are lots of homeless people downtown. If you don't use dark alleys late at night, safety shall not be an issue. Hotel room is small but is very clean and well equipped. Staff are very friendly. The only thing bad is probably the parking. Average price in that location is between $45. Guess you just cannot have the cake and eat it too.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Lau, 
When it comes to a fantastic SF location, it’s hard to beat Serrano Hotel—in the center of it all! If you came to shop, you were in luck because Union Square is just steps away! Thank you for the kind words about our clean rooms; our housekeeping team works hard to make the rooms shine. At Serrano, we strive to be at a comfortable price point, and we apologize if the room was smaller than you had in mind. While San Francisco may be short of square footage, our goal is to make sure that there’s plenty of great service to go around. We’d love another chance to impress and hope you’ll stay with us again!

review.title: Nice hotel walking distance from shoping ;)
review.reviewText: Is an ok hotel, clean (wich is the more important to me) very friendly and helpful staf, $45 public parking a cross the street,  nice bar but... In my opinion the rooms are to little, is too pricy... I stayed in a room with a queen size bed for $240/night  not really worth it for what it is.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
It’s hard not to love wine and great coffee, and we’re thrilled you enjoyed them both at Serrano. We’re taking your comments about our bed and pillows seriously because a relaxing night’s sleep is needed before a big day out in the city. Many guests tell us our beds are a highlight, but we understand no bed feels as good as home. The next time you stay, we’ll be sure and put you up in the coziest bed in the house!

review.title: Great location if you turn in the right direction.
review.reviewText: If you turn in the wrong direction, then you end up with the homeless people. Located close to Union Square. Walgreens located round the corner. Staff are great. They serve out Complementary coffee every morning and have a wine tasting evening every tuesday. Decent place. but the bed and the pillows can use some attention. No other complaints. Value for money. Could go back.
review.negativeRemarks: Beds & Pillows
review.locationRemarks: Union square is 10 mins walk away.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Martin, 
There’s no denying it; Jasper’s has a crazy good hamburger—made with angus beef, smoked gouda and BBQ smoked pork belly. (Yumm!) We’re thrilled to hear you were a fan. Offering the full package: rooms, service & great eats is what we love to do. We’re very sorry for anyone in the area that made you feel uncomfortable, we strive to be an inviting presence in any neighborhood. One thing we appreciate about our location (besides being at the heart of the city!) is seeing the revival of the neighboring district. With beautiful parks opening, big tech companies moving in the area and new housing in the works, we’re very excited for all that is to come. We’d love to have you stay with us in the future and see it too. Thanks!

review.title: Nice hotel. Close to everything.
review.reviewText:
Nice hotel. The room was small but very clean and comfortable. The Jasper restaurant serves really good burgers ! 

The only odds of this Hotel is that it is located in tenderloin. The worst district in SF. Lot of homeless nearby.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff, the room, the restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: The only thing that comes to my mind is the location... which unfortunately cannot be changed
review.locationRemarks: Even if the hotel is in a bad district. It is near of everything. Marker street, Powell street, the piers, union square, etc.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Barry,  
We liked having you stay a lot too! There’s nothing better than knowing a guest loved their stay because it lets us know we’re getting it right. Our hotel team is already keeping an eye out for your return because we’d love to see you again!

review.reviewText: Great place. I really liked it a lot. Great lobby, nice rooms a bit small.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
Access to coffee during the day is important; we completely agree! While we love to meet guests in the lobby every morning for our coffee and tea service, we’re listening to your feedback about in-room coffee makers and are taking it seriously. We want guests to have everything they need when they stay. Thanks for being our guests; we’d love to have you back!

review.title: Nice hotel, walking distance to shopping & attr
review.reviewText: Needed access to coffee in room or throughout the day, in lobby.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Katie, 
One of our favorite parts of a getaway is a luxurious bed which is why we want to offer that to our guests! We also want to offer our guests welcoming service, because at Serrano, you’re not just a visitor, you’re a valued guest! We hope to see you again soon; you have a standing invitation to come back!

review.reviewText: Beautiful old world decor and comfy beds and pillows. I used the fitness room to run on treadmill and it was fine. Staff was very nice

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
San Francisco is a great city to return to so it’s easy to see why you’d want to make visiting a regular thing. Thank you for choosing Serrano Hotel as your place to stay! Our team does everything we can to make sure guests enjoy their stay, and we’re happy to hear they treated you right. Guest feedback is very important to us which is why we’re taking your comments about our front door seriously. We want getting through Serrano’s doors to be easy and welcoming! We’re also listening to your comment about the TV. Having a large screen is great, but only if the channels come through clear. We’re sorry they weren’t working well during your stay. Our housekeeping team is also looking into your comments to make sure the hairdryers are working properly. Having the comforts of home is an important part of any stay, and we want to get it right. We’re glad to hear you’ll keep us in mind the next time you visit San Francisco; we’d love to have you back!

review.title: This place is OK.
review.reviewText: I stay in San Francisco frequently and I found this hotel to be along the lines of what you expect but a little bit less.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  Room was small and old.  Nice television, bigger sized flat screen, but the channels/cable kept cutting in and out so it wasn't relaxing to watch.  Hair dryer was broken, knees hit the wall when you sit on the toilet.  There wasn't really anywhere to hang out except for on the bed or at desk.  The room could use some updating and I wouldn't say it was dirty but not exactly clean either.  I would stay here again, if the price was right and other options were already booked up.
review.negativeRemarks: The slowly opening front door!
review.locationRemarks: Location is nice for walking to Union Square, shopping, Market Street.  It is right on the edge of the Tenderloin, if this is concerning for you.

managementResponses.response: Serrano has been a well-loved San Francisco hotel for nearly 100 years, so when it comes to finding a “classic” hotel-- you found it! A San Francisco getaway with your wife sounds perfect, and we hope you both had a wonderful time in the city! Thank you for choosing Serrano to be part of your special memories; we’d love to have you back to make some more anytime!

review.reviewText: Really good I've been at this nice and quite hotel with my wife during 4 days.. really good experience for one old classic hotel. The cost is good compared with others 4 stars hotel from the region.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
Three is a magic number and knowing our hotel team was: inviting, informative and prompt really makes our day! As a 4-star hotel we strive to always give attention to detail, and service and beautiful rooms are part of that package. There’s nothing better than offering our guests a wonderful stay because you deserve it! If there’s anything we can do to help you book another stay, we’d love to!

review.reviewText: The staff was inviting, informative and prompt to my requests.  The room was clean, comfortable and attractive.  The windows open to invite in the San Francisco air and ambiance.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
We’re giving you a big thumbs up too—thanks for being our guest! When you pair Serrano with a restaurant like Jasper’s, it’s what we call a win-win, and we’re thrilled you thought so too! Our liquid nitrogen caramel corn is a hit! (It’s a local’s favorite and has been catching the eye of major food writers like 7x7 and Thrillist too!) You’re not alone in loving it. Knowing you’d send business our way means a lot; we feel lucky to have had you as our guest! Please come again!

review.reviewText: Your doorman/parking attendant was more than helpful. Love Jaspers and the bartender and of course the carmel cold popcorn (big thumbs up) the room was nice, the view excellent and the staff very friendly would recommend it anyone!

managementResponses.response: At Serrano, we strive to be so much more than “regular,” and we’re truly sorry we didn’t impress. Thank you for sharing your feedback. While we want all of our guests to be happy, we appreciate your honesty. Amenity fees are an industry standard at many hotels and resorts around the country, but we’re very sorry that they were a disappointing part of your stay. We want our guests to love it here and feel it was worth every cent. We greatly value our guests and would love another chance to offer you a stay that you’ll enjoy.

review.title: Regular hotel, too pricey for what if offers
review.reviewText: Passable if you are staying all day out. The so called "resort fee ", which is mandatoty, is a shamelessly disguised increase  in rates. US 25 a day for coffee and a newspaper? A rip off, really. And if you take breakfast at the Jasper, coffee is charged again.
review.negativeRemarks: Honesty to recognize that all rates are in fact US25 higher. Or make the resort fee optional. If you use it you pay, if not, you don't.
review.locationRemarks: Location seems good.

managementResponses.response:
Hello mrs a, 
When you stay at Serrano, we want every member of our team to treat you right! It’s why little extras, like holding your luggage, is our pleasure! Thank you so much for your patience with the electricity issue. Having light in your bathroom is a big deal, and we’re glad we were able to take care of it right away. When guests stay with us, all they have to say the word and we’ll do everything we can to make it happen!

review.title: Great stay!
review.reviewText: Hotel was perfect for a quick trip to San Francisco. My first night the electricity was out in my bathroom and they came and fixed it right away. Small spaces but relatively quiet and comfortable. They also held my luggage while I attended my conference and were very courteous.

managementResponses.response: Being just steps away from so many of San Francisco’s best attractions (like Union Square!), is one of our best features. The weather is perfect, so we hope it means you could explore all around the area! We’re happy to share that getting a discount at our restaurant is only one of the many great benefits the Urban Fee covers. We love to offer our guests many more-- like our morning coffee and tea, all day flavored water in reception, morning newspaper, town car service Mon thru Fri mornings to the financial district, unlimited local calls and faxes, boarding pass printing, use of our bicycles, and free Wi-Fi. Guest feedback is key, and we appreciate you letting us know about the room size. We’re happy to hear Katherine helped you out, and we’d love for you to repeat the mantra with your next stay—“It got [even] better!”

review.title: It got better
review.reviewText:
At check in we were told our room was "cozy". It was like a closet. After taking to Katherine the next morning they put us into a standard king room, no questions asked. At check in we were told there was a $25/day "urban fee" with no explanation of what it's for. The next morning the Katherine explained what it was for. You are supposed to get 10% off at their restaurant but no one did that until I asked.
The bigger room was very nice and clean. The hotel was quiet within walking distance to a lot.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Kirk, 
A comfortable bed is a must for us too, and we’re thrilled to hear you could rest easy! If you’re looking for a hotel that’s close to all the best of SF, you found it. Downtown is a great place to explore. Thanks for your feedback about parking prices. Navigating parking in a city can be difficult, but our team is more than happy to point out nearby parking options at a lower price point. Always know you have an invitation to come back; we’d love to have you!

review.title: Close to downtown, bus lines, and good restaurants
review.reviewText:
Stayed for one night. Bed, linens, bathroom were excellent. Comfortable beds is a must for us. Staff pleasant and helpful.

Only downside is parking prices.
review.negativeRemarks: Deals with parking. What I saved on the room, I overspent on parking.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Emily,  
At Serrano, we want to provide exceptional stays, and we’re sorry to hear we disappointed. If there is anything we can do to make our guests feel at home then we want to, and we’re sincerely sorry if our team didn’t go the extra mile! We’d love the chance to make a better second impression and hope we get the chance to have you stay with us again!

review.title: Nice enough but not great
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice but the room and especially the bathroom was very small. The staff was nice but not overly helpful. Good experience but not great. Hotel is far from the Pier and most other things that tourists go to San Francisco to do.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Veronica, 
The feeling is mutual; we loved having you stay! Offering a stay that makes a visit to San Francisco even better is our number one goal, and it’s always appreciated to know that we’ve succeeded. Please come again the next time you visit San Francisco!

review.reviewText: Very pleasant stay.  Liked hotel and staff super friendly

managementResponses.response:
Hello Silvas, 
We love knowing our hotel team treated you right! (Guests are the best part of Serrano Hotel!) Because Serrano is a boutique hotel, we have several rooms to choose from. If you’re looking for a little more space, our deluxe rooms or hotel suites would be a perfect fit. The next time you’re in the city, we’d love to have you stay with us again!

review.title: Nice staff, rooms are small and baths ok
review.reviewText: Rooms and beds are small, need to be revamped, but a decent place to spend short period of time.

managementResponses.response:
Hello DeAnn, 
Knowing you’d stay here again are words we never get tired of hearing! Thanks for taking the time to let us know! Now that you know how to find us, we hope you find your way back—just look in the heart of San Francisco’s best shopping and you’ll find us!

review.title: The hotel was very clean. The staff was wonderful.
review.reviewText: I would stay at this hotel in the future. It is close to stores within I walking distance or a short lift ride to anywhere you want to go.

managementResponses.response:

We apologize if this made you uncomfortable; how guests feel about our location matters to us. Many guests share that our location, so close to San Francisco’s best attractions (steps from Union Square!) is a highlight, but we are taking your feedback seriously and passing it along to management. We want all of our guests to feel nothing but welcomed when they visit Serrano

review.title: Bate and switch
review.reviewText: Expedia advertised hotel was in Union square when it was actually in a very bad part of town. The hotel manager told us to not leave our car oin street parking as it would get vandalized, We did not stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Never had a chance we left because of the area.
review.negativeRemarks: Change the advertising to be honest
review.locationRemarks: Horrible location. Crime ridden - prepare to dodge bulliits

managementResponses.response: We don’t like to brag, but since you mentioned it, our location is fantastic! Nothing beats taking a trolley for a true San Francisco experience, and we’re happy to have one nearby—as well as Union Square and great shopping! Knowing our team treated you right is just what we like to hear; thanks for sharing! We’re listening to your feedback about our guest rooms too. Making sure they are kept looking their best is important because we want our guests to feel pampered during every stay. Always know you have a place to stay when you visit San Francisco; we’d love to have you back!

review.title: Nice Hotel Conveniently Located
review.reviewText: The hotel is very nice but very simple.  Nothing fancy.  The room looks like a guest room in someone's house.  It is comfortable and utilitarian.  More apartment than hotel feel.  The lobby is very pretty.  The staff is very accommodating.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms could use a spruce up.
review.locationRemarks: Location is great.  It is easy to walk to almost anywhere.  It is close to Union Square, BART and the trolly.  Lots of fun things nearby.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Jess, 
With so many amenities to take advantage of at Serrano, we’re sincerely sorry you weren’t aware of them and are bringing this up with our front desk team. We want our guests to make the most of their time with us! We’re listening to your feedback about freshening up Serrano and are happy to share we’re in the midst of ongoing renovations. Knowing what matters to our guests is an important part of that process. Thanks for the shout out about our comfortable beds. Sleeping away from home can be tiring, and our deluxe beds more than make up for it! Next time San Francisco is on your vacation must-do list, another great night’s sleep is waiting for you at Serrano!

review.title: Hotel that is in a good location - very dated.
review.reviewText: Overall the hotel was fine. Was very disappointed to find out there were several amenities I had access to (gym, car service etc.) at check out time, after I questioned what the resort fee was for. The bed was comfortable enough, and the hotel was reasonably quiet though the lobby and hallways smelt like stale carpet, would be good to freshen everything up, even just getting some fresh air through the hotel would be nice.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed was the best part.
review.negativeRemarks: Couldn't find the mini bar. The smell inside.
review.locationRemarks: Good location central to a lot of tech businesses in SF.

managementResponses.response: We know that when you're on the road for business, location and convenience are key. A little comfort and luxury never hurts either! That's why we love being in the middle of it all in San Francisco! We're that perfect little get away after a long day – whether it's meetings or sight-seeing we love to welcome you home! Hopefully you'll be back to see us again soon; we'd love to have the chance to welcome you back!

review.reviewText: Attended conference in the area. Good location close to everything. Staff always willing to help. Huge bathroom with jacuzzi. Very comfortable.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Diana, 
At Serrano, we think location counts for a lot, and we’re thrilled to hear ours gave you a front row seat to San Francisco. Whether you traveled for business or pleasure, you’re close to everything you need. Thanks for your feedback about our rooms. One of the best parts of being a boutique hotel is our variety of rooms and suites. We’d love to help you book a room that better fits your needs the next time you stay. From our deluxe rooms to luxury suites—there’s a space we’re sure you’ll love. We’d love to have you come again!

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: Good location but room is kind of small and a little old.

We agree; our location is one of the highlights of Serrano, and we’re already looking forward to having you find your way back!

review.title: Cozy hotel. Good location.
review.reviewText:
Hotel is cozy and lobby has a very welcoming feeling to it.
Hotel front desk personnel ok but not friendly . 
Bell  desk personnel very good. Very helpful and informative. 
Doormen had a great cheerful attitude.
I would stay there again .

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
If you want a truly relaxing experience, then wine tasting is the perfect finishing touch. We’re glad you enjoyed it and agree the Sonoma wines are wonderful. We appreciate your kind words about our hotel team. Interactions with people help make an experience great, and we want our guests to expect the best! We’re taking your feedback about our parking seriously; at Serrano we don’t want to be on par with other hotels, we want to exceed them and offer our guests many reasons to come back. We’d love to have you again!

review.title: Close to everything in downtown SF
review.reviewText: Staff was very attentive and courteous.  The Happy Hour wine tasting event was fun.  Got to try some Sonoma wines that are not readily available at retail
review.positiveRemarks: In the heart of the city.  Was very clean.  Has a lot of history
review.negativeRemarks: Only negative... parking is very expensive.  But's that consistent with other locations in downtown SF.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Virginia, 
If I had to pick the best parts of a hotel stay, comfortable beds and a great location would be at the top of my list! We’re thrilled to know you found them both at Serrano Hotel and that you were impressed from the moment you stepped into our lobby. As one of San Francisco’s most historic hotels, offering that original charm is always a guest favorite. At Serrano, we want our guests to have the best, and we apologize if you weren’t aware we serve coffee and tea in the lobby. Next time we hope you can enjoy it during all of your stay. Thank you for sharing your feedback about our Urban Fee. The fee covers so many great benefits like the (delicious) coffee in the morning, Wi-Fi service, all day flavored water in reception, morning newspaper, town car service Mon thru Fri mornings to the financial district, unlimited local calls and faxes, boarding pass printing, and use of our bicycles. Now that you’ve stay with us, next time you’ll know just where to find the coffee brewing. We’d love if you come back for more!

review.title: Fabulous lobby, central location, bed comfortable
review.reviewText: All good, no room service, did not realise free coffee in lobby
review.negativeRemarks: Not impressed by the additional $25 per day charge, supposedly to cover paper (from lobby), coffee (also from lobby but we did not know about
review.locationRemarks: Central downtown location

managementResponses.response:
Hello ❤️san Francisco,

review.title: Walk away from union square ,my sister and I loved
review.reviewText: The staff at this hotel was absolutely incredible it was nothing we can ask for that was not available and only did ask for something it was there within minutes we will definitely stay there again .

managementResponses.response:
