review.title: Nice hotel staff were very nice
review.reviewText: No wi FI in original room , staff got me another room , the women that helped me was lovely , room I was moved to was smaller which was ok , but the bathroom sink was in front of a column so you had to stand sideways to use the sink

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
At Serrano, we want to live up to our four-star rating, and we’re sincerely sorry to hear we disappointed. It’s very important to us to offer nothing less than the best service for our guests, and we’re sharing your concerns with our team. Taking care of our guests (quickly!) matters. We’re also sorry to hear our restaurant failed to impress. We change our menu seasonally, and if there wasn’t a favorite on the menu during this visit, we hope you’ll try us again. Our chef, Adam Steudle has his name all over San Francisco in popular food publications and has become a favorite in the city. We’d love a second chance to make a great impression!

review.title: Over Rated
review.reviewText: Hotel Staff is to slow to respond to guest request.
review.positiveRemarks: I think the hotel is over rated.
review.negativeRemarks: Improve the staffs ability to respond to guest request.
review.locationRemarks: The area has to many homeless people outside. Hotel restaurant is not good.

managementResponses.response: Hello Tami, If there are two things that every morning requires, it would be a hot shower and coffee, and we’re sincerely sorry that the hot water was faulty in you. Please know we’ve looked into this issue. We’re glad to hear you found other reasons to enjoy your stay though. Comfortable beds and a prime location are just a couple of ways we strive to give our guests the best. Wine tasting is another one, and we’d love to have you enjoy it if you stay you with you again.

review.title: My rating would be a lot higher, but....
review.reviewText:
The Serrano is a nice little boutique hotel. Although I didn't have time, the complimentary wine in the evening was a nice touch. 
I only have one complaint, but it's kind of a biggie. When I went to take my shower in the morning, there was no hot water - in the shower only. Normal hot water in the sink. When I went to check out, I told the person (not sure of job title) about the shower, and he took all of the information down. He only asked me one additional question-did I use anything from the mini bar. 
I really thought I would hear immediately from management with an offer of substantially reduced rate, comp, something, but unfortunately heard nothing. 
I'm not angry, but am disappointed. Doubt I would stay there again for that reason.
review.negativeRemarks:
The mini bar (which I didn't use) was so stocked that I had a little difficulty getting things of my own in it.
Response to complaints.
review.locationRemarks: Very centrally located to wonderful restaurants, shops. Easy walking district to theatre district. I was able to walk to the ballet at Yerba Buena.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
We’re truly disappointed to hear that your visit was not up to par. As you've noticed, we were in the midst of a major elevator renovation, and we’re very excited to announce that it’s finished. This was just the first step in our ongoing renovations because we truly do care about keeping Serrano picture perfect! We'd love to have the chance to welcome you again so we can win you over!

review.title: It looks a lot better on pictures!
review.reviewText: The hotel has seen its better days.  The pictures online look a lot better than the actual experience.  Wouldn't recommend it.  NO way a 4-Star hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel is in desperate need of an upgrade: Main Entrance door, elevators, lobby, etc..

managementResponses.response:
Hello Elizabeth, 
At Serrano, we believe our guests should have round the clock service, and we love knowing a member of our night-shift team offered you great service. We’re passing your kind words along! Guest safety is very important to us, and we’re always on hand to help you find transportation options, day or night, to make sure you arrive safely to any of your SF destinations. And if you’re in the mood for Union Square, it’s just steps away!

review.reviewText: The staff where excellent specially the receptionist that worked the grave yard shift on  Sat 4/23  4/24 Sun at 3am she was wonderful. The only thing that I did not like is that there is no parking for the hotel and the location of the hotel, at night it was so scary trash out side on the street in front of the hotel I literally felt like we where in the ghetto and going to San Francisco for the first time and planing a vacation there you expect it to be way better the SF city reminds me of down town L.a. but overall the hotel was pleasing friendly and clean it's just old.
review.positiveRemarks: The lobby the staff it was clean
review.negativeRemarks: It smells old location is bad at night it looks like it's in the ghetto

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
Serrano was completed in 1923 and was a part of the San Francisco resurgence after following the big earthquake of 1906. Many guests find our historic lobby and a décor are an endearing part of Serrano, but we understand this style isn’t for everyone. We’re also taking your comments seriously and are happy to share that we’re in the midst of ongoing renovations. (Our elevators were just completely remodeled!) Thank you for sharing your concerns about our location too. The Tenderloin District is part of the fabric of San Francisco and wonderful things are happening throughout the district— like new business, tech companies, parks and housing—but no matter what neighborhood we’re near, we strive to be an inviting presence in any surrounding. We’d love to have you change your mind and stay with us next time!

review.title: Checked in, but did not stay :(
review.reviewText: The hotel is dated and in dire need of updating. I understand it has a style, but dirty and dilapidated are not a style I want to stay in.  The location is less than desirable and felt unsafe.  We checked in, looked at the room and checked out within 20 minutes.  What a waste of Expedia points....
review.positiveRemarks: The desk staff were pleasant enough.
review.locationRemarks: Location is less than acceptable, felt unsafe.

Please know, we’re more than happy to make sure your connection is strong if you stay with us again. We’d love another chance to provide you with a stay you’ll love.

review.title: horrible internet

The rest of the hotel was fine but nonetheless the trip was a fiasco. Not exactly sure what additional content I could provide. This template is quite ridiculous

managementResponses.response:
Hello Maidee, 
You know, that’s the best idea we’ve heard in a while! We’d love for you to take that once-a-month getaway and stay with us when you do. If we weren’t already smiling during your stay, we certainly are now because your kind words have made our day! It was great to hear our lobby, location and big city views made your stay even better and we can't wait to welcome you again! Hurry back soon!

review.title: San Francisco city life
review.reviewText: The hotel is in the middle of everything in the city. This is a hotel that accommodates almost everything on a wish list of a hotel. It's San Francisco and if you want to experience it well I recommend this hotel. The rooms are comfortable ,nice, clean and the views are amazing. I stayed on the 17th level. Check in was easy and check out as well. Yes there is an urban fee of $25.00 but that's in every hotel you stay in really. The parking was easy if you don't park at the hotel there are garages structures around the Serrano hotel. The staff are all very nice and helpful everyone smiling. The lobby area is really nice decor. When I stayed there I forgot something I needed and there was a Walgreens really close by it was convinient for me. Overall I would definitely come back. I might just make it a once a month getaway just for the heck of it.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
Thanks for all the love! It was great to have you! We’re taking your recommendation about room service seriously. It’s important to us that we provide our guests with everything they could need (or want!) We’re thrilled our location made your stay even better and hope the next time you’re looking for a hotel that’s out of the ordinary, you’ll come back to Serrano. We’d love to welcome you again!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Loved the location, staff, character.  Only wished they had room service.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Meep, 
Interactions with people play an important part of any experience, and we’re sincerely sorry our front desk team didn’t offer the service our guests deserve. Please know we are bringing it to the attention of our team. We’re also sorry to hear our room size didn’t fit your needs. For future reference, we offer a variety of rooms and suites, like our Luxury Suites that feature a 510 square-feet layout with fantastic city views, a king bed, 2 flat-panel TVs and a queen sleeper sofa in separate sitting area. At Serrano we also feature quality Frette linens and robes, but we are taking your experience into careful consideration and checking to make sure any worn sheets are taken out of rotation. Our Urban Fee includes much more than the gym with great benefits like morning coffee and tea, all day flavored water in reception, morning newspaper, town car service Mon thru Fri mornings to the financial district, unlimited local calls and faxes, boarding pass printing, use of our bicycles, and free Wi-Fi. We apologize if you were not aware of the charges before your stay because we want our guests to be comfortable with our price point before they stay. Making a great impression is very important to us, and we’d like another chance to make a second impression you’d love.

review.title: You really don't get what you pay for.
review.reviewText: I literally wasted my Expedia points ($50 off worth) on this piece of crap hotel, and we still ended up paying $300 plus a $57 service resort fee for two nights. This hotel is gaudy, tacky and cheap looking. Our room (a standard queen) was the size of a CLOSET. It was literally the smallest room I have ever stayed in. The only furniture in the room was the queen bed, two small night stands and a giant wardrobe that took up most of the space aside from the bed. The sheets felt cheap and had some pilling which was disgusting to me. I can't stand sleeping in a hotel with overly washed cheap sheets. Don't waste your money staying here unless you're okay with paying a $57 service resort fee for a piece of crap gym that you're probably not even going to use, because that's what ended up happening to us. I have never felt so ripped off and disappointed at Expedia for marketing this hotel as 4 stars.
review.negativeRemarks: The front desk staff's attitude, the quality of sheets for the bed, ACCURATELY advertising the room conditions and sizing.
review.locationRemarks: It's kind of in a more shady neighborhood in SF. We saw lots of homeless people in front and around the hotel.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Diana, 
We’re happy to hear your stay was great, and we appreciate you letting us know your concerns with our Urban Fee. We’ve tried to make it easy to see our Urban Fee next to the booking rate, but we sincerely apologize if you weren’t’ expecting it. Guests usually prefer one fee rather than separate charges for the many amenities it offers. We’re also very sorry to hear our parking rates weren’t an expected price point. While our valet parking service is a great way to take the stress out of parking in the city, always know there are other nearby options, and we’d be happy to point them out to you the next time you stay. If there is anything we can do to make sure your next experience is one you’ll love, just say the word!

review.title: Downtown San francisco
review.reviewText: Stay was nice but there were a lot of extra charges. Parking was 59$ per night and they charge a 25$ per night urban fee for wifi and tea and coffee which i didn't even have any of.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
When it comes down to it, interactions with people play an important part of an experience. Our hotel team loves to treat our guests right because we have the best guests! We hope it’s not two years until your next visit—but whenever it is, we’re already looking forward to having you back!

review.title: Great historic hotel. great staff
review.reviewText: They remembered our names after 2 years. Very impressed.

managementResponses.response:
Hello mysecretavatar, 
With the many choices of where to stay in the city, we strive to stand out with our unique hotel lobby and dedicated service. We’re sorry to hear we didn’t impress and would welcome another chance to win you over. One trip to San Francisco is never enough, and we’d love to have you stay with us again!

review.title: Solid hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, though not special in any particular way.  For the price, it is what I expected.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Garfield, 
We’re very sorry to hear our parking disappointed you. Navigating parking in a new city can be difficult which is why we offer valet service, but our hotel team is more than happy to point you in the right direction of some more budget-friendly parking in the area. We want to meet our guests’ needs in any way we can!

review.title: the valet parking is extremely expensive
review.reviewText: The valet parking is extremely expensive. $66 per night. The parking fee is not clearly stated in the info, for 2 nights, we spend $705 including parking. Not worth it.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Doreen, 
You sound like the kind of person who knows a good thing when you see it, and we’re thrilled our location just that. At Serrano, we try to make everything easy—from paying to getting the service you deserve. We know that we have the best guests and want to thank you for being one of them. Whether it’s another conference, or just a getaway, we’d love to have you back!

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Reason for choosing this hotel as location. Had conference at the Hilton across the street but could not afford Hilton. Also Serrano allowed pay at hotel, which was very convenient. Friendly staff. Excellent bathroom facilities.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
We think a comfortable hotel room and delicious food are a great combination, and we’re glad you found them at Serrano and Jasper’s Corner Tap & Kitchen. It’s all the comforts of home—and maybe even better! We truly appreciate your feedback about our location. San Francisco is a diverse community, and Serrano is right at the heart of it. We’re thrilled about the exciting changes we’re seeing in the Tenderloin District—like new businesses, parks and housing bringing life back to the neighborhood. It just keeps getting better! We want guests to feel comfortable with our surroundings though—and how you feel is important. We’re also taking your comments about our décor seriously. It’s important to us to keep Serrano looking her best which is why we’re in the midst of beautiful renovations! Our hotel team would love to welcome you back, and we hope from the minute you walk into our lobby, you’ll be glad you did!

review.title: Hotel lobby and staff are both very nice
review.reviewText: The hotel lobby and staff are very nice and accommodating.  The hotel itself is a bit dated but comfortable.  The restaurant-Jasper's-adjacent to the hotel is nice with both a nice food and drink selection.  The hotel's issue is not directly related to it but is nonetheless an issue.  It sits just a block away from a homeless shelter which makes the general area a little uneasy.  Having traveled to many destinations we are not immune to local issues that you encounter upon arrival to a new city but due to the hotel's proximity to the shelter we never felt entirely comfortable walking around the immediate area.
review.negativeRemarks: décor, bathroom
review.locationRemarks: buses and cable cars are a short distance away

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
Comfortable beds, check. Great shower, check. We’re biased, but we think those are the best parts of a hotel stay! We’re thrilled to hear you enjoyed your time with us, and the next time you’re looking for a room in the heart of San Francisco-- you know right where we are! We’d love to have you back!

review.title: Nice hotel in the middle of the city
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel with comfortable beds and a shower with great water pressure.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Rob, 
If we could give our guests stars—you would have 5! Thanks for staying with us; we’re happy to hear you loved your stay. We think the best compliment is when a guest recommends us, and we hope it means you’ll take your own recommendation and hurry back for another stay!

review.reviewText: Very nice place.  Room was small but clean and well furnished.  Would definitely recommend it.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
The mini-bar is definitely a perk, and we’re very sorry you didn’t get to use it. In the future, our hotel team will gladly provide you with a key—just say the word! We’re taking your feedback about the luggage space seriously because we want guests to feel at home during their stay. One of our luxury suites might be perfect for you. With a separate sitting area, you have all the space you need!

review.title: No wardrobes
review.reviewText:
Room does not have any bench/ stand for keeping bags on. 
Nor does it have a wardrobe.
Minibar was locked up with no key.
The carpets need a change over

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
Having a great vibe with the place you stay is important, and we’re thrilled to hear our San Francisco charm won you over. Our team loves to help our guests—but our favorite job is welcoming them back. We hope to welcome you back too!

review.reviewText: The hotel is very clean. It's got a great old San Francisco vibe.Staff is very accommodating.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Cait,
Knowing that our guests are well taken care of is the most important part of Serrano, and we’re sharing your concerns with our hotel team. (We love to help guests before and after their stay, and are taking this feedback seriously!) We’re sorry to hear that our Urban Fee wasn’t expected. There are many great benefits like morning coffee and tea, all day flavored water in reception, morning newspaper, town car service Mon thru Fri mornings to the financial district, unlimited local calls and faxes, boarding pass printing, use of our bicycles, and free Wi-Fi, and we hope you could take advantage of several during your stay! We’re also passing your feedback about the bathroom on to our housekeeping team because you should count on spotlessly clean rooms every time you stay. Comfortable beds (with Frette bedding!) is a Serrano Hotel trademark, and we’re thrilled you enjoyed them. We’re also happy to hear our lobby, which stays true to our original Art Deco architecture, caught your eye. We’d love to hear from you directly so we can personally help with any of your concerns—but mostly, we’d love to have you stay with us again when you’re ready to see more of San Francisco!

review.title: Good location central to everything we needed
review.reviewText:
We stayed at Serrano Hotel for three nights prior to a conference in San Jose, to give us a chance to explore everything San Francisco had to offer. Hotel was conveniently located within walking distance of great restaurants and Union Square. 

PROs: centrally located, relatively affordable. Comfortable beds.

CONs: our room was not as clean as it should have been from the outset; elevator was being renovated and therefore it was very slow to get down in the morning; what was disclosed to us as "free wifi and coffee" in reality amounted to a $25/night "resort fee" which we in no way signed off on but were billed (I realize that this is disclosed on their Expedia page however the staff in no way acknowledged or referred to it until they handed us a bill at the end - attempts to follow up with the hotel staff were ignored).
review.positiveRemarks: The lobby decor was lovely and classic
review.negativeRemarks: Room cleanliness - there were noticeable dirty footprints on our bathroom wall!
review.locationRemarks: Union Square for great shopping; awesome crepes up the hill; amazing Mexican around the corner (we may have had food on our minds a lot this trip!)

managementResponses.response:
Hello Sheila, 
We totally understand not being in your room very much during your trip to San Francisco; there is so much to see and do in the city! It sounds like you had a great time exploring downtown, and we’re glad our location put you at the heart of it all. We’re also thrilled to know that the time you did spend with us was filled with helpful service! Coffee and tea service in the morning is just one way we want to thank our guests for staying with us. We’re listening to your feedback about our water temperature. There’s nothing better than a hot shower to get your day started, and we want the water to be just right. Hearing that you would “definitely go there again” has made our day, and we sincerely hope you will!

review.title: Great hotel, very convenient location
review.reviewText: We checked on Saturday afternoon, the room was clean and comfortable.  A lot of character.  Bathroom was small but clean and efficient although the water temperature in the shower was hard to get just right.  The staff was very helpful and friendly.  Coffee service in the lobby in the mornings was great.  A couple of times they ran out of coffee or cream but as soon as they were told it was empty they came within a few minutes to replenish.  We weren't in our room a lot so we didn't want to spend a fortune so it all that we needed.  I would definitely go there again.  The front desk staff were very helpful every time we asked them something.
review.positiveRemarks: This hotel was in a great location.  There were a few homeless people around but they never bothered you.  It was clean and comfortable
review.locationRemarks: The location was downtown, apparently steps away from Union Square.  It all seemed to be one area to me.  You could walk all over downtown

managementResponses.response:
Hello Sam, 
We want our guests to “sleep like a baby” when they stay with us, and we’re happy to hear the bed was just right. (We’re taking your feedback about the pillows into careful consideration though.) We’re also listening to your thoughts about the bathroom size. As a boutique hotel, we have several types of rooms and sizes, and we think one of our larger spaces will have a bathroom you’ll love! Thanks for choosing Serrano; we love being a smaller hotel and being able to take great care of our wonderful guests. We’re glad you found us and would love to have you back! We’ve got the welcome mat out!

review.title: Decent hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is a very old building with updated rooms. That being said, the rooms are a smaller size and the bathroom is very tiny with little room for your belongings. The location is convenient. Bed was comfy, pillows were not. We were satisfied with our choice and wouldn't change it for a larger chain hotel. We were able to walk to quite a few tourist destinations from here and the rest of them we ubered too for very cheap.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
At Serrano we want guests to be comfortable in every room, and we sincerely apologize your room was smaller than you expected. We’d love to help you stay in of our larger rooms if you come again! Your feedback about our room updates is important to us too, and we're happy to share that we're in the midst of ongoing improvements. Keeping Serrano looking its best is a priority because we want our guests to love their rooms and have a 5-star stay!

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: The room was far smaller and more warn than in the pictures provided.  The room seemed to barely fit the two full size beds in it.  My wife felt claustrophobic.  While the room appeared cleaned, because it also appeared old, you felt it was very used.  Paint and new interior would be good.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Mark, 
If you were trying to make our day, you definitely did! Thank you for all the kind words about Serrano and Jasper’s! Our goal is to be more than a hotel and a restaurant—to be a place where guests are treated like family and feel at home! We’d love to welcome you back for work or pleasure the next time you’re in town!

review.title: Nice Location - Wonderful Staff!
review.reviewText:
In town for a conference - The Serrano was a perfect choice for location.  The staff was wonderful and went out of their way to assist me, as I was traveling with heavy book boxes.  Rooms are clean and comfortable - a little small as to be expected for a downtown boutique hotel, but big enough.  Also, the Jasper's restaurant was inviting and had intriguingly fun menu selections.  The staff at Jasper's was also wonderful, took care of me and I felt like a regular!
Definitely a good choice for a good price!

managementResponses.response:
Hello Steve, 
Coffee and great showers make it to the top of our list too, and we’re glad we could offer that extra boost to get your day going. Thanks for sharing your thoughts about the lobby fragrance. While that’s not usually the case, we’re looking into it because we want our lobby to be a welcoming place. We’re sincerely sorry about the elevator wait. When it’s finished it will be well worth it! Your patience and willingness to be flexible with the elevator situation means a lot! We’d love to have you back soon to see the beautiful remodel!

review.title: Nice hotel in the heart of the city
review.reviewText:
Nice boutique hotel near Union Square.  Also close to a shady area known as Tenderloin.  There are dozens of other boutique hotels within a few sq/miles.  It's a very touristy area which is great if you plan to walk to get around.

Unfortunately, one of the 2 main elevators was undergoing maintenance during our 5 day stay so we had to use the staff elevator.  It didn't really make the waits much longer but I noticed a long wait during the morning hours as people had difficulty checking out.
review.positiveRemarks:
rooms were very clean.  Showers have great water pressure.
Free coffee every morning.
review.negativeRemarks: Their lobby had a strong perfume scent that was a bit overwhelming.
review.locationRemarks: lots of restaurants and shopping nearby

managementResponses.response:
Hello DG, 
Interactions with people play an important part of any experience, and we’re glad that our hotel team made you feel welcome! Guest experiences are important to us which is why we are taking your feedback about our location seriously. Being at the heart of a diverse city, we see people from every walk of life, but we’re sincerely sorry if anyone made you feel uncomfortable. Guest safety is very important to us! We’d love the chance to win you over with a stay that won’t let you down.

review.title: Ok hotel but not 4 star as advertised
review.reviewText: This was a pleasant enough hotel but was advertised on Expedia as 4 star. This is a long way off 4 star, a push for 3 star to be honest. If your thinking of staying here it's very close to the Tenderloin district which is full of homeless people who are in the streets heading to and from the hotel. The staff are great but location and amenities let this place down!

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
Thank you for the compliment about John our doorman. You’re right; he’s one of our best, and we’ll be sure to pass along your kind words! We apologize that not having an in-room refrigerator was a disappointing part of your stay, and we’re taking your comments into careful consideration. One of our favorite parts of being a boutique hotel is the variety of rooms and suites we offer. It sounds like one of our suites could be just what you have in mind, and we’d be happy to help you with that if you stay with us again. We appreciate your feedback about our restaurant as well. We’re listening to your comments about our price point because we want our guests to love it here as much as we do!

review.title: Just on the cusp of nice.
review.reviewText: The hotel is too expensive for what it offers. Tiny rooms, no room service and a lack of refrigerator in the room made it frustrating. But the biggest let down is Jaspers, its attached restaurant. If you want a quick bite or drink it will cost no less than $15 for a glass of wine and a breakfast for two ran $50 easy.
review.positiveRemarks: John, the doorman, was very friendly.
review.locationRemarks: Blocks from Union Square.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Randy, 
We take guest feedback seriously and are looking into your concerns about our hotel team. We believe guests should be given only the best service 100% of the time, and we apologize for falling short of that. We’re also sorry to hear our hotel disappointed. You're right; we are a historic hotel, completed in 1923, and a San Francisco landmark. We’re always working at keeping Serrano beautiful, which is why we’re in the midst of ongoing improvements. We want Serrano to be even better in person! We find that guests usually prefer one fee, rather than individual charges for great benefits like Wi-Fi, town car service, coffee and tea service (and more!) but we’re truly sorry if you weren’t aware of the Urban Fee. If there is anything we can do to win you back, we’d love to!

review.title: Wasn't as advertised
review.reviewText: Older hotel. Needs to be remodeled and ditch all the fees they tack on. In the pictures the hotel looks beautiful. When you get there that is not the case. Rooms are outdated and need some work. Also staff was friendly at times and other times difficult to deal with. I would say skip it.

managementResponses.response:
Hello,
At Serrano, we love our guests! It’s the reason that welcoming them from the moment they walk through our doors, and taking care of them during their stay, is our favorite part of the job!

review.reviewText: Staff showed their sense of of welcome more than I expected.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Shannon, 
When there are extra perks (like a hot tub and workout room) guests should be the first to know, and we’re sincerely sorry we didn’t give you a better lay of the land. You should hear about all of our amenities at check-in! By the sound of it, your time in San Francisco was full, and we hope that means it was full of wonderful memories that bring you back to the city for more!

review.reviewText: Room is tiny. Hardly enough room for two people to walk in room at the same time. Bathroom is tiny as well. Everything very clean though, staff friendly. Was charged for Internet and amenities such as hot tub and exercise room that I didn't know was there and didn't have time to use anyway.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
Even though you traveled for business, we hope you found extra time to get out and enjoy San Francisco. Having a comfortable bed is the best way to start a day out right, and we hope it gave you the energy you needed for a successful day of work. Thanks for sharing your thoughts about our Urban Fee. It can be hard to navigate online searches when you are comparing a variety of hotels and prices, but for your future reference our Urban Fee can be found next to the nightly rate. We’re sincerely sorry if you weren’t expecting the charge, but hope you found some of the benefits it covered made your stay even better!

review.title: business hotel
review.reviewText: not bad for advertised price but they tacked on $25 per day for "amenities" which they said was for internet and gym. nothing special beyond price.
review.positiveRemarks: nice bed, good locations, secure, efficient check in
review.negativeRemarks: transparent pricing, should disclose the "amenity fee" when booking in prepay service like hotels.com

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
Treating guests right is the most important part of our job, and we’re sincerely sorry we failed to make a good impression. You’re completely right; requests should be met in a timely manner, and we’re looking into the issue with our hotel team and making sure everyone at Serrano—from housekeeping to the front desk, is sure to offer the best service to our guests. Thanks for your kind words about Jasper’s. We’re passing on the compliment! Knowing that a guest loved their meal & service is a true boost for their team, and we’re thrilled to know you loved the restaurant as much as we do! If there is anything we can do to win you back, we’d love another chance to show you what Serrano is really about.

review.title: Lacking Customer Service
review.reviewText: The hotel itself is ok. The room was a bit small and could use some minor repairs. On the last day of our stay we noticed the distinct odor of cigarettes in the bathroom which we discovered was coming from the air conditioning vent. The service of staff was was deplorable. They were rude, unhelpful, and seemed annoyed if they were approached with a question or request. The group I travel with feel that it is unnecessary to have the room serviced on a daily basis and only request items such as towels or soap on an as needed basis. One day before heading out, my friend called the desk to request toilet tissue and towels. Unfortunately, she sat around and waited for 45 minutes for these items, which were never delivered, before finally deciding the leave the room to make it to a tour on time. Things such as this leave an impression. While the hotel was lacking in quality service, the restaurant exceeded our expectations. The food, drinks, and service were all great and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Although this hotel served its purpose, I wouldn't recommend it to friends or family, nor would I ever return.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
Location counts for a lot, and we’re glad to hear that ours put San Francisco’s best at your fingertips. We’re taking your feedback about our furniture into careful consideration as we’re always in the midst of improvements because we want to be sure and keep Serrano looking its best. We’d love another chance to make Serrano your San Francisco go-to!

review.title: Good location, OK hotel
review.reviewText: By no means would this be the best hotel I've ever stayed at, but given its price and location is acceptable.  I would likely not stay here again though.
review.negativeRemarks: Quality of room furniture and general facilities
review.locationRemarks: It is downtown San Francisco, so essentially everything is close or easily accessible.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
We love to see guests smile the moment they walk through the doors, and we’re happy our lobby caught your eye. We agree that our San Francisco history is one of our best features. Thanks for letting us know about the sound factor in your room. There’s nothing better than peace and quiet, and that’s exactly what we think all of our guests should have!

review.title: Good value hotel for SoMa
review.reviewText: This hotel has a beautiful lobby which may or may not compensate for the small, thin-walled bedrooms.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
We love hearing when guests find our location helps them get the most out of the city. In the heart of San Francisco, you don’t have to look (or travel!) far for a great time. It sounds like you have a busy schedule, but we hope you find the time in it for another visit to San Francisco!

review.title: Very good location. Nice personnel.
review.reviewText: Uneventful. I think this are the best. I don't have time to write more

managementResponses.response:
Hello J.,
Please know we are taking your feedback seriously and are sincerely sorry for your experience. We completely agree that you should have had a warm welcome as soon as you walked through our doors, and we apologize our valet service was not offered. We’re looking into the issue with our front desk team and taking your concerns to housekeeping immediately. A beautifully clean room should welcome every guest which is why housekeeping is a high priority at our hotel. We’d love the chance to win you over with a true Serrano experience, and if there is anything we can do to help make this right, we will!

review.title: NO WORDS, JUST READ!`
review.reviewText: Where do I start? Well let me tell you how things played out since I got there: First, there was nobody at the main door to greet us and or welcome us! Valet wasn't even offered and to be honest I don't even know if they offer...so we went to the public parking next door and paid $45 a night....after walking back to the hotel with our bags in hand. The Lobby area is Great here there's a lot to see for sure :) . the Lobby is really something else and I mean that in a good way. BUT, THERE IS THIS HMMMM CLOUD OF SOMETHING THAT LINGERS IN THE AIR. the air in this hotel is thick and it almost smells like my grandmas OLD HOUSE. checking in was easy, but the guy at the desk needs help with his people skills I swear...okay so on to the room, okay so this hotel is old and don't forget that. so the rooms were not the best nor did they feel the best. but they were clean and it sure seemed like they had tried really hard to have them clean....ill give them that. NOW HERE IS WHY I WOULD NEVER EVER STAY HERE AGAIN NOR RECOMMED IT. after walking in into our rooms and putting our bags down. I walk into the restroom, and to my freaking surprise!!! somebody freaking forgot to flush the freaking toilet before me!! like what the hell?! what happened to the hotel cleaning staff here???? the toilet had been used and left dirty, that right there killed this hotel for us.
review.negativeRemarks:
EVERYTHING! 

this hotel needs to be redone from the inside out! 
BUT, they might not have the $$$$
review.locationRemarks: great location for what I had planned.but no disrespect,I should've chosen the hotel right across the street from it - at least there I knew what...

managementResponses.response:
Hello Mary, 
Thanks for taking the time to tell us about your stay at Serrano! We’re happy to know that your clean and quiet room made the perfect spot to relax before your adventures out in the city. (Fisherman’s Wharf is one of our favorites!) Come back for wine hour, or come back for welcoming service— either way, we’d just love to see you come back!

review.title: Nice for an older hotel
review.reviewText: This is an old and smaller hotel but the staff was really nice and the room was clean.we we're upgraded to the king suite. The bed was very comfortable and the room was clean. We stayed in room 601 and the room is very quiet with no shared walls in the bedroom area. There is no view at all but I would rather have quiet than a view. There is free wifi but if you drive in,plan on paying a pretty penny for parking. They have a wine and cheese hour at 5 o'clock that we never we're around for so I can't tell you if that was good or not. There is ple t of public transportation right in front of the hotel but we mostly walked everywhere.  About a half hour walk to fisherman's wharf. Of course it is San Francisco so you will see your fair share of homeless people.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Sarah, 
It sounds like you had a great weekend celebrating your husband’s birthday. (Wish him a belated Happy Birthday from us!) You’re right; the mini-bar is a great extra, and we’re sincerely sorry we didn’t get the key to you at check-in. Always know, we’re more than happy to provide it if you ask. Thanks for your feedback about the valet and Urban Fees. While we want to take the stress out of parking, our team will gladly point out other parking options. We think parking your car should be the last thing on your mind when you’re ready to enjoy a vacation. We strive to keep our price point at a great San Francisco rate, but we’re sorry if there were any costs you didn’t expect. The last thing we want for our guests is to be disappointed. Your words, “loved staying here” have made our day, and we hope it means you’ll stay with us again!

review.title: Great place, but a lot of hidden fees!
review.reviewText: Loved staying here, great clean and comfortable hotel. Staff lacked too offer us the mini bar key and when you look at the price of your room on Expedia i would add about another $100 to that to include their taxes and extra fees. I have never had a hotel cost that much extra. Was not happy about that surprise! You read about their $25 resort fee but there was a lot more added to it not mentioned that we didn't bargain for! Also it's nice to have a valet but $80?? C'mon! I'd say $50 maybe but the prices are just ridiculous. Jasper's next door had great breakfast and staff was nice but I think it's overpriced for the size room and everything your getting esp when your not getting offered all they had like the mini bar we could've used while celebrating my birthday weekend with my husband.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Lora, 
Options in a big city are always a good thing, and we’re sorry not having room service was a disappointing part of your stay. It’s something we’ll keep in mind as we continue to make Serrano a great fit for our guests. We’re also sorry your room felt cramped. It sounds like the deluxe queen room with an in-room work space might be just what you’re looking for, and we’d be happy to help you with that next time. Our Urban Fee covers all the extras (like Wi-Fi) because we find guests prefer one fee rather than individual charges. We hope you’ll be able to take advantage of the many amenities it covers if you stay with us again. Thanks for your kind words about our hotel décor, we’re always thrilled to impress! If there is anything we can do to be “better than you expected,” we'd love to help!

review.title: Not what I expected
review.reviewText: The room was small.  For thr money i paid I would expect somewhere to sit besides the bed.  Just a room big enough for a bed and bathroom.  Felt cramped and it was just me.  Also no room service. Sometime you dont like going to the restaurant, need more options to eat.  But the hotel itself was beautiful and nice to look at. Still charged for use of internet and other fees and never was given password for internet or other imentities the hotel offered never used.  Shouldn't be charged for stuff like that.  I'll do Holiday Inn next time.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Ron, 
We think interactions with people are an important part of any experience, and we’re thrilled to hear you felt welcomed by our friendly hotel team. Steps from Union Square, many guests tell us our location is a highlight, but we’re sorry to hear the neighboring surroundings caused you to feel uncomfortable. San Francisco is a diverse community, and Serrano is right at the heart of our amazing city. We’d love to do anything we can to put you at ease during your time with us in the future!

review.title: Nice but beware of close neighborhoods
review.reviewText: Very nice, affordable hotel with friendly staff.  Be careful when walking which way you go as the hotel is on the edge of the tenderloin district where there are incredible numbers of homeless living on the streets.  No problm for me, but my wife was not comfortable.  Eay to avoid, but you should be aware before booking here.
review.negativeRemarks: Move the hotel (SIC)
review.locationRemarks: Lots to do nearby, theater, eating, bars, etc.  Just beware of tenderloin district.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Designer, 
Knowing you’ve stayed with us for 10 years means a lot, and we sincerely enjoy having you stay! Knowing how our guests feel about Serrano is very important to us, and we’re taking your comments seriously. Currently, we’re in the midst of ongoing renovations and just finished completely remodeling both elevators. There is only much more to come, and we’d love it if you stayed with us again so you can how we keep getting better!

review.title: Central for my needs
review.reviewText: I've been staying at the Serrano for 10 years. I'm considering other hotels around the corner since it's no longer a kempton group facility. It's not the same and time to update the rooms and clean it up!!!

managementResponses.response:
Hello SD, 
Thank you for staying with us! We love hearing back from our guests and are taking your comments seriously. We want to keep Serrano Hotel at its best too which is why we’ve recently completely remodeled our elevators and have ongoing renovations underway. Whether you come back for business or pleasure, we look forward to showing you that Serrano keeps getting better!

review.title: Nice location (by Union Square) but Mediocre Rooms
review.reviewText:
This hotel is very conveniently located just off O'Farrell by Union Square, however, the accomdations are very mediocre. The room (Standard Queen) is very small - tough for a multi-night stay. 

The front desk staff was very nice and accommodating, but the facilities are just a bit outdated. The room needs renovation. 

With a some new touches (paint touch ups, new shower curtains, new bedding, etc.), this place could be a nice hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The front desk staff was excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: Feels very outdated. Needs new paint, etc - basically a complete makeover. It feels like the 1970s (but not in a chic way).
review.locationRemarks: The location is perfect for business. Very limited in terms of food. Scala is a great restaurant around Union Square.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
We love being in a place where the best of the city is just outside, and a quiet relaxing stay is guaranteed on the inside, and we’re thrilled to hear our location was perfect for seeing the New Year’s parade. (It’s one of our favorite San Francisco events!) Thank you for the 5-star review! We’d love to have you stay with us again for next year’s parade—or any other time of the year!

review.title: Chinese New Year
review.reviewText: Great location to stay, very close to great  restaurants for after new year  parade and for  breakfast the next morning.  Awesome room.
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown and union square

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
One of our favorite parts of being a boutique hotel is that we are smaller and can interact with our guests, providing a more personal experience. From your clean room (and soft pillows) to our location in San Francisco, you’ve made our day knowing you enjoyed your time here. We’d love to have you back anytime!

review.reviewText: Nice location....clean rooms, loved their pillows..... unique quaint.....
review.locationRemarks: excellent location

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
Your 5-star review just made our day! Being in such a wonderful city, the bar is already raised high for a great experience and knowing Serrano made yours even better means a lot. You’re right; our location is perfect for exploring the city, we’re just sorry to hear of any trouble with parking. Always know that we do offer valet parking if you’d rather leave the effort to us. Then we can leave nothing but enjoying San Francisco up to you.

review.reviewText: I totally enjoyed my stay. Nice hotel, nice staff, very good location, reasonably priced.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice room - very clean, big. Also, I enjoyed 24/7 health club. Wireless was working well.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking by Union square is difficult to find. May be the hotel can have some allotted parking spots close by.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location close to everything, especially if you do not have a car!

managementResponses.response:
Hello joyce, 
At Serrano, we strive to take great care of our guests, and we’re thrilled our service made you feel welcomed. We understand that every guest is unique, and so are their needs when it comes to space which is why we are glad to have a variety of rooms and suites to offer. The next time you stay, we’d love to help you find just the room you are looking for!

review.title: Our room was very small
review.reviewText: Clean and the staff great!  Just wish the rooms were larger!

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
We’re passing your kind words on to Jon our bellman. You’re right; he’s one of Serrano’s best! Knowing you felt welcomed every time you came through our doors is exactly the news we want to hear, and we’d love to have you back through them for another stay. Having guests return as friends is one of the best parts of our job!

review.reviewText: The bellman John is awesome.  Gave our stay at the hotel a great feel.  We were there for 5 days.  He welcomed us every time we came through the door.  Whatever we needed, he made sure we got it.  Fun place.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
At Serrano, we want to be even better than our guests expect, and we’re sincerely sorry we didn’t make a better impression. We’re in the midst of ongoing renovations and continuing to keep Serrano at its best if very important to us. (Our elevators have just been completely remodeled.) We’d love to have you stay with us again where you can get the best of both worlds: historic charm & modern amenities!

review.reviewText: Hotel wasn't all what I expected it to be. Fairly outdated..... :(

managementResponses.response:
Hello Fiona, 
Many guests agree that our historic charm is part of what sets us out from the crowd, and we’re happy to hear you thought so too. At Serrano, we think a good night sleep is the best way to be ready for a day out in San Francisco, and we’re sorry to hear the mattress wasn’t what you were used to. We’re taking that feedback seriously because we’d love to have you stay with us again. We’ll do our best to make sure you’re in the room with the softest bed!

review.title: It's near to the Union Square,
review.reviewText: The room is small and the bed is not comfortable. But the hotel decoration is nice. Overall I recommend this hotel.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Clare, 
“Will return!” is our favorite part of your review! We’re glad that you loved the views from your upgraded room and our location close to Union Square and Chinatown. (Both great places to visit during your time in San Francisco!) We’re taking your concerns about housekeeping seriously because as a four-star hotel keeping our rooms pristine is very important to us. We look forward to having you again—in a room you’ll love.

review.title: Will Return!
review.reviewText: The original room my boyfriend and I were planning to stay in the card keys didn't work which was on the 11th floor. Explaining to the hotel clerk  the situation he kindly apologized and upgraded us to the 16th floor which had an amazing view without extra charge.  However, there were a few things in the room that grossed us out. There were few long hairs on the tub and little hairs on the wallpaper. Not only that but there were a few areas where the wallpaper was  peeling. Overall, it was a pleasant stay
review.positiveRemarks: Breathtaking view of the city, comfortable bed
review.negativeRemarks: repaint walls, extra time cleaning the room especially the bathroom
review.locationRemarks: Conveniently located across a parking garage. Few blocks from Union Square and China Town.

managementResponses.response:
Hello N, 
You’re right; a stay at Serrano should come with dedicated service, and we sincerely apologize this was not your experience. We are known for taking care of our guests which is why we are taking this issue seriously. Thank you for your feedback about our historic building. We strive to provide modern amenities while staying true to the original décor, and we’re glad you liked it! If you’re in San Francisco again we’d love to win you over with a stay, where from the front desk to the bellmen, you have all the help you need.

review.title: OK but bad neighbourhood
review.reviewText:
The hotel itself is charming as it is an early 18th century bldg. and has been fairly well maintained. The staff are friendly but grossly understaffed. I called the front desk twice during my stay and neither time did they answer the phone at all. It took me 15 min to wait for a bell captain to come back from his break so I could leave my bags at the hotel for the day.

This hotel is located in the "Tenderloin". I'm a native of SF so this did not bother me much. ( and I was just staying for one night) But crack heads wondering around the street outside your hotel at night waiting for the homeless kitchen to open up (it is half a block from the hotel) may not give you the San Francisco experience your hoping for.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff responsiveness.
review.locationRemarks: Bad neighbourhood. Not safe at night.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
Our lobby has its original Art Deco charm, and we’re thrilled it caught your eye. We want guests to love their hotel rooms just as much, and we’re listening to your feedback about the room size. For future reference, we have a variety of rooms and suites and we’d love to help you find just the right one the next time you stay. Thank you for your feedback about Jasper’s. We are sharing your concerns with the team, so we can all work towards providing both a hotel and dining experience you’ll love.

review.title: Amazing Lobby but terrible restaurant
review.reviewText: The room is very small and the restaurant is terrible. Infrastructure of a very nice 3 stars hotel and price of a 4 stars one.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
We believe guests should have the best at Serrano, and it starts at the front desk and having friendly and welcoming service. Thank you for being our guest— we’d love to have you stay with us again!

review.reviewText: Good location.  Staff at the front desk was very nice and helpful.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
On behalf of Serrano, thank you! We always appreciate knowing our location and hotel team made your stay with us exceptional. We loved having both you and your dad stay here! Thank you for the valuable feedback about Jasper’s. Knowing what we can do to improve our guests’ experience is very important, and we’re looking into this issue immediately. Our guests should have wonderful service and food when they visit Jasper’s, and we’d love to have you try Jasper’s again to find both!

review.title: Jaspers Feedback
review.reviewText:
The hotel itself was great! All the staff was very accommodating and friendly except for at Jasper's. We went there for cocktails on Saturday night  and ordered a drink for my father, a double absolute on the rocks with a splash of cranberry. It came back as an absolute and cranberry. The server thought we were unsatisfied because the drink wasn't filled to the rim when it actually shouldn't have been as full as it was.  So he put a few more ice cubes in and thought we wouldn't notice? The next morning, we went down to have breakfast there. We were seated and 15 minutes later, no one had even come up to see if we wanted coffee or anything to drink. When we flagged the only man that was working at that time down, he said "we are busy, if you don't want to wait for service, I would suggest you go somewhere else"...? Ok... so we did. 

The overall experience was great, but the service at Jasper's is terrible.
review.positiveRemarks: Cute boutique Hotel. Great location, easy access to Union Square without being directly in the mix
review.negativeRemarks: Mattresses are a bit too firm and again, service at Jaspers
review.locationRemarks: Farralon, my favorite restaurant of all time!

managementResponses.response:
Hello Michael, 
We’re really sorry to hear this was your experience. Please know, customer service is very important to us, and we’re looking into this concern immediately. We’d love the chance to make this right and welcome you to reach out to us personally so we can help. Making sure our guests are treated right is the most important part of our job!

review.reviewText: Terrible front desk staff. Never got anything right and none of them knew what the others were doing.

managementResponses.response:
Hello omar: avila, 
At Serrano, we truly enjoy having each guest, and we’re sincerely sorry if you weren’t treated with the best hospitality. Rest assured, we’re looking into this issue because dedicated service is a must at our hotel. Parking in the city can be difficult, and our hotel team is always glad to help point out some of the best parking options. The next time you stay, we want our location to be just one of the things you’ll love about your stay at Serrano!

review.title: Nearest Parking is very expensive
review.reviewText: Is a good location but the staff is not very friendly

managementResponses.response:
Hello Fintan, 
Guests often share that our location is a highlight, and we’re glad it was one for you too! When you visit San Francisco, there’s nothing better than being able to easily get around the city. We’re sincerely sorry if you weren’t aware of our Urban Fee. It covers so much more than Wi-Fi and has many benefits like morning coffee and tea, all day flavored water in reception, morning newspaper, town car service Mon thru Fri mornings to the financial district, unlimited local calls and faxes, boarding pass printing and use of our bicycles. It sounds like you quickly found your way around our hotel, and if you ever need more directions, our hotel concierge would be more than happy to help!

review.title: Nice Hotel,
review.reviewText: Nice Hotel, bathrooms a bit old fashioned but clean and comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: Good position, close to Union Square. Friendly helpful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Charging $22 per night for wifi was a bit much. Most hotels offer it for free.
review.locationRemarks: Good location, although best to turn left out of the hotel rather than right. Taylor St can be a bit dodgy at night

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
We’re glad to hear our décor caught your eye. It’s part of our historic past which we’re proud to embrace, while making sure we provide our guests with all the modern amenities. Being friendly with our guests is one of the best parts of the jobs, and we’re thrilled you felt welcomed. Thank you for your feedback about the water bottles. We’re listening because we want our guests to have everything they need!

review.title: A great example of a themed SF hotel.
review.reviewText: This place is a great little spot.  It was as expected, small, well appointed and friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: A couple of complementary bottles of water in the room wouldn't go a miss.

managementResponses.response:

We’re always working to make Serrano even better, and we take all guest feedback into careful consideration as we do!

review.title: Good location and room for the price
review.reviewText: No complaints. Location was good and service was great. Room was average.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
We’re very sorry to hear Serrano didn’t win you over because we want all of our guests to find many reasons to love their stay! Making sure our guests have everything they need is important to us which is what our fee covers— great benefits like coffee and tea service in our lobby, morning newspaper, town car service Mon thru Fri mornings to the financial district, unlimited local calls and faxes, boarding pass printing, use of our bicycles, and free Wi-Fi, but we’re sorry if these services didn’t come in handy during your stay. We’re also listening to your feedback about our cable service. When you’re looking to relax, finding a show that interests you is always a plus! Thanks for being our guest; we’d love to have you back for a stay that is way above average!

review.title: Just a Hotel
review.reviewText:
The Hotel has some services Charged that you must probably  do not use, do not need or like the bicycles were mostly not availables...
The neighbour is ok, next to most things, and the clean was ok. 
You are not going to miss anything if you choose another one.....
review.negativeRemarks: many things, the breakfast, the additional servicies charged and the TV cable.....

managementResponses.response:
