review.title: Rudest customer service I've experience
review.reviewText: Overall the hotel is nice but the staff, especially the front check in person ruined the experience.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
We love being at a price point that makes even a great hotel affordable, and we’re so glad you were our guest! Making sure our guests feel comfortable during their stay is very important to us, and we appreciate your feedback. While guests often share our heart-of-the-city location is one of our best features, we understand that there are people from every walk of life in the area, and we sincerely apologize if you felt uncomfortable. Guests are the most important part of Serrano, and we’d love to have you again so we can show it!

review.reviewText: Great place for the price. Area is kinda bad but close to everything. Clean and nice

managementResponses.response:
Hello DeeDee, 
Knowing our guests like our hotel is great, but knowing they enjoyed a wonderful night’s sleep is even better. We’re very sorry to hear the street noise and doors kept you up. We strive to make sure our guests have nothing but peace and quiet, and we’re looking into the issue of door noises. Thank you for your feedback about our Urban Fee as well. At Serrano, we think our guests should have it all, which is what the Urban Fee covers. There are great benefits like--, like morning coffee and tea, all day flavored water in reception, morning newspaper, town car service Mon thru Fri mornings to the financial district, unlimited local calls and faxes, boarding pass printing, use of our bicycles, and free Wi-Fi. We hope the next time you stay the only thing that will catch you off guard is the quiet, restful room you were looking for. We’d be glad to put you on a higher floor where the San Francisco buzz is out of earshot.

review.title: The room doors slam closed and noise from street.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel but I'm a light sleeper so I didn't sleep well.  They do have a $22.00 hotel charge they don't collect till you check out and I'm not sure why but I wasent happy about that.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
At Serrano, we understand that animals are a part of the family (cats too!) which is why we gladly welcome them! We’re glad to know it makes your time here even better. In the city location counts for a lot, and we agree having options like shopping, dining and spas within walking distance counts for a lot! We hope you have plans to return soon because we’d love to see you and your kitty again.

review.title: Cat friendly, clean, comfortable, great location.
review.reviewText: I have stayed at this hotel several times and I am always pleased with my stay. They are one of the few hotels in S.F that allow cats.:)  The rooms are comfortable, clean, nicely decorated and have large windows. The staff is friendly and very polite. The hotel is located in a very convenient location. It is only about a five minute walk from Union Square.
review.positiveRemarks: Very polite and helpful staff. Cat friendly! I can have my cat with me whenever I stay here.
review.locationRemarks: Five minute walk from Union Square. Plenty of shopping, dining and spa/salons options nearby (all within walking distance).

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
From stars to compliments, you sure know how to make Serrano look good! Thank you for the kind words about our hotel; we were just as thrilled about having you as our guest!

review.title: Very pretty and staff very pleasant
review.reviewText: Pretty lobby, great restaurant, conveniently central, staff is very nice

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
Union Square is one of our San Francisco favorites, and we’re very happy to hear you enjoyed it! (It doesn’t hurt that it’s only a short walk away from our hotel either!) It’s easy to be friendly because we really love having each guests. We hope you’ll be one of them again!

review.reviewText: The hotel was in a good location, in easy walking distance to Union Square, surrounding area not too sketchy. Staff was friendly and courteous. Our room was smallish, but cute and clean.

managementResponses.response:
Hello John, 
We love to offer comfortable beds so our guests can be well-rested for their time in San Francisco! We also like to offer a location that makes exploring the city easy! Thank you for your feedback about our hotel décor. We’re in the midst of ongoing improvements, (we just finished a beautiful elevator!) and we’re taking your comments seriously as we work towards making Serrano even better. The next time you stay, we’d love to make sure it’s “picture perfect,” and even better!

review.title: Close to everything
review.reviewText: The Serrano was  a bit shabbier than expected from the photos and descriptions.  Still a very acceptable place for the price we got.  We didn't stay there a week later because the prices had skyrocketed.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and staff.  The beds were comfortable. and the bathrooms were nice.
review.negativeRemarks: brighten up the lobby and update the furnishings throughout.
review.locationRemarks: Right near Union Square and a good base for urban walkers.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
Knowing you’d stay here again is worth 5-stars in our book, and we sincerely appreciate the kind words about Serrano. Thanks for letting us know about our gym. We are in the process of ongoing renovations and knowing what is important to our guests matters to us. Thanks for staying with us; we’re looking forward to having you back!

review.reviewText: Very cute, nice views, nice staff. Would stay again! Only bad thing is a small and fairly hot gym.

managementResponses.response:
Hello BERNIE, 
We strive to have a great price point, and we’re sincerely sorry the parking costs was a disappointing added expense to your stay. Navigating parking in the city can be difficult which is why our hotel team is glad to offer valet or be on hand to help you find the many other options in the area. We want our service to be a highlight of our guests stay and apologize if it service fell short of that. Please know we are bringing it to the attention of our team and would love to offer you a warm welcome upon your return!

review.title: PARKING AND CHARGING
review.reviewText: THIS HOTEL HAS NO PARKING, AND THERE IS NO PARKING ON THE STREET, BECAUSE OF THE STREET SWEEPERS, AN ALL THE PARKING GARAGES, CHARGED 30.00 TO 40.00 A NIGHT, I ALSO PRE-PAID FOR MY ROOM, BUT THIS HOTEL RAN MY CREDIT CARD FOR THE FULL AMOUNT, TILL THE NEXT DAY, WHICH WAS NOT TOLD TO ME WHEN I FIRST GOT THIS ROOM, THE HOTEL WAS BEAUTIFUL AND THE HOSTS WERE JUST OK
review.negativeRemarks: PARKING, AND IF YOU HAVE ALREADY PRE-PAID DONT RUN CUSTOMERS CREDIT CARDS AGAIN.
review.locationRemarks: NO TIME

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
When you combine a lux hotel, location that can’t be beat and a top notch guest like yourself— you’ll find the ingredients for what makes Serrano Hotel special. We hope you’ll call us home if you come back to San Francisco!

review.reviewText: Lovely staff who were very helpful, nice clean room, great shower
review.negativeRemarks: The elevators were being serviced so were limited - but this is only a temporary thing
review.locationRemarks: Was really close to union square so good for shopping

managementResponses.response:
Hello Chris, 
Knowing you found Serrano to be “amazing” has put an extra smile on our face because we know that happy guests are our best feature! We’re passing your kind words on to our front desk and housekeeping teams; they’ll appreciate knowing they were a part in providing a great stay. Thank you for your feedback about Jasper’s and the parking garage. Our restaurant strives to provide a favorite for everyone on its menu, but we’re taking your comments seriously. We’re also looking into the issue with the parking garage. While our valet team loves to show welcoming service, we want every interaction during your stay to be a great one. Come back for the comfortable beds and come back for dedicated service, but mostly—just come back! We’d love it if you did!

review.title: Nice place for a short stay.
review.reviewText:
The hotel and its staff was amazing! The room had a great view, the bed was very comfortable and it was centrally located to everything which made it real easy to get around. The cleaning lady was very nice and the front desk staff was a pleasure to talk to. 

As for ammeneities.... The attached restaurant Jaspers was not that great and had a very limited menu. Drinks were a bit pricey too!

The parking garage next door was very expensive and the employees there were extrmemely rude and unprofessional.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
You’re right; a stay at Serrano should be completely smoke-free, and we sincerely apologize that was not your experience. Serrano is a non-smoking hotel, and we take that seriously which is why we were more than happy to move you to a new room. If you’re looking for a hotel team that really cares about their guests, Serrano is the place to stay!

review.title: Great location just a little dated
review.reviewText: The room was great but after we left for a few hours we came back to a room that smelled of cigarett smoke and it never went away. They explained that the ventilation system brought it from another room. The staff was very accommodating in finding us another room.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
We love to hear that guests loved their stay and a delicious meal at the local’s favorite, Jasper’s Corner Tap and Kitchen. We want to have everything for our guests could want right here—and that includes welcoming service from our hotel team. Thanks for sharing your feedback about our location. You’re right; the surrounding neighborhood is only getting better, and we strive to be an inviting presence in our heart-of-the-city location. We hope having transportation just outside our doors and Union Square just steps away were great starting points for enjoying the city.

review.title: Very charming hotel. The staff is very friendly.
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay here over the holiday. The tenderloin area is changing, but, not sure I would walk anywhere at night. It was quite unnerving. We woke up to multiple homeless people fighting and screaming at one another. Anyway, the stay was still worth the neighborhood. We didn't take advantage of the room service, but we did eat at the restaurant attached to the hotel. The food was great! The staff was very friendly and allowed us to check in early and upgraded us to a room with a gorgeous view.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
Providing a fabulous stay for our guests is a must, and we’re sorry if it was anything less during your stay. Guests often share that our location, steps from Union Square, and quiet, comfortable rooms are favorite parts of their stay, and we hope you could enjoy them too. We always appreciate hearing from our guests as it helps us make Serrano even better, and we’d love another chance to offer you a 5-star Serrano experience.

review.title: just soso
review.reviewText: the hotel definitely is not a 4 star hotel, honestly

managementResponses.response:
Hello Deanna, 
Whether guests stay for a day or a week, we’re always glad to have them. San Francisco is our favorite city which is why we love having large window views to overlook it. Union Square, Chinatown and the Ferry Building are some of the city’s best places to visit. Whether it’s shopping, theater or dining—you’ll find it all, just steps away. Thank you for sharing your concern about the urban fee. While you can find it next to the rates on the booking sites, we understand comparing hotels and prices can be difficult. We hope some of the great benefits of the urban fee made your stay even better; it includes several perks like morning coffee and tea, all day flavored water in reception, morning newspaper, town car service Mon thru Fri mornings to the financial district, unlimited local calls and faxes, boarding pass printing, use of our bicycles, and free Wi-Fi. We love knowing you had a pleasant stay, and would love it even more if you’d come back for another one!

review.title: Nice hotel with a convenient location
review.reviewText:
We stayed one night on a quick trip to the city. The hotel has a modern, boutique look to it and our room had a nice view of the city. The room was comfortable and clean and the staff was professional and accommodating. We were able to walk Union Square, Chinatown, and down to the Ferry Building quite easily. 

The only issue I had was finding an $22 "urban fee" that was not advertised up front on our bill upon checking out. It's never pleasant to have additional fees added after the fact, so I wish this had been more clear on the front end. Not sure if this is a hotel issue or an Expedia issue. 

Other than that, a pleasant stay.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Jim, 
Thank you for the review! We’re thrilled you found us “worth every dollar.” Our highest goal at Serrano is to provide a stay that is comfortable and welcoming for our guests, and we love knowing our location and old world charm were a part of that. The next time you’re in San Francisco, we’ll have your room ready!

review.title: Classic hotel in convenient location
review.reviewText:
I stayed many hotels around this area - Union Square - and this hotel is one of classic and well maintained hotels.
Not fancy, not trendy, not showy, not mega-national brand but classic. Well maintained and clean. Feel safe and secure. Worth every dollar spent.
review.negativeRemarks: Update some decor and furniture.
review.locationRemarks: Only a few minutes of walk from Union Square. Very convenient.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
We’re very sorry to hear you didn’t find Serrano just as beautiful as our picture. One of our favorite parts of being a boutique hotel is the many different rooms we have to offer our guests. (Like our fantastic Wizard of Oz suite!) We apologize you didn’t love your room though and would love to help you find one that’s just right the next time you stay. Another reason we love being a boutique hotel is the attention we can give to our guests. We hope you found our service was a highlight of your stay. If there is anything we can do to help your next stay be “picture-perfect” we will!

review.reviewText: Pictures on the website of the rooms arent the way they are in real life

managementResponses.response:
Hello Debbie, 
We think that, just like wine, Serrano gets better with age. We’re really glad you love our historic charm and that you can count on Serrano being as great as you remembered. It’s hard to beat being close to “shopping, dining, theater, and Union Square,” and we’re thrilled our location offers this and more. We’re listening to your concerns with our parking fees and taking your feedback seriously. We want Serrano to be at a great price-point for all of our guests! Our hotel team will be keeping an eye out for your return; we’d love to have you back again!

review.title: Nice Hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: I've stayed at the Serrano Hotel in the past and find it to be just as nice as five years ago.  The staff is welcoming, and very helpful.  I highly recommend this hotel for your visit to San Francisco, it is walking distance to Union Square, which is nice.  The only complaint I have, the parking was extremely high.  We have a Honda Pilot and were charged for a large vehicle, parking alone was over $100.00 - I feel a fair price would have been $54.00.
review.negativeRemarks: Charge less for parking.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, dining, theater, and Union Square.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
At Serrano, we want our guests’ stay to be even better than they expected! We’re very sorry to hear our elevator remodel was a disappointment during your stay. We also sincerely apologize for not having coffee in the lobby when you needed it. (Coffee is a must!) We appreciate you letting us know about the hair dryer too; we’re looking into the issue. It’s great to hear our location won you over. There is so much nearby--, like Union Square, San Francisco Museum of Modern Arts, Embarcadero and Pier 39...just to name a few! We’d love to have you back again where your clean, comfortable room is just the beginning of things you’ll love about your stay!

review.title: Had high expectations, but was disappointed
review.reviewText: Could have been so much better. Unexpected construction, elevator out of order, hairdryer not working and no coffee in the room, or the lobby - until replenished.  Otherwise clean and great location.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Josh, 
Our goal at Serrano is to truly help guests enjoy a getaway, and having luxurious rooms and great views are a couple of ways we can. We’re thrilled knowing little extras—like the radio made your stay even better, and we’d be even happier to have you back!

review.title: Hidden Gem
review.reviewText: My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel for one night and it was great. Room was nice and clean and very upscale. Great view and great price. They had a radio with phone plug in for music which was a very big plus. I would definitely go back and recommend this place to anybody.

managementResponses.response:
Hello,
Some people know how to have a great time, and it sounds like you’re one of them! We love knowing you uncovered so many San Francisco gems, and hope you’ll be back to find even more. It would make our day to welcome you back!

review.title: Clean, lovely staff, great location
review.reviewText:
The title says it all. Dog friendly.
It was wonderful. Period.
review.negativeRemarks: We were happy
review.locationRemarks:
Restaurants, art galleries, Union Square., shopping 
Never got into a car during our stay, reached everything by foot.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
We always hope guests find Serrano even better than they expected, and we’re sorry you were disappointed with your stay. Many guests find our location a highlight, just a short walk from Union Square. Making sure our guests are comfortable is a priority to us, and next time, we’d love to have you stop by our front desk so we can help you find the best way around the city. As a boutique hotel, we have a variety of rooms and suites, and if you stay with us again, we’re sure we can find one that’s just right!

review.title: Not a area to hangout in
review.reviewText: The room and door was really small. Close to the tenderloin area so not a safe place to walk around in. You have to taxi out and suggest not to walk. Good enough if you don't plan on staying in the room. Not what I expected when I got to the hotel/room.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
You’re right; San Francisco is about walking (or riding the cable cars,) and we’re thrilled you could get around the city easily from our doors. The best part of your review is knowing you’d come back because we’d sincerely love to have you. We’ve got the welcome mat out!

review.title: Cute hotel close to Union Square.
review.reviewText: The Serrano is a cute small hotel that is very close to Union Square. It is all about the walking in San Francisco and from this location you are in walking distance from several things and only a $12 cab ride from every where else. Great hotel. I would stay here over and over again.

managementResponses.response:
Hello KY, 
We completely agree that getting to your room should be easy, and we sincerely apologize that our elevator was being serviced during your stay. While we’re impressed with your ability to take the stairs (Wow!), you shouldn’t have to, and you’ll be glad to know the elevator is now up and running. Attention to detail is very important to Serrano which is why we’re in the midst of ongoing renovations. We’re working to make Serrano even better, and we’d love to have you back soon so you can see it!

review.title: Great location, condition not so much.
review.reviewText:
Stayed here a few years back when it was a Kimpton Hotel. It looks like it was recently sold and subsequently fallen into disrepair. 1 out of the 2 elevators was not working the entire time we were there. The other one was intermittent. One afternoon we trekked up the stairs for 15 floors, ended up using the service elevator most of the time. The walls are showing their age, pealing wallpaper, beat up trim. Bathrooms were small but thats likely the norm for the vintage of building. However they could be a bit cleaner.

Hotel was a decent price but we'd likely look elsewhere next time.
review.negativeRemarks: Facilities

managementResponses.response:
Hello Grace, 
Wow! Knowing we’re your favorite hotel has truly made our day! We love having every guest, but it’s even better when we can welcome them back as friends. We’re already looking forward to welcoming you back; you have a standing invitation!

review.reviewText: I have stayed at this hotel many times.  Could be expensive certain times of the year, however I try to book it whenever I can.  Never been disappointed.  It is my favorite hotel in SF.
review.positiveRemarks: This hotel has a lot of character which is what I love about San Francisco.
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
Thank you for your honesty about your stay, Knowing how guests feel about their time with us is very important. Thanks for sharing your concern about the elevator; the last thing we’d want is to inconvenience our guests. Our elevator was being serviced because of ongoing renovations. Keeping up with maintenance is the best way for us to keep making Serrano better than ever. You’re right, our historic charm is one of our best features and we’ll take your feedback into consideration so we can put forward the true heart of Serrano. Thanks for being our guest; we’d love to have you back!

review.title: The Lobby
review.reviewText: The funny thing about this hotel was that there was a monitor right next to the front desk that spoiled the feel of the whole place. It had all the components of a historic hotel, but with a disfunctional elevator and a little bit of tackiness, I can only give it a second rate review...
review.negativeRemarks: the elevator- it broke down, and I was told that there was an incident where the elevator was overpacked and dropped a floor during our stay! Apparant
review.locationRemarks: massage parlor up the block

managementResponses.response:
Hello Bob, 
While we’re glad you enjoyed our hotel, we’re very sorry if our location caused you to feel uncomfortable. Our goal is to put our guests at ease while they’re here. Because Serrano is at the heart of such a diverse city, we often see people from all walks of life in our area. Our concierge, or any of front desk team, would be glad to point you in the right direction to help you find the best way to Union Square or any of the other great San Francisco destinations.

review.title: Nice hotel.... Location??
review.reviewText:
Staff was great when I looked up and found the hotel it appeared it was at Union Square. It wasn't .... Homeless all over and begging don't know if this is normal for San Fransisco?
Very nice hotel.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Alyssa, 
At Serrano, we think traveling is hard enough. That’s why we want it to be easy and relaxing from the moment you step through our doors. It would make our day to have you come back; we guarantee to make your next stay 5-stars too!

review.title: No complaints!
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was very friendly. Made everything nice & easy. Room was comfortable.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
Thank you for the 5-star compliment; you’ve truly made our day! If there is anything we can do to show our guests some Serrano love, we will. That’s why from wine tasting to helpful service, we aim to give our guests a reason to be glad they chose Serrano. Thank you for being our guest; it was a pleasure to have you, and we’d love to see you again!

review.title: nice hotel in the heart of downtown SF
review.reviewText: The hotel was at a great location in the heart of downtown SF. IT was really walking distance (2-3 blocks) from the BART station which connected our airport to this place. All facilities  and marketplace were in walking distance from the hotel. The hotel itself was very well done and very cosy. The rooms were clean and the service was good. Tea and coffee  and even wine! was available in the lobby at different hours and it was on the house. What more a traveller can ask. The from office staff was very friendly and always willing to help.

managementResponses.response:
Hello MLopez, 
We’re very sorry to hear about the wait for check-in. Rest assured, you are a valued guest! We’re talking the concern about our housekeeping seriously and sincerely apologize for any interruption to your employee’s sleep. We love having guests who visit for business and pleasure, and we hope you found getting around the city was easy from our central location. No matter what brings you back to SF, we’d love to have you again!

review.title: Waiting
review.reviewText:
I waited about 15mins to get checked in. A guy was helping another guest. The another guy that was at the other end looked at me and did not greet me. Another guests walked in went to that guy and he got checked in. After that guest was checked in, I then went you to that gentalman and said can you check me in? He then said yes and began to check me in. I was not very happy about waiting and seeing one person go head of me right when he walked in after I had been standing there for 10mins or more.  

I then added another room for one of my employees and he had told me that the cleaning ladie came in his room while he was sleeping to clean, but did not check to see if anyone was there.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Andrea, 
We want our doorman to be just the beginning of things to love at Serrano. Thanks for taking the time to share your feedback; it’s an invaluable way for us to learn what matters to our guests. We’re very sorry our elevator was being repaired during your visit because we don’t want to slow you down from getting to your relaxing room or back down to the amazing city! We are looking into the promotions for Jasper’s as well. You’re right; they should be current. We’re also sorry to hear we didn’t get the mini-bar key up to you the first time. Having dedicated service is a high priority at Serrano. We’ve tried to take the stress out of parking with our valet service, but we’re always happy to help you find other parking options. We’d love to have you stay with us again and for the chance to provide a stay that’s far beyond “okay.”

review.title: Okay hotel, expensive parking
review.reviewText:
Hotel was clean and rooms were decent, but on the small side. One of the two elevators were broken, with old posters advertising non existent promotions at downstairs restaurant. Wasn't given cupboard/mini bar key upon arrival. Called down to get it & they forgot. Called 2nd time and was brought up. 

Doorman was lovely & polite, but $54 for valet is expensive, especially when there are lots for $25 around the corner.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
We love when guests come in and find Serrano even better than they expected—and we love that this was the case for you. When you visit San Francisco there are so many sights to see and one of the best parts of staying at Serrano is being close to them all! We hope you’ll visit the city again soon, and when you do, we’d love to have you visit us too.

review.title: Clean room, friendly staff and close to DT
review.reviewText: Was unsure of what to expect but rate was reasonable and the room was very clean.  Also close to the heart of downtown San Francisco so it was easy to get to the spots we wanted to check out while we were in SF.

managementResponses.response:
Hello E, 
Thanks for your patience during our crazy night on Saturday and for your kind words about our historic charm and helpful staff. Please know, the unexpected water issues and alarm are not a usual part of a stay at Serrano. We think that rest, relaxation, and comfortable beds should be the only words to describe your time with us. We’d love to win you over with another stay—where our décor and location will be just the beginning of things you’ll find to love.

review.title: Older hotel had some issues
review.reviewText:
This hotel is attractive, with a lot of vintage charm. The staff was helpful when I needed directions, etc. The location is short walking distance to many attractions and transportation.

Having said that, we had a few issues. The hotel contracts with the airlines so the lobby is swarming with flight crew in the mornings making it almost impossible to get a cup of coffee at 6am. There was an issue with the water heater that tripped the fire alarm...twice...once at 4am and again around 4:30am. That meant 2 treks down the stairs to the lobby from the 9th floor...not fun. The water heater was obviously having issues so water was completely shut off for several hours. On fairness I was moderately compensated for the inconvenience.

While I love older, unique hotels, I may book at one of the newer properties next time I am in town.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
At Serrano, we think some flair is a good thing, and we’re glad you liked our décor. Thank you for sharing your feedback about our plumbing and bathrooms. We’re in the midst of ongoing renovations and making sure our plumbing is one of our best features is important. (Guests love our hot water pressure!) We’d love to show you our different rooms the next time you stay, so you’ll be sure to have a bathroom as spacious as you’d like!

review.title: A hotel with Flair.
review.reviewText: This hotel is a quaint nicely decorated environment.  I couldn't understand why this hotel was rated 4/5 stars at first. The staff was very friendly and helpful.  The rooms are smaller than the typical chain hotel rooms. One thing I didn't like was the plumbing. When I set the water temperature it sounded like a power generator was running each time. Overall it was a decent experience but I like a bathroom with space, and theirs were tiny with no counterpoint space.

managementResponses.response:
Hello 
We love to offer our guests a truly San Francisco experience with our location at the heart of the city, and it sounds like you found some of the best places to visit! We’re taking your concern about the bathroom very seriously and looking into the issue with our housekeeping team. As a four star hotel, keeping our rooms pristine is a high priority. We’d love to have you back again—for a stay in a comfortable and sparkling room.

review.title: Walking distance to everything
review.reviewText: Walking distance to shopping, Food, and nightclubs. Part of the location looked rough with the numerous homeless living there. The room was nice except for the black mold found in th bathroom.

managementResponses.response:
Hello,
Central location—comfortable beds, it's the makings of a great stay. Thanks for joining us at Serrano Hotel and for the valuable feedback about your stay. We’re in the midst of ongoing renovations and are taking your concerns seriously because we want the best for our guests. We’re sorry you didn’t have a chance to take advantage of some of the great benefits of our Urban Fee, such as morning coffee and tea, all day flavored water in reception, morning newspaper, town car service Mon thru Fri mornings to the financial district, unlimited local calls and faxes, boarding pass printing, use of our bicycles, and free Wi-Fi. We apologize if you were not made aware of the charges before your stay but are glad the issue was resolved. We hope the next time you’re visiting San Francisco, you’ll come visit us too!

review.title: Urban Fee and Wi-FI
review.reviewText:
Hotel is located near Tenderloin area (1-2 blocks), that is known for many homeless people.  
On the other hand it is also very central, so everything is 5 minutes away from there. 
The hotel is old and tired so a refurbishment would be good. (e.g. single glass  windows, broken paint on the selling, ...)
Most annoying bit was that we booked the hotel via Expedia, and were told that everything is included. (including Wi-Fi)
On arrival in the hotel we were informed that  this is not the case and that we have to pay 22USD/per day for the internet.   
As we are on a holiday, we thought we can survive a few days without internet. 
On the check-out, we were confronted with a bill which was much higher then what Expedia sent us. 
The bill included the 22USD/per day charge.They call it  "Urban fee" and it is supposed to cover for Wi-fi and few other things. According to them it is  a mandatory fee ?!?
I explained that I was never informed about this mandatory fee, also they never provided access code for Wi-Fi, also we never used any of the services covered by the Urban fee. 
After a few minutes of discussed they agreed to remove this additional fee.

Bed is comfortable, and rooms are clean. 
We were on the 17 floor, and there was some noise coming from the top, I guess some kind of a pump or air-con or something like that. It was a constant noise so it was not a problem for sleeping.
review.negativeRemarks: everything
review.locationRemarks:
Hotel is located near Tenderloin area (1-2 blocks), that is known for many homeless people.  
On the other hand it is also very central.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Laura,
We want nothing less than “a great experience” for all of our guests, and we love knowing our hotel team and location were highlights of your stay. Our boutique hotel offers many choices for our guests, and the next time you stay, we’d love to help you find the perfect sized room.

review.title: Good area, close to The Warfield, great staff!
review.reviewText: The rooms are a bit small but overall we had a great experience.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Charlie,
Marathon or not, we want our guest’s getaway to start the moment they walk through our doors, and we’re very sorry for the delay with getting you to your room. We couldn’t agree more that our location is a front row seat to all the best shopping and dining in the city, and we hope you’ll soon be back to explore even more!

review.title: close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Our room is only ready at 4PM, one hour late than 3PM(normal check-in time)
review.positiveRemarks: on the street , closed to all restaurants and activities.
review.negativeRemarks: Room should be ready at 3PM as promised
review.locationRemarks: Half marathon at Union Square

managementResponses.response:
Hello SY,
There’s nothing we love more than seeing a friendly face, and we’re thrilled you’ve come to see us many times! It makes our day to know we’ve won you over with our service and comfortable rooms because you’ve won us over by being a fabulous guest!

review.title: Nice hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: I've stayed here several times over the last few years, and keep returning for the friendly team and clean rooms. It isn't as fancy as some of the very expensive hotels, but it is nice and clean and super comfortable.

managementResponses.response:
Hello,
It’s very important to us to hire a team with integrity and to help our guests in any way we can. We’re taking your feedback very seriously and are sincerely sorry we couldn’t be reached. We’d love for you to reach out to us again so we can make this right.

review.reviewText:
House keeping staff seems to keep items left in the room; called multiple times 4 hours after check out to no answer. 

Wife left a Marc Jacobs limited edition pallet and her Rainbow sandles. I guess housekeeping chose to keep them

they do not return calls and I have not been able to contact anyone for what I know was left.

managementResponses.response: We’re glad our lobby caught your eye because we strive to offer a beautiful hotel from top to bottom. Our urban fee is meant as a benefit, to provide extra amenities, but we’re sorry it wasn’t what you were expecting. Next time, we’d love to help you book a deluxe room with large, updated bathrooms.

review.title: Too small and Too many unnecessary fees
review.reviewText: There are too many fees associated with this property.  $22 includes WIFI, 2 bikes, that Everyone has to share in the hotel, tea and coffee in the lobby, that was put away by 9AM.  And you have no argument on the fees. The bathroom's are standing room only.  Just too small.
review.negativeRemarks: No extra fees for things that you cannot use.
review.locationRemarks: Everything is a walk away in San Francisco.  You just walk to everything, no matter where your hotel is.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Mike,
We’re happy to hear our old world décor caught your eye, from the lobby to the rest of our hotel, we strive to impress. Serrano is in the midst of ongoing improvements and the next time you stay, we hope the lobby and our helpful hotel team will be just a couple of the things you love.

review.title: Nice hotel but needs a remodel
review.reviewText: For the four and a half stars it received, I expected a little more updated room.  The lobby was beautiful but the rooms were a bit small and definitely needed renovation they didn't have coffee or pen an paper in the rooms. You had to go to the lobby to get some coffee and only during certain times. Be prepared to pay $57 for parking too. lot of little hidden fees( $25 for resort fee for coffee in the lobby and several things we didn't use, and what is an SF surcharge? ). I will say it had a lot of character and the staff was nice.

managementResponses.response: We love having new guests and offering a location just steps from Union Square. We’re very sorry though if you were uncomfortable with our surroundings. Serrano strives to be a welcoming presence in any neighborhood. Beautiful rooms are important, which is why we’re always making Serrano better!

review.reviewText: Hotel is not in a very good location , rooms need updating

managementResponses.response: Upgrading you to a suite is just one of the ways we can help make a (frequent traveler) more comfortable, and we’re thrilled to hear you loved your beautiful suite! We think the ingredients for a wonderful stay are the ones you just mentioned: location, beds, quiet rooms & having you! Come back soon

review.title: Great Hotel SFO
review.reviewText:
I`ve stayed at a different hotel in SFO and decided to go for Serrano this time. They upgraded us to a suite, a gorgeous, comfortable suite thanks to my Expedia status. Hotel has coffee/tea in early morning. Great beds, nice bathroom, great location close to Union Square.
Yes, some homeless people all around Downtown SFO, just ignore them!
This is a GREAT hotel and I would definitely come back next time I visit beautiful San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Beds, bathroom, location. Quiet, quiet rooms!
review.locationRemarks: Nice cafes and restaurants to have breakfast. Walking distance to Bart and Muni transport to get around SFO. Cable car station is also very close by.

managementResponses.response:
Hello,
Helping our guests enjoy their stay is the best part of our job, and we’re thrilled to hear it was the best part of your stay! Our historic charm is one of our best features, but we’re in the midst of ongoing renovations to make sure our guests have a room they’ll love.

review.title: Old but nice
review.reviewText:
The hotel staff was friendly and seemed to accommodate our requests in a timely fashion.

The hotel itself is old and the rooms reflect the age; running toilet, cracked walls, old carpeting.

The location is favorable but they're are much nicer hotels in the area for a similar price.

managementResponses.response: While we’re thrilled to know our hotel team was the highlight of your stay, we’re also sorry to hear your room didn’t impress. We strive to make each room shine and are taking your concerns very seriously. Our renovations keep making Serrano even better, and we’d love another chance to prove it.

review.title: Just didn't make the cut, for me that Is.
review.reviewText:
I want to start off by saying that the hotel staff here are extremely friendly and courteous.  They are assertive and helpful when you request something.   

Now the bad stuff, the hotel is just simply old.  Our room was on the 6th floor and it was very noisy outside.  The bathtub tiles had mildew.  The restroom was extremely small.  

Look, if you're okay with some of the above and want to save a few bucks then you're all good.  This hotel is within walking distance to union square.

managementResponses.response: Providing a wonderful stay for our guests is our number one goal, and we’re thrilled to hear you felt welcomed and taken care of by our team. We’re also glad our location was the perfect starting point for all your San Francisco adventures. There’s nothing we’d love more than to have you back again!

review.title: Nice vintage feeling.
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice and very clean. Staff was great. Great spot in the city as well. Loved the vintage feel and look of the hotel.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Kevin,
You found all of our favorite places to visit, and we hope you loved them as much as we do. (Especially Jasper’s!) You’ve made our day letting us know you’re coming again. We already can’t wait to welcome you back!

review.title: Great hotel in a great area.
review.reviewText: Close to fisherman's warf. Close to Giant's stadium. In walking distance to Union Square. Has a brewery connected to it with great food, drinks and of course beer. Third time staying there and will defenently return in the future.

managementResponses.response: If there’s one thing we think our guests deserve—it’s the best service, and we’re thrilled to hear we were able to accommodate your early check-in and late check-out requests. You’re not alone when you chose Jasper’s as a favorite; we love it too! We’d love to see you again soon!

review.reviewText: Located in union square this hotel is blocks from the cable cars and lots of shopping. Many options for dining near by and.Jaspers located in hotel has great food. We arrived early but a room was available and also got a late checkout. The staff are very friendly.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Dave,
We’re very sorry to hear our price point wasn’t a good fit for you. We love offering our guests the best of everything—from location, to dedicated service, to clean, comfortable rooms. We’re happy to hear our lobby impressed and hope you’ll come stay with us again!

review.title: One night stand
review.reviewText: Town was very crowded and availability very tight.  Price was insane considering the quality of the experience. Over $425 including tax for a closed with an AC unit that sounded ready to pass into the great beyond.  At $200 it would still seem fully priced, despite SF hotel pricing being some of the highest in the US.
review.negativeRemarks: Price, Price, room size
review.locationRemarks: Convenient location, but very busy.  Don't expect a tranquil experience in this neighborhood

managementResponses.response:
Hello,
With Union Square just around the corner, we have to agree our location is hard to beat. One of the best parts of a getaway is luxury—and a hot bath and comfortable bed is a part of it, and you can find both right here. Come back soon!

review.reviewText: Quaint hotel in a good location. It has a bath tub also.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Maureen,
Thanks for the kind words about our décor! We love to impress. Being a smaller hotel has its perks, and we’re glad to hear you agree. We’re looking into our breakfast options, and think ordering an amazing breakfast from Jasper’s up to your room is a great solution!

review.title: opulence galore!
review.reviewText: It is nice to be in a small hotel. I missed room service, but the opulence of a long gone era was worth it. I have gotten tired of giant corporate hotels with sterile, modern interiors with too much grey. The vibrant colors remind me of Italy on a sunny day. We had a room on the 15 floor on the east side. A great sun up on the cityscape!
review.positiveRemarks: It is charming and joyously colorful. The room can be almost blacked out for good sleep.

review.reviewText: The hotel was great - huge, deep bath tub, great bar downstairs.

managementResponses.response: We love giving guests a beautiful view of the city, and we’re glad to hear it was a highlight of your stay. The next time you need a comfortable room, luxurious bed—and a location at the heart of it all, come back to Serrano!

review.title: Very good hotel in the center
review.reviewText: Very good hotel. Clean and comfortable. 2 blocks to main shopping street and 4 blocks from fancier Union Square area.

managementResponses.response:
Hello John,
Being in the heart of San Francisco, we strive to be an inviting presence in any surrounding. Many guests tell us Union Square is a highlight, but we’re sorry to hear the neighboring surroundings caused you to feel uncomfortable. How our guests feel is very important to us, as is providing a safe, comfortable stay. We’re sincerely sorry for any issues at check-out. Our job is to make the process of staying with us as stress-free as possible, and we’re looking into our procedures with other booking sites. Offering our guests wonderful customer service is a must in our business, and we’re sincerely sorry you didn’t receive the help you sought.

review.title: Beware in Tenderloin district
review.reviewText: Our first thought was oh no.  The area is slum like with homeless panhandling and it was not the San Francisco we wanted to visit.  We decided to stay only one night and when we told the front desk we were informed that we needed to contact Expedia because they could not do anything about it.  The Expedia agent informed us that we would have to pay for the full 5 nights and I informed him that I would not.  He said he would call the hotel booking.  When he returned to my call, he told me to go to the front desk because it was handled  So, we went back down to the desk and the very unhelpful man at the front said that there was nothing in the computer so we would have to come back in the morning to get it resolved.  We went back in morning and was informed that there were no notes in the computer.  We were very frustrated with all the run around.  I know for a fact that the hotel had vacant rooms.  Our cancelled reservation did not result in someone being turned away for a stay.  When we protested about all the run around, the woman working the desk did cancel the rest of the reservation and we paid for the one night.  It makes me hesitant to book on Expedia again.
review.negativeRemarks: Overall customer service.  This is the second time I have been treated like a second class citizen because I booked off of Expedia.
review.locationRemarks: It is in the Tenderloin district.  Do your homework.  Very sketchy area.

managementResponses.response:
Hello,
Thank you for your honest feedback from your stay at Serrano. We’re sincerely sorry that there was a housekeeping issue in your room as our team works hard to make every room sparkle. If a guest ever shares their concerns with us, we are more than happy to come back and help. We’re also sorry to hear our price point was not a good fit for you. We strive to offer both location and luxury, just steps from Union Square—and if there is anything we can do to make your next stay more comfortable, we’d love to. You have a standing invitation to come back!

review.reviewText:
Hair in the bathtub :(
Old, worn carpet (clean but old).
Overpriced for quality.
Location is the issue.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Tasha,
It’s hard to beat being close to Macys, Union Square and the Westfield Shopping Centre. (It sounds like you found the best of SF!) We’re glad to hear you enjoyed your room, a perfect place to relax after a big day of shopping. For your future reference, guests do have access to safes at Serrano, and we’d love to help you with that the next time you visit!

review.title: Decent hotel in a handy location
review.reviewText: Decent hotel with a quirky style. Clean and pleasant rooms but we didn't have a safe or a kettle in our room which was a bit of a let down. The location is very handy for public transport access and is walking distance from Macys, Union Square and Westfield shopping centre along with various bars and restaurants.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel lobby is welcoming and unusual. The facilities are in good condition and clean.
review.negativeRemarks: The advice from staff on travelling around using public transport wasn't accurate so that could be improved
review.locationRemarks: The location is good - easy to walk to Union Square and Powell Street for the cable car and street cars

managementResponses.response:

review.title: Nice hotel in downtown
review.reviewText: If you have a plan to travel around downtown, this hotel is good choose to live, I really recommended it.

Near Macy's, if you like shopping

review.title: Plush hotel in the heart of San Fran
review.reviewText: I enjoyed both nights of my stay at Serrano. The room was comfortable, the staff was helpful, and everything was as I expected it to be. One piece of advise, stay away from the Mini Bar. Those prices will kill you. You're better off going across the street for a candy bar than spending a five spot on M&Ms like I did! Otherwise, a great hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Very comfortable bed, up to date hotel room, plush.

review.title: The staff was accommodating and friendly.
review.reviewText: I had a problem with my room ( it had a beautiful huge bathtub and I prefer showers) and they took care of me immediately.

managementResponses.response:

review.title: Not liking looking at hookers and homeless

review.title: Charming boutique hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel is only a short walk from Union Square but seems miles away from all the hubbub of the city. You are warned at check in  that a few blocks in the wrong direction will land you in the Tenderloin district but the hotel area seemed very safe. The morning coffee and tea are ready early in the lobby as is a choice of newspapers. the staff is friendly and helpful and does everything to make the stay pleasant. We booked a few outings (city tour, wine country) with the desk and got a better deal than if we had booked it on our own. The elevators are small as is the bathroom but that's part of staying in a boutique hotel. Everything was clean, comfortable and cozy.
review.positiveRemarks: We loved the eclectic decor, the restaurant was very good. Coffee was already available at 5:30 am when we needed an early start for the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Our internet service was somewhat spotty. We were able to log on but kept getting booted off in the middle of things.
review.locationRemarks: A short walk to Union Square and public transportation, very convenient. Good restaurants only a short walk away.

managementResponses.response:

With some of the most competitive rates in the city, and several online promotions, we strive to be a great price point for everyone, but we’re sorry if we weren’t for you. Having a great location, and easy access to parking is worth a lot, and we appreciate your kind words about Serrano’s highlights. You’ll find that when it comes to rooms, Serrano has a wide variety of rooms and suites. We’d love to help you find a favorite the next time you’re in San Francisco; you’re always welcomed back!

review.title: Good location very pricey
review.reviewText: Small room, high price, but good location.  PRking nearby.

review.title: Great location. Within walking distance of all we
review.reviewText: We had a great time would stay here again if I get a chance to come back.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Mike,
Serrano dresses to impress, and we’re happy our décor and luxurious room caught your eye. Thanks for bringing our attention to the alarm clock. We’re talking to our housekeeping team to make sure they are all turned off while they are preparing our guests rooms. We love knowing extra-touches like our bathrobes made you feel more at home during your stay. We are also taking your feedback about our gym seriously. It’s important to know what matters to our guests which is why we are looking at improvements. We hope everything you loved about Serrano will be reason for you to join us again. We’d love to have you!

review.title: Great wall paper, curtains and view. Poor gym.
review.reviewText:
We were very impressed with the luxury nature of the room, the whole look was great as well as comfort. The iPod doc did not work which was disappointing however not a disaster and the alarm clock functions where confusing which resulted in the alarm going off at 6am (as well as another room we could hear which wasn't turned off - slightly irritating). The bathroom equipped with hotel branded bath robes was a great touch and the mini bar was very well stocked.
The restaurant, Jaspers was very basic - we ordered Eggs Benedict for breakfast which bizarrely came with a fruit salad? This would've been much nicer if it came with a fresh lettuce, tomato, etc. salad or something more creative than strawberries, melon and pineapple.
The gym on the lower level was very basic, could not work out how to get the sauna to work and one of the main multifunctional machines was out of order due to one of the handles had snapped off - this hadn't been maintained or signposted. Some music in the gym would've been great if supplied however there was none. Not much space to work out with other guests using the gym at the same time.
review.positiveRemarks: The curtains, the wall paper, the view, bathroom, bath robes and the luxury bed.
review.negativeRemarks: The gym, the iPod doc, alarm, carpet and maintenance of the cabinets (although these are pretty much antiques they still should be maintained).
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location, we booked this place because it was a block away from Slide Bar where my partner had an art exhibition.

managementResponses.response:
Hello,

review.reviewText: Good location, easy parking, good value for money

review.title: Great value and location in San Francisco

review.title: A couple blocks from Union Square, wrong direction
review.reviewText: We stayed here for the first part of our honeymoon and we were generally unimpressed. The room itself was fine, a little small but comfortable. The location of the hotel we believe was misleading. Yes it is a couple blocks from Union square but it is in a slightly dirty, dangerous-feeling locale. If you walk even one block in the wrong direction, be prepared for homeless people, garbage, and overall disgusting surroundings. We were also charged a $22.00 per day "urban fee" that included charging us for what was labeled as "free wifi" and "complimentary tea and coffee" of which we did not use. Overall 5/10 would not recommend to friends, nor would I stay there again.

managementResponses.response:
Shan,

review.title: Boutique hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Prompt and friendly service from all staff members from the doorman, the front desk, bell desk, and housekeeping.  If you wake up late, there is no full housekeeping services after 4pm, however, the staff/runner is more than willing to accommodate requests needed for the room.  The complimentary coffee/tea service in the mornings in the lobby were wonderful.   As well as complimentary iced water in the lobby all day.  Our guest room seemed a little small and was close to elevator. The room was very clean and comfortable.   The plumbing was noisy when taking a hot shower.    If you return after midnight and need something to eat, there is a Sushi bar walking distance two blocks up the road and a korean place walking distance up and across the street.  For breakfast, there is a Diner a block away.  And a Walgreens a block up.      Convenient location two blocks from Union Square.    Expected a little better service from the public parking lot next door that took care of our parking for our rental car, especially for $50/night plus tips.

review.title: Nice hotel which I would stay at again.
review.reviewText:
Room was very nice corner room with nice views, clean, and well made up. There were some long hairs around the bathroom and one under the bathroom drinking glass but otherwise the bathroom was decent and had good water flow and heat to the sink and shower. They were also generous on the towels. Staff was very friendly and courteous and enjoyed that they seemed very attentive. My room didn't get made up on Easter day as I stayed in until 10 AM. I thought usually they would come back around but would give them a break since it was the holiday so don't want to judge that too harshly.

I think my only disappointment was that this hotel isn't a block or two further to the east or north. As long as you head east or north out of the hotel, the surrounding area is nice, great shopping and close to market where you can jump on the muni or bart. Head west or south and the neighborhood gets a bit iffy very quickly.

Their associated restaurant, Jaspers, had wonderful hamburgers and beer in the evening but the breakfast buffet was overpriced and underwhelming. I would recommend them for dinner but might try somewhere else for breakfast.

Oh and they do have a room safe in the minibar which I didn't realize until the second day... I hurried up check-in so maybe I missed being told but just a good thing to note if your staying and want to lock away your valuables.
review.positiveRemarks: Quiet and comfortable room. Very attentive and friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Room might do with some minor maintenance (eg. minibar had lock but could be opened without key).

review.title: Dingy room...TINY bathroom
review.reviewText: The living area of the room itself was adequate however; the furnitures was very worn, as was the carpet, the baseboards, etc.  Basically, it looked like the room hadn't had a decent overhaul in about 20 years but that wasn't the worst part, that would be the bathroom! It's so small that the toilette sits within about an inch of the wall, under the towel rack, so you have to sit sideways on the seat and the towels rest on your shoulders...be careful not to accidentally pull one down, and into the water, when you stand up! There is NO COUNTER, only a tiny ledge that's crowded with all of the stuff from the hotel so you're left to put your toiletries IN THE SINK!  Even this isn't easy because the sink sits under the aforementioned ledge so you don't even have full use of it's minuscule space.  Finally, the tub is so narrow that, you can't stand with you feet more than an inch apart without your ankles having to turn in to accommodate the curvature of the tub! If this place were rated at 3 stars, this would be relatively normal but, at 4 stars it's a complete joke!

review.title: Good hotel near everything
review.reviewText: My experience at the Serrano Hotel in San Francisco was great; however, because of its location it had a few flaws. The parking garage next door was very convenient but being so close to a bad area made me a little skeptical and uncomfortable at times. Overall the staff was very nice and the hotel service was great. Even after my stay I had a few problems transactions but accounting at Serrano was very helpful. I would definitely visit a Serrano hotel again.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Alex,
We couldn’t agree with you more; our location is an ideal home base to explore San Francisco’s many attractions and hidden gems. We’ll take your feedback regarding the price of valet parking into careful consideration. There are several self-park garages nearby, and our team is always willing to help point those out to you. For your future reference the fee includes; morning coffee and tea, all day flavored water in reception, morning newspaper, town car service Mon thru Fri mornings to the financial district, unlimited local calls and faxes, boarding pass printing, use of our bicycles, and very fast Wi-Fi. In our experience, guests appreciate one price for all that the fee includes, instead of separate charges for each item. Booking travel can often be a complicated endeavor as you try to compare and price a variety of hotels. It seems in this case you did not see details of the Urban Fee and we will take a closer look at fee descriptions. We’d love to welcome you back again in the future; we’re positive we can win you over!

review.title: Central location, but shabby and noisy hotel.
review.reviewText: Unfortunately, the hotel does not have parking, we had to pay $78US for two nights. We received an excellent discount from expedia (40%) but the hotel decided to charge us an extra $44.00 for 2 nights, for a coffee machine and internet that we did not use.....

review.title: Good Staff, Bad Property - this is 2 stars at max
review.reviewText: The staff is great and welcoming, but their efforts are unfortunately not enough to compesate the poor condition of the property.  The building is rundown and really in bad shape, the rooms are awkward and small, the furniture is outdated and beat up, the mattress is unconfortable (I spent the next day with serious back pains), the pillows are cheap and hard, the gym/exercise room is a joke, the restaurant is not a restaurant, it is a simple cafe.  This hotel needs serious renovation.  No chance of being a 4 stars, this is 2 stars at max!
review.negativeRemarks: Whole property renovation.
review.locationRemarks: it is also on the wrong side of the block... if it was on the other side of the street, where the Hilton is, the location would be better...

Just like any other big city, there is homeless around the area but they didn't bother us.

review.title: San Fran Post Christmas Getaway
review.reviewText: I found the Serrano on Expedia.com and was impressed with the boutique style hotel décor.  I like a hotel to feel like 'somewhere different'.  The Serrano has an ornately European feel ~ with a lovely lobby where coffee is served each morning and wine on Tuesday and Thursday eves.  Very central, it was an easy 6 minute walk to Union Square from where you can get almost anywhere in San Fran on public transit.  The staff were friendly and helpful, the rooms clean and comfortable, and the price was excellent.  We're looking forward to coming back.
review.negativeRemarks: It was great.
review.locationRemarks: We had a great time at the Marrakech Restaurant, which is right across the street on our first evening.  Had an excellent five course Moroccan dinner.

If you're the spread out and take up some space kind of traveler, go somewhere else. Also, Jaspers, the bar downstairs, was nothing to write home about. Overpriced, too strong of alcohol in drinks, and subpar food was our experience there. The hotel was conveniently located in the theatre district and near a Walgreens as well as many food destinations.

review.title: Location is everything!!!
review.reviewText: This hotel is perfectly located to go to the Curran Theater (about a block away), the ACT Theater, and Union Square, which is a short, pleasant walk away. It is close to restaurants and shops. We actually had 2 rooms at this hotel, a 2 bed double and a queen single. The hotel was able to accommodate our request for adjoining rooms for our daughter and her family and my husband and myself. The rooms were nicely appointed and clean. The only glitch we had with the hotel was that our room was not ready at the check-in time (3:00) and not ready until 5:00. Fortunately for us we had access to the other room so could hang out there. I would stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Having rooms ready at the designated check-in time.

review.title: Hidden Cost

I should have been informed the total expenditure beforehand.  Moreover, urban charge includes in room wifi which was very poor, morning coffee, health club  and daily papers. These things were not necessary for me since I  was busy with my own staffs.

The staff was very friendly and helpful, so a real asset to the hotel and our experience.

review.title: Nice but old hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText:
Overall, this hotel was worth staying in. It was good value for money and the location was pretty good, although it was on the more dangerous end of Union Square. As a 30 year old female, it felt unsafe walking back to the hotel at about 11pm at night. 

The decor was pretty old, it could do with an upgrade, but the linen was nice and the room was clean. There was also an umbrella in the cupboard - fantastic!

Some of the staff were helpful and friendly, some were short and didn't give us much time. 

The frustrating aspect was the "urban fee" which most people comment on in these reviews. That seemed like an opportunistic price gouge but when we added the fee to the cost of the booking it was still a little cheaper than a roughly equivalent hotel nearby. I was also well aware of the fee before I booked the hotel.

However, there was mold in the bathroom ceilings which could have been easily rectified with a proper scrubbing. The furnishings in the room show a lot of wear and could use some updating. Finally, they have a mandatory "resort fee" of $22 for things that other hotels make available free of charge; most notably, WiFi. I mean come on...this is San Francisco!

review.title: No problems
review.reviewText:
Everything was fine with the hotel itself.  Of course the hotel is a block away from San Francisco's skid row, which seems to grow larger all the time, so if that really bothers you maybe you should skip the Serrano (unless your taxi or limo delivers you to the door and you don't plan to do any walking in the neighborhood). 
My only critical comment may be more about Expedia than about the Serrano:  I chose the Serrano because it was the least expensive hotel on Expedia that was close to where I was going (the Great American Music Hall on O'Farrell).  As I proceeded with doing my booking on Expedia, I noted that the price quoted in the headline did not include an additional mandatory "resort fee" to be paid directly to the Serrano on my arrival to cover things like use of the hotel's fitness center (which I never visited during my fifteen hour stay).  If that resort fee HAD been included in the price of the room, the Serrano would no longer have been the cheapest hotel in the area -- probably the Super 8 across the street would have been.  So despite the nice, reasonably quiet room, attractive lobby, courteous staff, etc., this is what I remember about my stay.  Hotels should think about this sort of thing when they set their pricing policies.  People remember most instances when they believe they are being misled or manipulated.
review.negativeRemarks: Pricing policy with regard to the "resort fee" -- as discussed above.
review.locationRemarks: Great American Music Hall, Market Street, CalTrain station (within reasonable walking distance)

review.title: Formerly fine
review.reviewText: We had stayed at the Serrano before and found it to be perfectly adequate,  however, it has now changed hands and the new management appears to be acting like a legacy airline.  I revealed when we  booked was a $20 per day "Urban Fee" which apparently covers wi-fi, limo service to the financial district, the use of a pair of bikes (if they aren't taken) and coffee in the morning in the lobby. This is not negotiable, even if you don't want a limo or a bike or wifi. And to charge for COFFEE!!!  Why don't they charge for the shampoo and soap in the rooms; perhaps the towels?  Maybe the television.  What a rip off! We stayed at three other hotels on this stay and none of them had an Urban Fee.  Plus, the hotel looks kind of worn and poorly maintained. The attached restaurant (Jasper's) is not great either.  Unlikely to ever return until they drop the hidden fees.

review.title: Hotel that used to be beautiful
review.reviewText:
This hotel used to be part of a famous chain of hotels that possesses various other hotels in San Francisco.
If the chain decided to sell it, it is probably that they were not interested in refurbishing it. 
So the hotel looks like an old hotel, old furniture, scratched walls, outdated decoration.
The worst is that they are charging you additional fees for the internet, coffee and gym...fees that you can not refuse. 
The internet connection is bad.

At least the staff is really nice, that saved the trip. However, considering the price and the stars classification, this hotel could be way better. If the company that owns it want to be considered within the best hotels of the city, they will need to close it a while and do the appropriate renovations.

CleNliness is not maintained for either the room or the bathroom. Not worth a penny of the room rate paid. A motel room should rate much higher. Truly amazing the number of stars beside the name of this hotel, I wonder on which basis those stars are awarded. Also amazing, how  is this structure is able to stand beside other respectful decent hotels we moved to, in the same neighborhood costing the same or even less. Staying there for only one night was a real disaster that ruined our enjoyment of San Fransisco. Would never recommend staying their to any body. Nice size suite.
Breakfast service at Jasper's was slow and the food was below average.
review.negativeRemarks:
Coffee makers in the Suites.
Breakfast at Jasper's.

managementResponses.response: We love knowing our dedicated team and charming hotel helped make your San Francisco experience wonderful! Thank you for the review. Please come visit us again soon!

review.reviewText: Had a wonderful experience, staff was great, friendly and place was cozy and had lots of character.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for the terrific review! We love knowing you thoroughly enjoyed your stay with us. We hope you return to San Francisco soon; we would love another chance to “wow” you!

review.reviewText: It was great. Would stay here again if visiting SF in the future.

review.title: Okay but not great for older guests.
review.reviewText: Bathroom needs safety handles. Not safe to walk around outside in evenings for single women, children or teens, older couples, others eith slowed pace. Surrounding small hotels are in certain decline. Too bad, because management and staff are trying hard to keep the place going, but location takes a toll. Not bad place for young couples without children who are looking for urban nightlife, dining and a tion. Restaurant for breakfast, lunch, desserts and drinks is nice. Small place but good food and access for hotel guests.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for the amazing 5-star review! We are thrilled you took advantage of our fantastic, centralized location and explored the city. We agree! The fresh air feels wonderful, and you definitely don’t need to hit the gym after all that walking. We’re happy to hear you enjoyed Serrano’s old world atmosphere and some of Jasper’s delicious creations. We apologize for any inconvenience caused by elevator maintenance. Guest safety is our top priority. We’ll take your helpful suggestion about providing in-room coffee makers under careful consideration. Thank you! We hope some of the complimentary organic coffee and tea, found in our lobby, was able to hold you over. The next time you’re heading to our beautiful city, we hope you consider Serrano again. We’d love to make your next stay even better!

review.title: Nice hotel in a good location
review.reviewText:
The hotel is just of Union Square and the road it is on leads straight through to Nob Hill and Fishermen's Wharf while Chinatown and the Theatre District are also close by.  Therefore everything is in walking distance so long as you can cope with hills, but this is true wherever you are in downtown San Francisco.
While not as grand as some hotels I actually prefer these smaller hotels and although the décor is a bit run down it adds to the charm.
There is a good bar built into the hotel which has a range of micro brews and also some good food.
There is a gym but after hill walking all day there seemed little need to check it out.
The room is spacious enough for a city centre hotel with all the facilities you need - with the exception of coffee making facilities in the room.
review.negativeRemarks: There are only two lifts/elevators and while I was there it was rare that both lifts actually worked.  Could be just bad luck though

managementResponses.response: Hello! Thank you for the great review! We’re happy to hear our clean, comfortable rooms and fantastic location impressed you. We are thrilled our terrific team offered you quick, delicious dining options. We apologize if you experienced any form of service that didn’t meet the high standards we pride ourselves on. We hope you return to Serrano soon though. We’d love to make your next visit even better!

review.title: Good downtown SF place to stay
review.reviewText: Very nice,comfortable, quick and good service (restaurant one room service was bait lacking).
review.positiveRemarks: Good location, clean comfortable room, quiet
review.negativeRemarks: restaurant
review.locationRemarks: SF theater district and Union square,  easy access to freeway and other bay area attractions.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Louis,
Thank you for the 4-star review. We’re thrilled our location “in the heart of the city” was such a hit! We’re happy you were pleased with your accommodations here at Serrano. Please visit us again; we promise to make your next stay even better!

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel in the heart of the city. Close to market, union square, soma. Not s luxurious hotel but nice enough.

managementResponses.response: We’re very sorry to hear you didn’t enjoy your recent stay with us. We apologize if you were displeased with the condition of our hotel or aspects of our central location. We appreciate your feedback. Guest security, comfort and satisfaction are our top priorities. We hope you consider us again, the next time you’re in San Francisco. We’d love the opportunity to win you over!

review.title: Disappointing, tatty & tired hotel
review.locationRemarks: Hotel is located on the edge of the homeless area (Tenderloin) of San Francisco, and blighted by swarms of homeless people.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Elisabeth,
Thank you for the feedback and sharing your experience with us. We are happy you enjoyed our beautiful lobby and decorative arrangements. We are very sorry the size of your room didn’t meet your expectations. For future reference our standard urban fee includes; morning coffee and tea, all day flavored water in reception, morning newspaper, town car service Mon thru Fri mornings to the financial district, unlimited local calls and faxes, boarding pass printing, use of our bicycles, and very fast Wi-Fi. In our experience, guests appreciate one price for all that the fee includes, instead of separate charges for each item. Booking travel can often be a complicated endeavor as you try to compare and price a variety of hotels. It seems in this case you did not see details of the Urban Fee ahead of time. We are sorry for any confusion. We also apologize if you were displeased with the condition of your room, housekeeping, and general service you received. We strive to offer all our guests a wonderful experience. We hope you consider Serrano again and give us a chance to make things right.

review.title: Ridiculous charges
review.reviewText: After booking our trip on Expedia, we thought our room would be the spacious 2 bed suite we had booked.  Instead, it was so tiny, we were tripping over one another.  Also, there was this weird Urban Fee of 20 dollars, plus a 50 buck per day fee charged in advance in case you raided the mini-bar.  What?  Who's going to eat a $6 dollar package of chips when you can walk 500 feet to a deli and buy the same bag for 99 cents?  No free Wi-Fi, no extra bottles of shampoo or soap, and they kept putting you on hold when you called downstairs to inquire about anything.  The hotel rooms were tiny and less than sanitary.  Once, I walked into our hotel and the maid was playing loud music and looking through our items in the bathroom.  Nice lobby, though.  And for those that say you should have read the fine print on the Expedia form, there was nothing about an urban fee or precharging you for the mini bar items.  It was weird.
review.negativeRemarks: Better service, please.

managementResponses.response: We’re happy our location was a big hit. We can’t agree more; we love it here too! We are very sorry to hear you weren’t impressed by the size of our rooms and felt our advertised photos were in any way misleading. Guest satisfaction is very important to us. We’re glad you were pleased with the cleanliness and comfort of your rooms though, and we hope you’ll consider us the next time you’re in San Francisco. We’d love a chance to win you over!

review.title: not overly impressed, pictures misleading
review.reviewText:
Upon arrival, I was a bit disappointed.  The pictures looked a lot better!  The rooms were very small, but clean.  Guest service at check-in was ok.

Best comment I could add - good location to shopping/entertainment.
review.negativeRemarks: really nothing - the rooms are rather small but cannot fix that
review.locationRemarks: shopping, eateries, entertainment all great

review.title: Great hotel but very near Tenderloin district
review.reviewText:
The hotel was very cool. Staff super helpful but not overbearing. Room was fine, small but you only sleep in it. The downside is it is right on the border of the Tenderloin district which is not conducive to walking around at night. Tons of homeless people and sketch bars. Luckily the hotel bar Jaspars is AMAZING. Hopefully Anthony is working during your stay. Enjoy a delish drink, the Tenderita. 
Please note, I live and work in downtown Chicago so it's not like the big city or homeless people were a new experience.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing outside of moving to a better neighborhood.
review.locationRemarks: Near bad neighborhood. Close to buses and close walk to Embacadero.

review.title: Could have been better
review.reviewText:
We got the room right next to the elevator. 417. I had to go to bed early and wake up early, plus I'm a light sleeper. I maybe got 4 hours of sleep because people are so loud. I guess I could have asked for a different room but that seemed like a lot of work since we arrived late and I was tired from a long drive. Next time I know better.

There was no view. The wifi was good. Beds were comfy, showerhead had good pressure. Hot water was fast, fridge was stocked up and TV was nice and big. The lobby is pretty too.

Don't forget to make use of the amenities like wifi, coffee in the morning, newspaper etc. You pay for it when you check out - $20 - whether you use it or not. 

We also pulled up for valet but the valet guy ignored us. That ended up being a good thing because we saw a sign that said it was $34 across the street, vs the $50 something. So we saved $20 because valet was lazy.
review.negativeRemarks: Don't make a room next to the elevator. Full size mirror please.
review.locationRemarks: It's in the north east and everything in SF is close to everything, aside from traffic that can make a 5 min drive into 20 min.
