review.title: Good spot for my 7 yr old son and I
review.reviewText:
Trey Lopez, the concierge was the all star of our trip...great recommendations for everything...he even printed our tickets for the Giants game off the stub hub website for us.  
The $20 urban tax per day was a disappointment.  They say It's for the wifi and coffee...NOT COOL!!!  
It's not very close to fisherman's wharf or the ball park but it was close to the "BART" which is the local subway system.  
You can take the BART to and from the airport rather than a $50 cab ride.  
No snack machines that we could find in the hotel.

review.title: Easy to get around town from here

I walked around after dark and during the day alone and had no issues. If you're a diva or a princess this might not be the best hotel for you. 
The hotel staff was very friendly, and gave great directions. The hotel is clean and comfortable, and close to everything. 
The only thing I wasn't aware of was the resort fee. The hotel should charge you if you use the features or include it in the total nightly price. It seems like a dishonest way to take an extra $20 a night.

review.title: Weekend in Serrano
review.reviewText: This was a very pleasant surprise for me checking in this hotel. I can get so many ideas on a place just from pictures, but seeing it in person was great. The lobby was superb- Spanish/ American décor with iced cold water available for the guests waiting for the room, or pick up. The rooms were clean, comfy and I love the fact that you can open your windows to get a breeze of the wonderful San Francisco air. The staff was nice for the most part. All of them smiled despite the fact they were swamped by customers at times. There was one Asian lady who seemed like an iron fist though, fortunately I was helped by another nice gentleman. Our hotel room was in the 10th floor, right by the elevator. To my delight, the room was quiet, couldn't hear the elevators open and close, or the "ding" or the bell when the elevator arrived. The location of the hotel was perfect, just a few blocks from Union Square Poweel Muni and Bart Station, but it's in the nucleus of a circle of culinary treasures. Fino Italian restaurant and Sadana Japanese Restaurant is only 2 blocks up. The Curran Theatre and other great thai restaurants is just 1 block up. I will definitely stay here again, Oh yeah, they should fix or update the big touch screen monitor downstairs. We had trouble checking in for our flight, even with the assistance of the concierges. They said it was the airline's website that had the problem. I had to go to the Lower level business room to check in... Gym 24 hrs!

Convenient parking right next to the hotel for $31.00 /day, minivan and large cars are $20 more. You have to check in early to get the best view of the city. Overall, the hotel was quite nice for the price except the $20 resort fee. I would stay again in the future.
review.negativeRemarks: get rid of the resort fee or at least offer a complementary breakfast.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Union Sq & public transport
review.reviewText:
The hotel is an old-looking (apparently on purpose though) but well-maintained building close to the Union Square and Market St. which are great places for shopping and sight seeing. It is also close to public transport (bus, muni, BART) options that makes traveling around the city a breeze if you don't intend to walk all the way to the Golden Gate Bridge. The location comes with a minor cost though: you don't want to be on the wrong side of the hotel after a certain hour. Stick to O'Farrell and you should be safe.

The bar which is directly connected to the lobby (Jasper's) is VERY nice. Once you're in it is a bit noisy but the food and drinks were great. I missed the free morning coffee in the mornings since I can't drink coffee without eating anything but luckily there's a Starbucks just 2 blocks away so a quick breakfast was not an issue either.

The room I stayed in had a very nice view on 16th floor without much street noise (if any). Shiny on the mornings, dark enough to fall asleep easily at night. The amenities are quite good. I never used the TV or the minibar though. There is an awesome power socket/system on the desk inside the room that has 2 USB ports -one for a phone one for a tablet-, and multiple normal jacks. Not sure if it had universal plugs or not but it was impressive. The internet was free, very fast and reliable too.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, price and the utilities in the room were simply great. Jasper's at the lobby was a good bonus.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything looks a bit old. May be that's on purpose for fashion but not really my taste.
review.locationRemarks: Almost central, very good location. Close to Union Square and Westfield Shopping Mall on Market St. A bit sketchy neighborhood after dark.

review.title: Great hotel...Great location!!
review.reviewText:
I just stayed at this lovely hotel for 5 nights along with 3 other people. A warm welcome from doorman Trey was a great way to start off our girls trip (ps - all of the doorman were always welcoming, helping us find great places to eat, getting us cabs & helping us with our bags - never did we not come and go with out a friendly smile)

Check in was great as we arrived 4 hours ahead of time and they got us into a room so we could unpack and start exploring. Are the rooms small...well 4 girls with large bags to bring back goodies had no problem sharing 1 room - besides unless you are there to stay in your hotel room all day then sure..it is a bit small. It was clean and to me that is all that matters.

I keep reading about "so close to Tenderloin and the bad part of San Fran". I think what you will notice if you aren't from a large city is that there is in fact a lot of homeless people but they are everywhere in every single part of San Fran. Whether you are waiting for the Tram, or down at the Warf you will see homeless people. They were never hanging out in front of the door at the hotel.

Also Jason was a great help in suggesting what we should do in order to get baseball tickets!

I also see people complaining about the $20 fee - when you book online it says so about the extra fee - so maybe those people should start reading a bit more careful.

If and when I am ever back in San Fran this hotel will be the first place I check for availability!!
review.positiveRemarks: Everything was great about this hotel!
review.negativeRemarks: The pub inside the hotel needs to improve their service. Also don't have access from hotel if you have to go to front door in order to get seated.
review.locationRemarks: Honey Honey 2 blocks up from hotel was great. Slanted Door at Ferry Building is amazing!

review.title: Nice hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText:
I really enjoyed my stay at the Serrano Hotel. The room was nice and clean. Not all that big, but I wasn't in the room that much for it be a real problem. I enjoyed my evening runs in the exercise room and the dry sauna was an added bonus. I like that we weren't far from Union Square where we found some excellent places for dining and shopping.
The only things that were an issue were the bath tub and refrigerator. The tub was concave on the bottom which made it awkward to shower and felt it was a little unsafe. The refrigerator was stock full with hotel stuff at hotel prices. I couldn't put my own leftovers and snacks in the refrigerator.
I would still stay at the Serrano Hotel the next time I visit San Francisco. Thanks for a enjoyable stay.

review.title: Great Customer Service
review.reviewText: This was our second time staying here and I am sure it will not be our last. The hotel has a great Union Square location and the customer service is some of the best we have encountered in our many travels. We were greeted very promptly the minute we pulled up to hotel and our luggage was loaded off and car parked in no time at all. Chris at the front desk was very nice and courteous and when we mentioned it was our wedding anniversary he gave us two free cocktails for the Jaspers bar. The bell hop brought our luggage up to our room and even got ice for us. Our room was small but decorated very nicely and was very clean and had top of the line toiletries. Once we got settled Chris called to make sure that we were satisfied with our room. We appreciated that! There is a restaurant next door called Jasper's and we attempted to have breakfast there but the service was so poor that we left and ate somewhere else. All in all a great visit to San Francisco at the Serrano Hotel!

review.title: It's ok, but not entirely what I was expecting.
review.reviewText:
I was disappointed with this hotel probably because I was expecting so much more than it delivered and it fell short of expectations.

When I booked, I specifically booked this hotel because it was in the kimpton brand. When I turned up, it wasn't! And I can see why. It's a bit tired, a bit shabby and ( disappointingly) it didn't have the wine reception in the evening. Coffee in the morning was good but a choice of tea would have been even better.

The staff were nice and quite helpful, and when I queried the $20/night 'resort' fee they didn't charge it. But, honestly, what is a resort fee in San Francisco anyway?

The location was fairly good, very convenient for a lot of things but you do need to watch which direction you head - it turns seedy within one block of the hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel, near Union Square
review.reviewText: Me and my sister decided to give Serrano a try for our first visit in San Francisso. When we arrived, the lobby instantly impressed both my sister and I with its neo-classical/Renaissance inspired design. The room was a little tiny for me, but overall it was a good size for two people to stay with a queen bed. The restaurant next to the hotel lobby was also highly rated and chic, however, we didn't get a chance to try its menu, despite its delicious selections. Surrounding the hotel are many great restaurants and convenience stores for our needs so we were very happy about that, especially during late at night when we in needs of water or small snacks, there is a 24 hours convenience store very close by for us to visit for whatever we demand. The only thing I can remember I don't like so much about the hotel would be a $20/day fee for coffee and water. For a premium price hotel, they could have provide free coffee until 10/11 AM and unlimited water in the lobby for customers.
review.locationRemarks: Near Union Square, very near. Good restaurants surrounded.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for the fantastic review! It is wonderful to hear that you enjoyed you trip to San Francisco and your stay at our hotel. You will be happy to hear; we are in the process of upgrading our Wi-Fi. Then next time you visit us the internet should be speedy! We hope to see you again soon.

review.title: Centrally located gem
review.reviewText:
Stayed with wife and adult son 4 nights. Omar at front desk let us check in at 11 and gave us room on 16th floor with a great view. Usually when I book online the room location is in a less desirable location. The hotel has lots of charm and character, but it is an older building with smallish rooms. Despite room size, it was clean and comfortable and was very workable. There is a small gym and sauna on lower level. Wifi was a little spotty.

The location was ideal--just a few blocks from Union Square. I guess the Serrano's location is on the cusp of the Tenderloin district, but the Hilton was kitty corner from it so how bad can it be. There were lots of homeless people everywhere we went downtown, and the doormen kept them moving.

The only thing I wish the hotel contained was a small outdoor space.
review.positiveRemarks: Lots of staff to help if you need that.
review.negativeRemarks: It was all good.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of restaurants and shopping nearby; easy access to public transportation.

managementResponses.response: We are thrilled that you loved our location; we couldn’t agree more! We are very sorry that you felt our hotel was in need of some renovations. We will take your comments into careful consideration as we continually strive to improve. We hope to see you again when you next visit San Francisco, we know we can wow you with the ongoing improvements.

review.title: Good location but quite tired.
review.reviewText: This hotel needs to be renovated. It's looking very tired.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was excellent - near to the union square.
review.negativeRemarks: The decor needs to be updated.
review.locationRemarks: Right in the middle of all the shopping.

managementResponses.response: We are very happy that you loved our location and that our team took good care of you. Your location tips are wonderful; we know future guests will be grateful, thank you. We hope to see you again when you are next visiting San Francisco.

review.title: Hotel close to the action
review.reviewText: Room met expectations. Fifteen minute walk to Moscone center. Jaspers food and service was excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: N/A
review.locationRemarks: Three blocks to BART. 15 minute walk to Moscone Center. Several blocks to Union Square.

managementResponses.response: We are very sorry that you were unhappy with your recent stay with us. We value ever guest review. As we continually strive to improve, your comments help us know what we need to focus on. We would welcome the opportunity to make things right.

review.title: Never again
review.reviewText: Rooms were dirty.. No coffee.. Beds were small.. It smelled like mildew.... Parking was 40 dollars... Sketchy area

managementResponses.response: We are very happy that our hotel met your expectations and that you enjoyed our location, bar and breakfast. It’s great to hear that our team took care of you, but we apologize for disturbing your sleep with that early call. Come again soon!

review.title: Good hotel in a good part of town
review.reviewText: Everything pretty good - good bar and breakfast - annoyingly the reception phoned me at 7am to tell me that housekeeping had said I was having problems with the wifi!
review.positiveRemarks: Was only there for a night but helpful staff (as long as you tip well!)

review.title: Nice place
review.reviewText:
A nice old hotel in a good location, provided you can put up with the swarms of bums, panhandlers & vagrants that infest the Union Square area. Elegant lobby & 5:00 complimentary wine tasting a very civilized touch; restaurant offers a relatively limited, but well done menu & takes its cocktails seriously.

Note: As of 1/31/14, the place is changing ownership, so all bets may be off.

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: We chose the Serrano because it's close to the ACT Theater and good restaurants near Union Square. And though it's easy to get to and away from via I-280, I'd use the parking garage across Taylor street which costs half as much. Staff is very helpful. Comfortable beds and pretty quiet.

review.title: Convenient location to Union square, restaurants
review.negativeRemarks: Interior is very old
review.locationRemarks: Central location in downtown, all the tours and sightseeing easily accesible by cabs/bus.

review.title: Not up to Kimpton's par
review.reviewText: Horrible service. Staff we're not knowledgable and not friendly.
Great location!! Free coffee and wine! Beautiful architecture .

review.title: great location in San Fran
review.reviewText: Staff was exceptional! Room was small - but not cramped. Location close to Union Square. Parking was outrageous, but not many options in City.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was friendly, professional and helpful.
review.locationRemarks: Walking to Union Square, theaters

review.reviewText:
Serrano Hotel is located near Union Square...an easy walk. Members of the hotel staff were extremely pleasant and helpful. The bellboy provided us with excellent recommendations for dinner in North Beach. We weren't disappointment. In the evening, the hotel holds a wine reception, and hot chocolate and coffee are served in the lobby each morning. We were unable to take advantage of either, but many guest did and seemed to really enjoy both.
The lobby is dark and tired. Our room, while clean, was in need of some repairs. The furnishings were nice and the bed was comfortable. The small bathroom had been nicely renovated, but the door was splintered at the bottom and had been painted over, rather than replaced.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff, the bed, the location, cleanliness
review.negativeRemarks: Free wifi, replace molding and door rather than painting over problems,
review.locationRemarks: Near Union Square where tours have pick-up stops and where all the big department stores are located.

review.title: Enjoyed our stay at Serrano
review.reviewText: My husband and I enjoyed our stay at Serrano. We were pleased with every aspect of our stay. There was a small issue at the restaurant, Jasper's, which was handled exceeding our expectations. Our friends were at another, more modern hotel, and wished they had been booked at Serrano. We won't hesitate to stay when next we visit San Francisco. If there is one thing I missed it would be a coffee machine in the room. Not a big deal though as there is the coffee service downstairs. The concierge booked us a wonderful limousine to take us to Napa Valley for the day. Thank you for a wonderful experience!
review.positiveRemarks: Character, comfort of home, staff efficient but not in the way, friendly, location.
review.negativeRemarks: Coffee pot in room.
review.locationRemarks: It is downtown San Francisco, lots to do and close to transportation.

review.title: Oct 9 to 12 2013
review.reviewText: They were very accommodating as we landed in San Francisco at 5:30 am on the Sunday and even though check in was 3:00 pm they gave us a room with no extra charge. We were blown away by their hospitality. Even though the hotel is close to an area that is not very good, we had no problems at all. Restaurant was great, service by hotel staf fantastic .

review.title: Great hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText:
Spent quite a while trying to locate a decent hotel close to Union Square and the downtown area that was good quality but not too expensive. After several searches I kept coming back to the Serrano and decided to book it for our stay. Very glad I did, as both my friend and myself really enjoyed our stay at this hotel.
Rooms were of a decent size, we stayed on the 17th floor and the never had any problems with the lift. Bathroom was a little on the small size but still big enough. Staff were very friendly and helpful, always able to answer any questions we had. Really enjoyed the free wine hour in the lobby every evening too, nice way to unwind after a long day touring around the city. I would definitely stay here again, perfect location and a very relaxing hotel.
I knew when I booked it that this hotel was on the border of the Tenderloin area, which people advised me to stay away from due to the homeless people, but to be honest, we never had any problems during our stay, just remember to walk left when you leave the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly and helpful staff, very comfortable beds, and loved the free wine hour every evening.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe offer breakfast as part of the package, rather than having to eat out every morning.
review.locationRemarks: Within walking distance of Union Square (about ten minute walk) and lots of bars and restaurants nearby. Right distance away from the Tenderloin.

review.title: San Francisco hotel
review.reviewText: Good location, near theatre attractions and shopping. Overall, staff excellent (1 exception).

review.title: Comfortable
review.reviewText: My husband and I had a 1BR and it was a modest size, enough to sleep and unwind in between sightseeing trips. The bathroom was a little small. The hotel is located on the border of Union Square and Tenderloin, so if you want to avoid Tenderloin, you can choose your routes to minimize your walks through there. The hotel is conveniently close to several bus stops, cable car stops, and the BART.
review.positiveRemarks: Two great conveniences - the location (near public transit stops) and the attached restaurant (Jasper's Kitchen).
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom was a little small, and the tub was slow to drain, which made the showers a little uncomfortable.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is close to several public transit stops, so it was easy to get to all sights, including the Golden Gate Bridge and Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Awesome
review.reviewText: Stayed here for 5 nights. Hotel was extremely close to union square and public transportation. Staff was extremely helpful and we really enjoyed the free wine hour from 5-6 everyday after a long day of san Francisco sightseeing. Hotel is connected to Jaspers restaurant which also has great food and cocktails. Negative was room size...pretty small and we had no view, but we barely stayed in the room anyway. Also, if you make a wrong turn while walking, you can end up in some pretty scary areas if you are not paying attention (stay away from section of Turk street that is close to hotel). Overall I would definitely recommend.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff, decor, wine hour, location, restaurant
review.locationRemarks: Very close to union square hustle and bustle, tons of restaurants and public transportation to get you all over San Francisco.

review.title: Great hotel for the price.
review.reviewText: When staying in San Francisco hotels can get very costly. It took me forever to make a hotel decision but I am so glad I made this one. The staff was very nice and helpful, room was very clean and bright, had everything we needed. Also has a restaurant right underneath that was very good and reasonably priced and is across the street from a liquor store. I did think this hotel was closer to AT&T park but it was just a short cab ride. It is right by a homeless hotel but we didnt have any real issues with any of them. You will pretty much run into them at any location in SF. My mother in law is extremely picky about hotels and we both agreed we would stay here again. Also, there is a doorman at all times and he was always helpful with door, luggage, cabs etc. Great coffee and tea in the morning as well. It was a great place to stay!
review.negativeRemarks: Small rooms but I think that is pretty standard for most SF hotels.
review.locationRemarks: Restaurants, nail shop close by, liquor store across the street. Short and cheap cabs rides to mostly everywhere

managementResponses.response:
Hello Gail,
We're thrilled you enjoyed our Wine Hour! It is always great to have this type of feedback; as we continue to improve! We're so happy our team was able to enhance your visit! We can't wait to see you on your next visit to San Francisco!

review.title: Great location and very friendly and helpful staff
review.reviewText: The Serrano is an updated old hotel. The lobby is very nice with seating sections that are very nice especially during the "Wine hospitality hour". The staff were all friendly and helpful with ideas of where to eat and take good photos.
review.locationRemarks: It is close to Union square and so is easily to get around anywhere in San Francisco from the hotel.

managementResponses.response:
Hello LC,
Thank you for the review! We are so happy you enjoyed our convenient location and great team during your stay at our hotel. We look forward to seeing you again on your next trip to San Francisco!

review.title: great hotel

review.negativeRemarks: With the windows open there was a lot of street noise.

review.title: Nice Hotel near Union Square.

Not only was it extremely quiet, it had an amazing view and great A/C (it was a warm weekend in San Fran). It was a wonderful stay at the Hotel Serrano!

managementResponses.response:

review.title: Great Location

review.positiveRemarks: The location was easy to the BART and Trolley lines. The hotel had a lot of charm.

review.title: Stay at the Serrano
review.reviewText: Good location. A few minutes from the Westfield Mall & Union Sq. The hotel isn't the most modern & up to date but it's nice. The rooms are clean & the staff is friendly. I would stay here again.

review.title: Close to Powell and many great restaurants.
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was helpful. The bed was comfortable. The shower was a little hard to stand in as the floor of the tub was not secure. The room was light and airy. Nice robes. Rooms small but did the job. One issue is noise from hallway in the mornings. Some cleanliness concerns.
review.positiveRemarks: Well appointed. Comfortable bed. Great location, Helpful staff.

review.title: Beautiful lobby!

review.title: Excellent Location for Dining!

A good starting point to walking all over San Fran...staff are great and the building is very nice. Our room was good but could use a refresh as the sink and bathtub showed signs of aging...cracked grout and some minor mold from normal usage.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, front lobby wine hour and staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Updating bathroom.

review.title: Elegant, friendly and close to fun

review.reviewText: This hotel wasn't the standard I expect from a Kimpton, but I couldn't fault the saff - extremely helpful and made me feel very welcome.

review.title: I'll be back

review.title: Warm welcoming hotel
review.reviewText: Superb hotel with close proximity to Union Square, Powell Bart Station, Westfield Shopping centre, cable cars and all muni transport . Lots of car rental places within two minutes . The hotel staff were welcoming and friendly , the rooms are nicely furnished, with excellent mattresses on the beds. Good wifi connection and recharging facilities. Only downside is it is very near the Tenderloin district which is quite seedy and full of homeless people, not a problem if you are aware of it and can avoid it. all and all a lovely boutique hotel with an nice ornate reception.

review.title: Small, comfy, yet small

review.title: nice hotel, good location

review.negativeRemarks: update the rooms

review.title: Nice hotel with a centric location
review.reviewText: Pleasing and well light room. The bed was very comfortable.

review.title: My lovely Serrano night
review.reviewText:
I was able to check in early so I didn't have to walk around with my heavy bag. I was very
grateful and impressed about that. My friends got to come and check out the hotel room
without any hassle. It seemed like I was trusted by the staff.

review.title: Solid easy stay.
review.reviewText: Central location wi close proximatey to Powell Street, Union Square and Market Street. Good wifi access and rooms are quiet. Bar and restaurant downstairs is very good and good value for money. Rooms a little bit small but clean and comfortable.

review.title: San Fran Stay
review.reviewText: Enjoyed the wine happy hour and C.O. Bigelow bath products! I would return to this hotel. The rooms are rather small, but the service was great. Close walk to many Union Square/shopping. The walls are a little thin, we could hear our neighbors at times.
review.negativeRemarks: room size
review.locationRemarks: close walk to many neighborhoods

review.title: clean rooms but definitely not new
review.reviewText:
The lobby looks very good but the rooms are in need of refurbishing. They look nice but are very obviously not new. Showerhead was not great either as parts of the water stream were strong and others were weak (but that probably only matters to girls with long hair as it messes it up a bit).

Overall, I would look for a different hotel next time if I can help it, but if there is nothing better and similarly priced I would stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: room state, shower, and a fan in the room ceiling behind a grate making way to much noise right before we were to sleep - thankfully it stopped soon.
review.locationRemarks: great location - 5mins (or less) to Union Square, less than 10 to Market street and from there you can easily get onto Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Wonderful little hotel.
review.reviewText: Great convenient location. Short stroll to Union Square. Very quiet room with VERY SOFT bed linens. The room was rather small in size, but we really didn't spend much time there with so much to do in the area. Staff was fantastic and extremely welcoming and accommodating.
review.negativeRemarks: Small rooms and bathrooms
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square

review.title: Excellent staff, location, and value.
review.reviewText:
I came to SF to attend Google I/O and my wife joined me toward the end of the conference for some touristy stuff. I spent the first night on the 2nd floor with a Queen bed and felt like it would be too small for two. Called the front desk and they were able to give me a King at no additional charge on the 2nd night and for the duration of my stay - I was very pleased.

My wife loved our room on the 9th floor when she arrived. Windows are newer and could be opened to let the wonderful fresh air in.

Weight room is great with most of the workout equipment you want. Removing one cardio machine (out of the 5) might give us meat-heads more room but that's minor.

Location is very good; you are two blocks from Union Square, and a block or two from the Tenderloin. We always felt safe and I could get to Moscone Convention Center in about 12-mins on foot.

Omar is the man! ALL the staff were friendly and tended to any special requests promptly. Omar in particular, was exceptional. He was generally interested in the conference I was attending and we had several great chats.

We left on the Sunday of the "Bay to Breakers" Marathon, and the front desk was kind enough to notify us in advance that we'd want to leave early to avoid the marathon traffic. BART was a great solution and fast to the airport.

The hotel itself is older but well maintained. One nuisance is the WiFi which is intermittent just like every other hotel in the area, but hey, it's free.

I would gladly stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff, location, hotel room, exercise facility
review.negativeRemarks: WiFi was intermittent at times. Business Center was a little expensive ($7 for 15 mins) and pricey printing, but on par w/every other hotel.
review.locationRemarks: 2 blocks from Union Square, 1 block from Tenderloin, 12-mins on foot to Moscone Center. we felt safe.

review.title: Very welcoming staff
review.reviewText: All of the staff was extremely welcoming and friendly. The room was clean and comfortable. The downstairs restaurant, Jasper's, was excellent. The location is within walking distance of Union Square. The parking is pricy, but that is to be expected in San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: I wish the parking was a little cheaper.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square is very close. We went to a fun bar called "Swig" which is just around the corner.

review.title: Pleasant stay for a solo business traveler
review.reviewText:
I admittedly didn't use many of the amenities at the hotel, but it was generally a comfortable and pleasant experience. The staff was helpful and accommodating with the few things I sought help with.

I am a younger male who was in the region on business and stayed in the city a few extra days to explore.
review.locationRemarks: The area is a bit intimidating if you're not used to the city

review.title: Great hotel nearTheatres and Union Square
review.reviewText: Great location. Close to theatres and Union Square. Friendly staff. Good restuarant and wine hosting was nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Veiw of wall of other bldng out window
review.locationRemarks: Great location Near theatres and Union Square

review.title: Great hotel and location to Union Square
review.reviewText: Great location to union square and the trolley. Great pubs in the area. Went to Swig(nice ambiance and cozy), Johnny Foley's (Irish pub with live music) and Jasper at the hotel was great too!! The hotel rooms were small but not too small, had everything that you need, nice size closet, TV, desk, room for 2 large suit cases, two big windows and a clean washroom. We really enjoyed the coffee in the morning and the wine reception in the evening was a great way to start your evening. I think the hotel is more geared to adults, couples, girls get away or guys sports weekend. Really enjoyed our stay.
review.negativeRemarks: No hot tub
review.locationRemarks: Union square, action, cable car and transit

review.title: Worth a stay!
review.reviewText:
Great place to stay. Great location and the staff was helpful.

Had some minor issues with hot water - apparently the "x09"/"x10" series rooms have some odd hot water piping problem where some days it's hot, other days it takes 5 mins to heat up. They also didn't have a kettle for loan, but room service brought me hot water daily.

review.title: A perfect location
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel, although the shower water never got hotter than warm, despite my notifying the front desk.
review.negativeRemarks: Shower water
review.locationRemarks: Close to theaters and Glide

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText:
Love the location and the staff --- extremely helpful and makes you feel right at home. You are close by to literally everything!!

Room itself was a bit small but did have good closet space. Restaurant in hotel needs to be improved -- most of our meals were taken elsewhere.

Generally, I feel right at home and will return!
review.negativeRemarks: attached restaurant
review.locationRemarks: perfect!

review.title: Decent hotel, a bit over priced.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, small rooms as expected downtown. No in-room coffee facilities although one was provided when asked (although no replacement coffee provided the next day, so pretty pointless). Free WiFi if you sign-up to the frequent-flyer programme. Free coffee in the lobby in the morning and wine in the evening - but limited sitting space and small glasses. Wine session opened 1-2 minutes late but closed on-time daily after 57-58 minutes. Valet parking is a con - best part of $50 per night when the local rate is nearer $25 (I paid $24 1 block away). No option for clean bedding daily.
review.negativeRemarks: Few in-room facilities.
review.locationRemarks: Good location.

review.title: Very good value.
review.reviewText: The localization is excellent. From there is possible have ease access any place. The bathroom need some place to put some stuffs as the sink is very small, but despite that the room is very comfortable room.
review.negativeRemarks: none to report
review.locationRemarks: The hotel have a excellent localization.

review.title: Great deal in downtown SF
review.reviewText: Very great staff. Felt extraordinary as I walked in thje hotel. We stayed for 4 days and enjoyed the wine tasting in the afternoon. Close to everything you want to see. Located at the limit of the Tenderloin district, you have to make with the unusual amount of hoboes. But if you stay East of Taylor you won't get bothered. An overall unique experience, we really enjoyed the Serrano and will surely come back when visiting SF.
review.negativeRemarks: Location

review.title: Distinct Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was central and close to everything, had a great deal of charm and character.

review.title: Will stay again and again
review.reviewText:
A great stay. It was a recommendation from a colleague and proved to be an excellent choice.

The hotel is well situated, with lots of bars and restaurants nearby. The staff are very professional and attentive.

Check out the Bourbon and Branch sleep easy bar (don't forget to book beforehand!#

Valet service is a bit pricey #$41/day), but I guess that's the going rate for in the middle of SF.

I'll be going back again on my next visit to the SF.
review.negativeRemarks: Valet costs
review.locationRemarks: Brilliant, lots of great bars and restaurants only a short strole away. There are a number of "bums" around though, but they appear harmless.

review.title: Nice, simple historical hotel
review.reviewText:
A nice historic hotel in downtown but with that comes small spaces and an area that's not so desirable after dark. Hotel was clean and the bed was super comfortable. Bathroom is tiny so no room for sharing. The entrance to the hotel is small but opens to a nicely decorated lobby, although slightly dark.

This hotel would be more suitable to business travelers and couples who desire more unique, historical hotels. Families and those wanting nightlife might be better served closer to Union Square.
review.positiveRemarks: Historic charm and a comfy bed...
review.negativeRemarks: Uninviting entrance, a bit cramped...
review.locationRemarks: Not that great after dark...

review.title: Stay here - it's brilliant
review.reviewText: Superb! Great service, friendly staff; outstanding rooms. Clean and tidy. Love the support of nature, animals and the environment - The Serrano hotel is a great place to stay!

review.title: Highly recommended!
review.reviewText: The only single complaint was the uncomfy beds otherwise the entire place was fantastic, friendly and with outstanding location & amenities! Thank you for the complimentary cidar every night!

review.title: Kimpton Hotels
review.reviewText: The Kimpton Hotel chain is always a good bet - the wine reception is nice and they had a hot chocolate bar with marshmallows. We always enjoy the robes with animal prints too. The water was not very hot though. Staff was nice and helpful. This one was one of the less expensive of their hotels and it was good value.

review.title: Hotels near Union Square

review.title: Getaway Weekend
review.reviewText: The Serrano Hotel is a Kimpton hotel. Kimpton takes older properties and upgrades them. The only real drawback is that older hotels have smaller rooms than more modern hotels. Our room was a queen bed, desk, chair, TV cabinet and one night stand. The room was adequate and comfortable but small. The staff at every Kimpton hotel we have stayed at are over the top hospitable and go out of their way to help. Overall we had a pleasant stay and would choose the Serrano Hotel again if the price was right.
review.negativeRemarks: Room size

review.title: Great location pet friendly

review.title: Great for couples

review.title: Great Location Hotel

they were very informative and accommodating. We look forward to a future stay at
the Serrano Hotel.

review.title: Great hotel

Great hotel. I loved that the hotel allows dogs. Saturday morning in the lobby when I was enjoying coffee I was able to pet several well behaved dogs.

review.title: Call this "Last resort" hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel wants to charge you for everything that comes standard with others and expedia customers should expect to hear that because that was their excuse. You are also in the very last block that one would feel safe to walk from. This would be the buffer hotel between the undesirable and better hotels. Lastly, the pictures of the hotel must have been taken 30 years ago because it's pretty run down. I would not recommend this one.
review.positiveRemarks: They did have a wine from 5-6 o'clock but I think that's so one doesn't look too closely at the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: It really looked tired and run down everywhere.
review.locationRemarks: We overheard someone say not to go on the other side of the building.

review.title: Nice hotel in Nob Hill but a little dirty.
review.reviewText:
We were pleasantly surprised by this hotel. It's not in the best part of town, but it's a great retreat from the noise.

When we got to our room, we found hairs on the towels. There were basic cleanliness problems. But it was nice - the bathrobes indicate someone has a sense of humor!

Speaking of noise, we couldn't hear much from the outside at all (unlike other reviews I've seen). However, we could hear people in the hallway pretty clearly.
review.negativeRemarks: Thin walls, cleanliness problemss.
review.locationRemarks: Dirty area. Some great ethnic restaurants (Indian, Thai, Vietnamese) nearby.

review.title: Nicely upgraded hotel
review.reviewText: Great location to Union Square and catching the cable car. Room was clean and comfortable, the bed also. A wine reception is also a bonus. Would definitely book again.

review.title: Decent hotel, friendly staff in a handy location
review.reviewText:
We stayed at this hotel for 5 days last week, with the missus and I and our 3 year old daughter.

We had a standard queen room, I think it was, with two queen beds. The rooms are pretty small - I would equate them to New York sizes - but they were well laid out and nicely decorated. Personally I found the beds a little soft, but my preference is for a hard mattress, so probably most people would like it. The hotel overall is in pretty good condition - a few knocks and scrapes here and there that prevent a 5 star review, but generally it's in good order.

The staff were great. Helpful, courteous and efficient.

The free wi-fi in the lobby and in the rooms was a plus as well, although it wasn't super fast. I'm not sure you could have streamed a movie for example.

The free drinks reception in the evenings was a very nice touch, as was the tea and coffee in the morning. We did have breakfast in the adjoining bar, and it was OK but overpriced for a breakfast I thought.

The area the hotel is in is a little hit and miss. If you go out of the hotel and turn right it doesn't take long before you hit a shady area. If you go straight ahead or left you'll be absolutely fine. I thought it was in a great location for access to Union Square and all of the connections from there.
review.positiveRemarks: Free drinks reception, free wi-fi, location for Union Square
review.negativeRemarks: Location to the right of the hotel, soft beds, average breakfast

review.title: Not what I thought it would be.
review.reviewText: Everything in our room was really old. The furniture was very old and very used. I felt like I was in my great grandmas guest room. It also smelled like a good will. I hated it and will never go back. The bathroom was terrible. There was no counter space so I had to sit on the floor in front of the mirror in the hall to do my make up. This place is in serious need of an update. I seriously have no idea why this hotel has high ratings. I feel like I was fooled. I was very disappointed to say the least.
review.positiveRemarks: The entry room to the hotel was pretty neat.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom, the furniture, the floors, and the walls. Very old and not in a good way.
review.locationRemarks: Union square is about a block away. Lots of shopping and places to eat with in walking distance.

review.title: Great to visit again
review.reviewText:
This is the second time we have stayed here and I wasn't disappointed. It was our honeymoon so our room was upgraded so we were on a higher floor and also had a huge bed. My only complaint was that the bathroom was tiny compared to last time which I wasn't expecting with an upgrade so was slightly disappointed by that.

The staff were lovely and we both enjoyed the hosted wine reception, it added a special extra touch to it.

review.title: sweet suite
review.reviewText: We stayed one night in the suite and it was really nice. The suite was a bit smaller than I had expected but was beautiful and comfortable. The bathroom was spacious and very clean. One thing that I wasn't too crazy about but was no big deal, but I am big on decor so I'll just throw it out there was the theme of the room is theater so we had the Wizard of Oz blown up portraits in the room, the wicked witch portrait over the bed and glenda the good witch in the bathroom. It was just slightly weird to have these blown up portraits staring at you will you sleep and use the toilet haha...but like I said such a small thing. Other than that I loved it and I would definitely come back
review.positiveRemarks: love the bedroom separated by the curtains and the theater chairs and the mirror is the shower
review.negativeRemarks: pull out bed was uncomfortable- need to get a new mattress or a thin mattress pad.
review.locationRemarks: right in the middle of it all

review.title: Ideal local and good value for money
review.reviewText: Ideal location for Union Square and car rental pick up point. Good value for money with so much competition very nearby (Hilton, Best Westin etc).
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Union Square
review.userLocation: Newcastle Upon Tyne, Tyne and Wear, UK

review.title: great hotel for visiters
review.reviewText: This hotel is near downtown SF. good service and nice envirement. I like it. but a litter bit expensive

review.title: Won't stay here again
review.reviewText:
We stayed here for one night. The room smelled like smoke. When I informed the front desk they said that they would use an air purifier while we were out to help get rid of the smell. Either it didn't work or it wasn't really done. Room was very small and noisy even though we were on the 14th flr., we heard ambulances all night. There is an AC in the room but it didn't work.

Most of the staff were friendly and helpful. We were
offered a free continental breakfast to compensate us for the awful room smell. They also waived the additional parking fees for exceeding the daily parking time limit.

We will not stay here again. The room was far below expectations.
review.locationRemarks: Location was okay, a few blocks from Union Square but close to Tenderloin District.

review.title: leave your heart in san francisco at another hotel
review.reviewText:
walls are paper thin and was woken up every night at 3am by people next door who liked to talk for two or three hours

rooms/bathrooms very small for price and hard to move around in

review.title: Mediocre...which is what I paid for
review.reviewText: Okay hotel if you have to stay in Union Square. Nice shower, comfotable bed, but old feel.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location, great staff, bits of the hotel are a little old but it makes the hotel different. Really good and quiet hotel close to union square
review.negativeRemarks: Tv positioning was bad
review.locationRemarks: Great location near union square and transport

review.title: A very nice and pleasant hotel
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed a week at this hotel and were really happy with it. The hotel is well located, close to restaurants with good prices, as well as fast food restaurants. One block has a recognized brand pharmacy that sells everything, which was very useful. Close to good shops, a subway station several blocks away. Speaking of the hotel: the lobby is lovely antique. They offer very good complimentary coffee in the morning: exquisite and also have the newspaper of the day. In the afternoons offer complimentary wine, also very good, and can be shared with other guests. In the lobby they can always find fresh water. The room was spectacular, an excellent bed, a very good maid service. The toilet in our room we found rather uncomfortable (misplaced), but the shower and the towels were excellent. The hotel staff was friendly, courteous and collaborators.
review.positiveRemarks: The morning coffee, the comfort of bed and wine, aaahh and bath robe
review.negativeRemarks: The toilet in our room was poorly located and was rather uncomfortable to use.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent.

review.title: Pleasant San Francisco Hotel
review.reviewText: Very pleasant, knowledegeable staff. Nice, clean, comfortable room. Close to Union Square and theatre district. Just be cautious you don't turn right, as you're also on the border of the Tenderloin district. Tasty, innovative menu and good draught on tap. Complimentary glass of wine in the casually elegant lobby. No hesitation to recommend the Serrano.

review.title: Great Hotel in Union Square area
review.reviewText: Convenient location. Friendly and accommodating staff.

Great hotel. Location is really good lots of nice little bars and restaurants near by and easy access to public transport. There is a few homeless around the streets but they dont bother you at all. The rooms a very comfy and the staff are very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Quality hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: I took my teenage son to San Francisco. We really liked this hotel. While the neighborhood to the south isn't great (lots of homeless people), I still felt safe walking around. None of them bothered us. The hotel is in a great location, close to bus lines, the Bart and cable cars. Also close to Union Square and Market Street shops, and lots of restaurants. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: great hotel.
review.reviewText: VERY GOD LOCATION, FRIENDLY STAFF, NO PARKING LOT OR GARAGE, PARKING ARROUND THE CORNER FOR $32 A DAY. Conecction with the pub through the hotel lobby. Nice.

review.title: Close to tourist buses
review.reviewText: The room we stayed in was a little small and cramped but very clean. The hotel is well located; close to tour buses, trolleys and shopping area.

review.title: We loved this place!
review.reviewText:
We booked our room for our honeymoon online not knowing what to expect. When we arrived we were blown away at all of the decor and the service we were given. We were upgraded to a bigger room and were surprised with a knock on the door with complimentary wine and the kindest note!! We definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. Thank you Serrano Hotel for making our honeymoon a memorable one!

Sincerely,
the happy newlyweds!

review.title: Great hotel at a reasonble price
review.reviewText: Room was clean, hotel staff were very helpful. The 2 double beds is not very roomy for a family of 4. Hotel was clean throughout. Location was very close to Union Square. Parking was expensive, in general, parking in San Fran is expensive. Overall, we had a great stay and would return to this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Pets allowed

review.title: Cute and charming little hotel
review.reviewText: The Serrano meets everything I look for...clean rooms, comfy beds, awesome location, and a very friendly and helpful staff. Yes, this is an older hotel...the room was quite small and the bathroom could use a facelift, but when in San Francisco all you really need is a safe and comfy place to sleep! This was a great location to explore the city...three blocks from public transportation but we mostly walked everywhere (and got a great workout thanks to those SF hills!) free coffee and tea in the mornings and a cocktail hour every night were especially awesome! Only negative is that we couldn't take advantage of the free bike rentals that they offer because one of the bikes was broken...

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText:
The location of this hotel is great, close to bus and trolly routes. There are a lot of places to eat close by which is also a plus. The free coffee in the morning was a wonderful perk and it was great to have the free wine tasting in the afternoon.

I was not satisfied with the room we were in. This may have just been the room we received and all rooms may not be like this, but I was very disappointed in the lack of counter space in the bathroom. I also did not like how the TV stand was not directly accross from the bed.

Other than that, the room was fine. Make sure to sign up for the Kimpton club, it is completely free and you get free WiFi and $10 from the mini bar!
review.positiveRemarks: Bed was comfortable, free coffee in the AM.
review.negativeRemarks: Lack of counter space in the bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Location was perfect!

review.title: good location
review.reviewText:
The hotel is old, but generally clean. It is well located as far as shopping, restaurants and public transportation are concerned. 10 min walk from the BART and main cable car line.
The daily wine reception is a nice touch.
review.negativeRemarks: the tenderloin neighbourhood next door is a little sketchy.

review.title: Great hotel at a good price
review.reviewText: What a nice surprise to find a quaint, clean boutique hotel in downtown San Francisco. The concierge was very helpful with touring hints but it is close to a bad section of SFf
review.negativeRemarks: Location

review.title: Great hotel, central location
review.reviewText: Came for two days for a nice weekend trip with my gf, the room was clean, it had all the modern amenities needed, service great.

review.title: One of the best quality rate in the US
review.reviewText: One of the best quality rate we got in the US. Room were clean and beautiful, staff very pleasant and giving good tips to visit the area, free coffee / tea in the morning and wine in the afternoon!! I really recommend that place.
review.positiveRemarks: The room decoration, noise insulation, mattress
review.negativeRemarks: The location
review.locationRemarks: Not the best part of the city but close to everything

review.title: "Comfortable, charming, well-located, good value"
review.reviewText: My daughter and I had a wonderful experience at the Serrano - it is very well located, and convenient to everything we wanted to see in San Francisco. Our room was charming and comfortable. The staff was uniformly attentive and helpful - everyone from front desk staff to bell captain to housekeeper was warm and service-oriented. It was also a good value - it was about the mid-point for lodging price in downtown San Francisco. We would absolutely stay there again and would recommend it to friends.
review.positiveRemarks: The central location and charming decor
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms somewhat tiny; elevators small and older
review.locationRemarks: Excellent - very convenient to ACT, shopping, galleries, public transportation

review.title: A big "UP" for the Serano Hotel
review.reviewText: The good old Serrano Hotel, San Francisc. A wine reception on arrival, small but well appointed rooms and friendly staff. What more can you ask for?
review.positiveRemarks: Our room was very clean, tastefully decorated and well fitted out. The ensuite was also very clean, a bit small, but fit for purpose.
review.negativeRemarks: The proximity of the hotel to the Tenderloin area!
review.locationRemarks: The location was ideal for access to Union Square. I would recommend catching an open top bus from the Square to familiarise yourself with the city.

review.title: Kimpton San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location (only a few minutes walk from Union Square), is good value, and the staff are friendly. The rooms are not very big, and not best suited for business (limited desk space). The decor is a bit tired, and could do with some refurbishment. But overall, it is a good hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms are in need of refurbishment

review.title: Overall good experience
review.reviewText: Good location. Nice overall. Worked out fine for my needs. Wine reception was nice. very nice staff

review.title: Good hotel for a couple or a family
review.reviewText: Nice hotel for a couple or even a family. The staff was very friendly and helpful! I'd recommend this hotel to a friend.
review.positiveRemarks: Map in the lobby with restaurant suggestions. Found a cool restaurant just by looking at the map one day! Easy to get shuttle service to/from airport.
review.locationRemarks: Taylor street south of the hotel was a bit rundown/sketchy. But this was not a huge issue and Taylor street can be avoided if you want to avoid it.

review.title: Old Beauty
review.reviewText: Beautiful old hotel. I was a little disappointed with the size of the bathroom but it was understandable because of the age of the building. The beds were very comfortable. I think I would have had a more positive experience if it were not for the negative attitude of a few staff members (doorman and reservation clerk). The concierge Sephen, was such a gentleman and so helpful, he almost makes it worth staying here again all on his own. Also, one of the best thins about this hotel is that it is only 1 block from Happy Donut, the best doughnuts ever.
review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful Lobby, comfortable beds, helpful concierge.
review.negativeRemarks: Rude doorman and snobby reservation clerk.
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Close to Chinatown and trolley stops.

review.title: Serrano Hotel
review.reviewText: AWESOME boutique hotel! Wine tasting 5-6pm everyday. Log on to Facebook to find their secret word for free items. Recommend to anyone!
review.positiveRemarks: Visual appeal, wine tasting, gym, location, staff. Clubs just around the corner....
review.negativeRemarks: Parking, no discount for guests.
review.locationRemarks: Your in the middle of everthing.

review.title: review
review.reviewText: Nice location. Great feel to the place. Room was clean. My room was very small and the window looked out on to a brick wall which was pretty disappointing. Staff very nice and helpful.

review.title: Vacation trip
review.reviewText: We stayed one night in this hotel. The hotel staff was very helpful and courteous. I enjoyed this place, and it was within walking distance to restaurants. The only downside is that there is very little shelf space in the bathroom, but overall I would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff and the atmosphere of the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom shelf space
review.locationRemarks: Convenient and close to restaurants

review.title: In a nutshell
review.reviewText: Cute boutique hotel, maintenance on the facility is minimal. Fixtures and appliances are out dated. Rooms are small but serviceable, bathrooms are tiny with 0 counter space. If you are planning on staying somewhere just for fun it would be ok, if you are planning on staying in a place to enjoy and maybe work a bit think again. Minimal outlets/plugs/work space. In room iHome docking was not working, desk was small and cramped, entertainment console was limiting the room.
review.positiveRemarks: Cute, colors and feel make it slightly more B&B-ish not quite so chain influenced.
review.negativeRemarks: Inefficient, bathroom. HATED it!
review.locationRemarks: Very central, great walk to Union Square

review.title: Great weekend trip!
review.reviewText: Great experience here! Employees were all very friendly and helpful. My only complaint would be the cleanliness of the sheets in the hotel initially, but were replaced. Hosted wine reception was amazing!

review.title: union square weekend
review.reviewText: location is great. close to union square and chinatown as well as market street.

review.title: Retro charm
review.reviewText: This place is has Old World charm that makes me think of the nicest hotel in a foreign city. That is meant as high praise; I prefer places with the character of culture over the latest contemporary (and cold) expressions of trendy architects.
review.positiveRemarks: Ornamentation of the lobby, quirky personality associated with the Kimpton hotel themes, fun yet dignified personality of the staff.
review.negativeRemarks: None.
review.locationRemarks: An easy couple of blocks walk to the downtown / Union Square locations, cable cars, and the Hop On - Hop Off tour bus stop.

managementResponses.response: thanks for your comments, it's true we are not right on the square but it's only because we don't want to tempt anyone with the awesome shopping! :)

review.title: Good solid hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: So it's not right on Union Square, but it's only a few blocks. They have friendly valet parking which I've used a few times. The attached restaurant is pretty good, and is making some really interesting cocktails. The hotel itself is pretty typical Kimpton; it's nice, clean, and professional without feeling like you're in a giant chain. Considering the price and the area, it's a great value.

review.title: Carol anf Fred's stay.
review.reviewText: Love the attitude of friendliness and location. The rooms were cozy and clean. The beds comfortable and loved the shower.

review.title: Good place for business or leisure
review.reviewText: Good location not far from Union Square. On the edge of a less than wonderful area, but a very good value for the price.

review.title: General review
review.reviewText: Very clean and comfortable room. Good location.Shame that breakfast is not included.
review.negativeRemarks: No breakfast included but complimentary tea and coffee in the mornings is nice.
review.locationRemarks: Good. Near union square and tram stops.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText:
The staff are great. The hotel is in a very good position. The hotel needs updating. Wallpaper peeling off the walls etc. Very little space for hanging up your clothes, OK if you are only staying a night or two but difficult if there are two of you staying for a week.
The wine tasting of an evening is great. Gives you a chance to socialise with other guests.
review.positiveRemarks: friendliness of staff and great location
review.negativeRemarks: hotel looks tired and needs a facelift
review.locationRemarks: excellent location. Close to shops and trams

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms are a bit small
review.locationRemarks: Its San Francisco, near the public transportation, union square, shopping, but also some shady places

review.title: not terrible...
review.reviewText:
We stayed at Hotel Serrano for 3 nights for a weekend getaway. The hotel boasts nightly complimentary wine reception from 6-7 which was a nice welcome. The concierge and desk staff are all very kind and helpful. The lobby is quaint and nice.

We stayed in room 315. Third floor. We weren't expecting much but a clean place to sleep at night. If this is all you are expecting then you will not be disappointed! We weren't. The room was small and awkwardly furnished. The door opens into the armoire. If you are obese you would have trouble getting into this room.

The bathroom was small but clean. The bed is very soft, maybe a little too soft but we slept well because we were so tired. There was little street noise but we did have the ice room next to us which was loud but not often enough to be a problem.

Room service prices were outrageous. Expected so we ordered out. Overall, it was a nice stay. Close to shopping. There is a walgreens up the block. If you don't mind a few beggers! They are everywhere!

Would stay again for a short trip.

review.title: Serrano Hotel Review
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay. The hotel was clean, quiet, and comfortable. The staff was friendly and the complimentary Wine Reception was very enjoyable. When we return to San Francisco we will stay at this hotel again.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly Staff, Clean, Quiet, Wine Reception.
review.locationRemarks: Good Central Location.

review.title: There, there
review.reviewText: Location, location, and the welcoming hospitality of Kimpton Hotels!
review.positiveRemarks: Great corner room with a view of storm clouds and sun.
review.negativeRemarks: The lighting in the room was awkward for reading
review.locationRemarks: Very near Union Square + shopping. Walk Johnny Foley's on St. Pat's to hear the fabulous Skindivers play covers of 60's and 70's.

review.title: Accommodating, convenient and comfortable
review.reviewText: Staff were very friendly and helpful. Location is a short walk from Union Square and very convenient to public transport options. Very comfortable bed, clean room and could open window a little to allow fresh air should we want it. I stayed in a twin room - a little cramped. Room was quite small but was fine for our purpose and affordable option compared to other hotels. Would return to this hotel.

review.title: We did NOT receive what we paid for
review.reviewText: Serrano Hotel website stated how accommodating they would be with our pets. "Food and water bowls and a dog bed placed in your room for use during your stay. Treats, bottled water and plastic pick-up bags for great San Francisco walks. List of pet-sitting, walking and grooming services and neighborhood pet resources" but when we arrived, nothing was in the room. When I mentioned how I was disappointed, the front desk lady said there must be a full house with pets that I should have requested those items prior of my stay. I did register our pets, TWICE, online and even if we didn't register the pets, the website says they would provide those items before we even arrived! After my complaint, we requested 3 bowls, only received 2. We used a cup in place of the 3rd bowl. I was very disappointed in the quality of the hotel and room. The knobs on the bathroom and closet were about to come off and there was scuffs and marks all over the walls. The area was filled with bums. The only good thing about the hotel they offer hosted wine everyday 5-6 and coffee/tea in the mornings. The price of the room was way too high for what we received overall.
review.locationRemarks: Bums around every corner of the building.

review.title: Very pleased and would return...
review.reviewText:
We were pleasantly greeted upon arrival and our check-in was smooth. Our room, a standard Queen, was on the small side, but ample. The bed and bedding were fantastic.
The decor was very pleasant.

We only had two areas with our room that we noticed could have been better. The TV, safe, minibar, etc was housed in a large armoire. A small section on the end was hanging space for clothes. At the bottom of the hanging space was the iron, another pillow and umbrella. So, items we did not need to hang remained in our suitcases.
Our other disappointment was lack of space for toiletries in the bathroom. An extra shelf or two on any of the walls would have been great.

The staff was very friendly and helpful and we did not have any issues with our stay. We would definitely recommend this hotel to our friends.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed and bedding were so comfortable. A great night's sleep every night.
review.negativeRemarks: Lack of hanging space for clothes and very limited shelf space in the bathroom.
review.locationRemarks:
On the edge of the Tenderloin - no problem we walked freely day and night and
never had concerns. This was a great central location for everything.

review.title: Comfortable and fun boutique hotel!
review.reviewText: Overall this was a great little boutique hotel, would definitely stay there again!

review.title: Clean and comfortable, location ok
review.reviewText:
OK location in San Fran and we got a good deal for our room.
The room was rather small, we even only had one bed side table, though another could have fit.
The coffee and tea in the mornings was great for when you were on your way out, would be nice to have tea and coffee facilities in the room for other times.
Bellhop was helpful and even reduced the price of a car to the airport for us.
The hotel restaurant is the pub connected to the building, ok in the night, but probably not for families.
The hotel is on the edge of what seems the dodgy end of town, alot of drunks on the street and reasonable restaurants at least few blocks away. Though it was close to transport and a large shopping centre
review.positiveRemarks: location for our sightseeing and shopping
review.locationRemarks: the area it is in isn't the nicest part of town, hard to find nice restaurants nearby.

review.title: Say "stretch out on the rack" and mean it
review.reviewText: Room was nice enough and fairly well equipped. Desk and bell staff were friendly and helpful. Maid service good. The in-house restaurant is overcrowded by night, empty by day, always over-priced, and seems to have slow to inattentive service. Room came with a minibar key, but the "bar" had already been broken open. Oddly enough, the in-room safe is inside the minibar. This didn't seem to cause any problem,s but does make me wonder why they have a key. The bath was roomy and had no shortage of hot water, and plenty of towels. The bed, however, was rather like a medieval torture rack; a thing of iron wires and spikes designed to punish the body and deprive the brain of sleep. While it had nice linens, the pillows were not quite right: either slippery poofs half-filled with down and feather, or solid cotton logs compression-stuffed into pillowcases. My head needs more than one inch of support and much less than fourteen for comfort.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is good, price was decent, staff was friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: The bed. Definitely, the bed. Heater was rather noisy, as well
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to Powell BART/MUNI station, Union Square shopping and eateries. Yet not inundated with the Union Square homeless.

photos.caption: Nice view of the area, plenty of light

review.title: Perfectly happy with my stay...
review.reviewText: Smallish room on the 11th floor offered good light and was perfectly suitable for my one-night stay on business in the city. I had business in the financial district and chose this hotel over closer ones because of free internet (must sign up for the Kimpton loyalty program to get it) and the nicer boutique format.
review.locationRemarks: Not quite as close to the financial district as I might have liked, but convenient to Bart and Union Square.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great historic hotel in downtown sf. One of the nicer SF hotels I have stayed in for the price.
review.locationRemarks: Good central location in SF, not close to any one thing but a less than $10 cab ride to most places.

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: It is in a great location and the hotel staff were extremely helpful and friendly.

review.title: Serrano Hotel review
review.reviewText: Good location small but elegant rooms restaurant on premises
review.locationRemarks: Downtown convenient to everything

review.title: Lovely weekend getaway destination
review.reviewText: We thoroughly enjoyed our weekend getaway at the Serrano Hotel. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful, and slthough we arrived around 5 pm on a Friday night, there was no waiting to check in. We arrived just in time for the hotel's complimentary hosted wine tasting from 5-6 pm. The location is central to many fun weekend activities, either by foot or by taxi. Within walking distance to Union Square (a real plus during the holidays), a short cab ride from Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39, not to mention nearby restaurants to satisfy any culinary craving. A charming boutique hotel that we would definitely recommend!

review.title: Leisure Trip
review.reviewText:
Rooms need a little more TLC i.e, repaint baseboards and trim, very dirty and worn. Cramped bathrooms. Quiet.

Service was outstanding in every aspect -- A+ Friendly & attentive staff. We will return.

review.title: nice escape after business
review.reviewText: Comfortable retreat from business. Nice to stay in a hotel with character. Made me feel at home. Bellman really went out of his way to help with a transportation issue. Easy to access public transportation. Overall friendly atmosphere.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square due to proximity to shopping, dining, great little cafes, arts, and easy access to other points.

review.title: Great place for a theatre weekend
review.reviewText: The hotel was very convenient to restaurants and theaters. And love the discounted parking for hybrid vehicles!

review.title: Great Hotel for Union Square
review.reviewText:
I stayed at the Kimpton Serrano for 3 days while I was up in San Francisco running the Nike Women's Marathon. The location is great, a few blocks from Union Square and the Powell BART stop.

The staff was super friendly and accomodating. The room I was in was very clean and a nice size for me, but I would have expected a bit more luxury for the price.

review.title: Small. Quaint. Cozy.
review.reviewText: A downtown sanctuary after a long day.

review.title: Highly recommended
review.reviewText: I was very pleased with the Serrano Hotel. Everyone was very courteous, and the room was quitecomfortable. I slept like a baby. I particularly enjoyed the wine reception every evening. I would certainly recommend this hotel and will stay there again if I ever return to San Francisco.
review.locationRemarks: Downtown. You can get around much faster by walking. And if you enjoy a good trek up a steep hill, climb up to Nob Hill.

review.title: Lovely hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Serrano Hotel was just what we wanted after a 13-hour flight from Australia. The staff were lovely, the room cosy and the location was perfect for us – just down the road from Union Square.

review.title: I would go back to this hotel
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed my stay at the Serrano. The hotel staff was really friendly. The neighborhood was decent, and easy to get around town to and from the hotel.

review.title: I loved the Serono a Kimpton hotel, clean friendly fun!
review.reviewText: Thannk you for the great time at the Serano, a Kimpton hotel! My room was cute and clean. The wine hour was generous and an opportunity to meet interesting people! I plan to stay in Kimton hotels every chance I get!

review.title: Would recommend it to everyone!
review.reviewText: The Serrano hotel exceeded all of my expectations. I work in the hotel business which makes me very critical when it comes to other hotels. Being my first time in San Francisco, this hotel was centrally located and convenient, only two blocks from Union Square! We attempted to check in earlier than 12pm even though we knew check in wasn't until 3. The front desk agent was very polite and let us know that they didn't have any rooms available at the time but they would have them available around 2:30 - 3pm. We were not surprised and left our luggage with the bellman and toured the city. Upon check in, we were greeted by a new front desk agent who was also very amiable. He offered to have our luggage delivered to our room and let us know of the amenities the hotel offered. By the way, they offer complimentary wine tasting every evening in the lobby for an hour. The room was gorgeous, cozy and very clean. They even had bathrobes in the room for us to use. Housekeeping was extremely nice. The bellmen were very helpful when it came to recommending places to dine and nightlife options. I loved the decor as well. I had the best time in San Francisco and needless to say, the Serrano hotel influenced my experience greatly. I can't wait to go back and possibly stay at this hotel or another Kimpton Hotel.

review.title: good time
review.reviewText: Lovely wine reception, functional & ugly breakfst room, small guest room would have liked another chair.

review.title: Lovely Stay
review.reviewText: The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. nice tv. It may be a little small for multiple people, I was by myself though and always out on the town. The bathroom was clean and so was the room. That's all I care about. :)

review.title: Definitely going back
review.reviewText:
The hotel location was very central. Given some time we were able to walk to most other neighbourhoods (Chinatown, Japantown, Fisherman's Warf, North Beach). Its best to avoid the tenderloin neighbourhood on which the hotel borders.The hotel service was for the most part excellent! Staff were always very helpful in providing directions or answering questions. My only criticism is that it would be helpful if staff were more in-the-know about good places to eat or get a drink around the hotel. For example, staff were unaware of the funky Bourbon and Branch, a throwback to a 1920s speakeasy, located just around the corner from the hotel. A couple times we were also directed to places that had closed down or staff gave us the wrong address entirely. That being said, MOST of the staff were able to look up and give excellent and accurate directions.
The complimentary wifi was extremely helpful as we brought a laptop to plan our days or to purchase online tickets to events such as a Giants game.
We loved the complimentary wine hour! It was a great way to meet fellow guests and share ideas/advice on what to see and do around town. The 6-speed bikes provided by the hotel were fantastic and a great way to get around town for those who prefer some exercise over taxi or public transit. We particularly enjoyed using the bikes to go through Golden Gate Park and over the Golden Gate Bridge. In addition, the gym facility was excellent for a small hotel!
Can't wait to go back!

review.title: Downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: Very charming hotel. Nice experience

review.title: This hotel will nickel and dime you
review.reviewText:
Location: Not bad. They will tell you to stay away from a particular area near the hotel because it is unsafe. The hotel is a few blocks from the trolley but I would recommend a hotel closer to the Market/Powell trolley stop, because that will take you just about anywhere you want to go.

Hotel quality: The rooms are tiny but I think that is normal for San Francisco. The beds are nice and the bathroom is well-equipped.

My issue: I needed to print a few pages on my last day there. I had a memory stick, so I didn't need the internet or anything. The only way I could print them was if I "rented" the use of their computer. They only do 15 minute intervals, so although I only used the computer for 2-3 minutes, they charged me $15 to use the computer PLUS 50 cents per page to print. The front desk gave me the manager's email to inquire about this outrageous fee but she did not reply to me.

The only other issue I had was that a wine glass in our room had lipstick stains on it. When we asked the front desk for a new one, they said they didn't have any. Very odd for a hotel with a nightly wine reception.

Overall, would not stay here again.

review.title: Good Value
review.reviewText: Room was nice size; but bathroom was on the small size. No counter space. Restaurant was being renovated and buffet was very mediocre with poor service, only one cup of coffee. Loved the wine reception and location was convenient to Union Square. Lovely, older hotel.

review.title: We were very pleased, we can't wait to go back again.The
review.reviewText: The location of de Hotel is very convenient, close to everything.It's in downtown.the workers a the hotel are very helpfuland very accomodating everyone. When we first arrived it was a way before cheking time and they gave us a room where we stayed for a few hours to wash up and rest until our room is ready, very nice people. We were very pleased.

review.title: Great SF boutique hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: Great boutique hotel with great lobby, friendly staff, and beautifully decorated and comfortable room. Highly recommended. One great plus -- the windows are doubled paned so the street noise is almost nonexistent. This is very important in the Union Square area because it can get pretty loud at night time, even in the more expensive hotels.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The room was small. The shower curtain didn't repel water, so the floor was covered in water after a shower. The ceiling in the bathroom looked like it had mildew.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText:
I booked a Queen room but unfortunately it was part of an adjoining room which had a door locked that led to the next room. There were children in the room next door. I asked to be moved to a quiet room. The front desk moved me to a quiet room but it was a double room and had no view. However, it was quiet.
