I did ask when I booked to have a quiet room, so this request was ignored. It would be better customer service if the front desk checked requests and did not have to move a guest in the middle of the night.
Overall, the front desk did move me to another room.

review.title: Ghost of James Thurber
review.reviewText: Extra points for character--the hotel has a comfortable, ornate lobby with murals and deep green and red velvet couches, staff who feel like they've worked there forever, an Addams-familyish kind of place where you expect to see cats. Liked the evening wine hour, because you meet the other guests. Surprisingly okay exercise room. Great area to stay in, reasonable price. Professionalism and quality of the booking system, billing, etc. not up to 4-star chain hotel standards, but a great place for a family on holiday. Friendly to dogs.

review.title: Cool place for the price
review.reviewText: The Serrano hotel was pretty nice place to stay at for the price I paid. We had the executive suite, it was very comfortable and had a nice view! The only downfall to this hotel is the location. If you are coming back from a night out you should be careful. Then again most of the city is like that. Overall though the hotel was great.

review.title: Nicely Renovated early 20th century hotel
review.reviewText:
The hotels really makes you feel like you in a movie from the 1930's. The only problem I had was the neighborhood, It was on the edge, but not in, the Tenderloin. You can avoid the TL not walking south on Taylor. It may seem a little dicey for some travelers. That is not enough to keep me from recommending this hotel, however.
I stayed in a Luxury Suite and hosted a small party there.
It is a fun place to stay.

review.title: Lovely hotel
review.reviewText:
The hotel was easy to find. The wifi was perfect. The hotel was clean, bath and shower worked. Windows opened. It's within walking distance to Macy's and all the shops.

I did the tour to go to wine country and the concierge helped me book to stay for a few nights in Sonoma. Did you know you can go on the wine tour and get dropped off at a town called Sonoma? It was an unusual request as most people just do the tour for the day. I did the tour 2 years ago and loved the town, so I decided to stay for a few days.

Also I learnt you can catch a bus to Sausalito from San Francisco from the tourist bureau located in the city. There is also a local bus you can catch from Sausalito to Muir woods. Enjoy San Fran but also get out and explore the surrounding areas.

review.title: Overall it is a good hotel
review.reviewText: Every aspect is good except parking. I park in the public parking lot and it is 36 for one day.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: The Serrano Hotel is excellent for first time visitors to San Fran. Two minutes from all of the shops in Union Square, and a nice 20 minute walk to the Ferry Building, this hotel is in a great location for visitors. The hotel adds several nice touches, such as the 5pm wine hour each night and the coffee and pastries in the morning. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful throughout the stay. I would definitely return to this hotel.

review.title: Terrible customer service, very unsatisfied!
review.reviewText: I wouldn't'my go back.

review.title: Charming decor and welcoming staff
review.reviewText: Room was clean, simple and well layed out. Bed was very comfortable. Staff was friendly and helpful.

review.title: San Francisco - Union Square
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice, clean and convenient. Unfortunately, due to remodelling the restaurant was closed but there are plenty of places to go within a block or two. My only real complaint is that it is located on the outer fringes of the Union Square district and just a block or so away the neighborhood was not as nice.

review.title: Would Stay Here Again
review.reviewText: My husband and I recently spent 4 days at the Serrano. The location was excellent with easy access to buses, streetcars and cablecar. The hotel was old, but very nicely upkept and clean. The afternoon complimentary wine in the lobby was a nice touch. The staff were very helpful with our queries regarding local attractions. The restaurant was still undergoing renovations - I am sure it will be very nice when completed as they appear to be doing a `gut job`. We would recommend this hotel to friends and family who want something a bit different from a large impersonal chain.

review.title: we will be back again.
review.reviewText: the staff are so friendly and helpful. the location is very good just within walking distance to union square, cable car station and shopping area. we are very happy to stay in this hotel and will definitely recommend to our friends.

review.title: Klimpton is Solid
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, good location, and priced right. I enjoyed it.

review.title: love this hotel.I had such a great time.
review.reviewText: I hope I can live there. It is such a special and beautiful place . They have the most polite and friendly people working there. This is definitely the hotel to live when I am in san francisco next time. Thank you, Kimpton!

review.title: Nice boutique hotel in Union Square area
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at the Serrano Hotel. Though it is on the border of the Tenderloin district of S.F. we felt safe and appreciated the intimacy and warm inviting environment that this small (by S.F.standards), hotel offered. Our travel companions were across the street at the Hilton and that hotel was large and impersonal. Our room was cleaned immediately after we left each morning. We enjoyed the free coffee each morning and evening wine reception.

review.title: wonderful place to stay and great buy
review.reviewText:
Classy, very comfortable and pleasant and helpful hotel. Great price thru Expedia too.
Neighborhood is a little dicey at night-- it's in the Tenderloin with a lot of
massage parlors but if that doesn't bother you-- it doesn't seem to be
dangerous--there is nothing comparable for the price.

review.title: nice hotel, currently under renovation
review.reviewText:
We stayed there for 2 nights in late April, the hotel was great. At first we were confused by the heavily discounted rate we found, but I believe that could be explained by the fact that the hotel is undergoing renovations. There was a note in our room letting us know that there might be some work being done on the windows between 9 am and 5 pm but we didn't hear a thing.

The room was very cute, super comfortable bed and high quality toiletries.

Hotel is in a very central location, but not my fav San Fran neighbourhood. Right near the Powell St cable car turnaround and the BART.

We lucked out and got a corner room and enjoyed 2 glasses of complimentary wine on our arrival.

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: Clean, friendly, and great location.

review.title: It was Dreadful! Wish I could move in!
review.reviewText: From the doorman to the maids, the exterior to the bathroom fixtures, all were more than pleasing to the eye and certainly to the pocketbook. The Serano was more than comfortable for my choosy needs. Old and modern blended together in a city of juxtapositions. A lobby to die for, a bed more comfortable than my own. A staff at my beckon call and a locale that was seconds to Union Square and minutes to Market street. Even when I had to walk through the Tenderloin, one of the Bellmen drew me a walking map for safe passage to my destination. I'll be back. So should you.

review.title: Nice place to stay for a couple nights
review.reviewText: The Serrano was a nice place for my family and I to stay in San Francisco. We didn't spend much time in the hotel but it was a convenient location to stop and go. The rooms were small but for sleeping and using it as a pit stop it was perfect. The service was great. I was impressed by the doorman he should have been tipped more. Very polite and has a great welcoming personality. I wish I could remember his name. As I remember he works Tuesday thru Friday. We got in late Wednesday night from sight seeing and left next morning. I was surprised he was back at work or still working with the same great attitude. Give him a extra buck or two for me.

review.title: Still a great choice
review.reviewText: Haven't stayed at the Serrano for a few years, but pleased to say it is still delivering excellent service and value. The immediate area still hasn't picked up greatly, but 5 minutes gets you to Union Square or Market St if you want shopping. And of course two great breakfast joints just round the corner - Taylor St Coffee Shop and Dottie's True Blue Cafe.

review.title: Initial reaction shocked but opinion improved
review.reviewText:
I had booked the hotel for our 29th wedding anniversary. When we arrived my husband thought I was joking as the neighborhood was rundown and the entrance and facade was covered with scaffolding that we had not been alerted to. Some areas around were very seedy which I was aware from previous reviews but otherwise the hotel was central to explore the city.
Overall the staff were helpful however when we queried a tour booked by one concierge we were advised by another that we had made a grave mistake. The tour we made with Extranomical turned out to be a memorable day in Muir Redwood Park and the Sonoma wineries with a great guide.
Our holiday to San Francisco was wonderful and the hotel was in easy access of the transport system - we can recommend the 7 day Muni-pass. We also liked the evening wine-tasting which we understand is a particular feature of Kimpton hotels. We were also pleased to have coffee, tea and newspapers provided in the reception area every morning. There was also free wi-fi throughout the hotel. The rooms were on the small side but were clean and well serviced. The evening appetisers and meals in the restaurant were well presented.
The work being done in the hotel did not cause us any noise or inconvenience except for using an alternative entrance. However we feel there should have been some explanation about what was taking place before and when we arrived to prepare us.
Complete the upgrade and advise guests about the surrounding neighborhood.

review.title: Kimpton is the bomb!
review.reviewText: This beautiful hotel located just 2 blocks form Union Square and four from the top of Nob Hill was a pleasure. The room was large and comfortable with huge windows that open. The staff was extremely pleasant and they host a wine hour every evening. It was a wonderful get away close to everything with all the comforts of home.

review.title: Loved San Fran
review.reviewText: This hotel is just on the edge of the Tenderloin area. You are so close to shopping and walking distance to a lot of great places. We walked everywhere! The hotel staff are really friendly and so helpful. I would definitely stay there again. They were still doing some outside renos but it was not noisy or dusty at all. The room was a bit small but we managed. The wine reception in the evening was pretty good for a boxed wine. They had a appetizer special on too and they were really good. Try the breakfast place just down the street, Taylor Street Cafe. Be prepared to wait but well worth it.

review.title: SF in the spring
review.reviewText: Rooms nicely appointed & hotel staff very helpful.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Very good location to be able to walk to many sites

review.title: Great Stay!
review.reviewText: Great Room -- clean, convenient location. Excellent breakfast and friendly,efficient staff.

review.title: WOW!!!
review.reviewText: pretty good location, decent service, very cleanly, and had a good price at the time during construction. The decor is.. interesting. But had a good time.

review.title: good hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is good and convenient. They provide free services to travelers, like letter drop-off, printing, etc., which helped a lot.

review.title: Kimpton Hotel's Are Just Horrible
review.reviewText: 1st time shame on them, 2nd time shame on me and 3rd time I no longer need to learn the lesson that Kimpton Hotels are just horrible. First time they misplaced my tuxedo I had them send to the dry cleaner two days before an event for work at Hotel Palomar in DC, 2nd time they gave my suitcase to someone else from the baggage check and were unable to get it back at the Helix in DC, and 3rd time tonight they did not tell me when I checked in that room service and the hotel restaurant was closed as they were getting their floors cleaned. There was no sign in the lobby, no notice given at check in or in my room. I had made a reservation at a restaurant nearby but cancelled it after seeing that room service had some great items and decided to stay in and relax,watch the Oscars and order from room service as I had an early appointment for work tomorrow morning. I called at 8:30 to place my order and got a message that said they were busy and to leave a message with my order. 50 minutes go by and no food, so I call the front desk and am told that room service is closed and that they were not able to change the message because they did not have the key to the office where the machine is. What?!? Ridiculous. It was then 9:30 and all the decent restaurants near the hotel were closed as it is Sunday night and any crappy food that was available would not arrive at least for 30-45 minutes. If I had not prepaid for my stay I would switch to one of the bigger brand hotels next door.

review.title: retrofitting charm
review.reviewText:
The hotel is undergoing an external refurbishment which means lots of scaffolding, but we never experienced any work going on (it was New Year's) so it was no problem for us. The hotel lobby is very nice, although the automatic doors tend to open frequently which can leave the lobby chilly in colder weather. The afternoon hot cocoa was a nice idea.

The surrounding area was semi marginal - on one side, the Hilton, on the other, the beginning of the Tenderloin, but pretty much safe as houses. There were no more transients here than most other partsof downtown,

Overall we enjoyed our stay a lot. After all, it was a Kimpton hotel and they are always nice.

review.title: Jorge R
review.reviewText: Loved the hotel. Down side. Not much into pets in hotels

review.title: Awesome little Hotel!!!
review.reviewText: The hotel was marvelous...beautiful decor, friendly and helpful staff and the rooms were clean, and comfortable. We loved our trip. It was located right in the heart of San Fran in the nicer part of the city, so we were not worried to go out at night. And it was super easy to get from one place to another.

review.title: not impressed at all
review.reviewText: not impressed with hotel, rooms really small and parking was very expensive. Hotel was also undergoing extensive renovation, which made the overall appearance very bad. The excellent service did make up some for the poor conditions.

review.title: Satisfied in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Though bordering a scruffy part of town, the Hotel Serrano is a charming, and extremely reasonably-pricedplace to stay in San Francisco.

review.title: "I will be back"
review.reviewText: I enoyed the cozy entrance way of the hotel and the concierge service was terrific. This was my first time in S.F. so I was able to see so much and confidently knew where I was going due to the consierge service! The room was comfortable and next time I will ask for a room with windows that open. They were remodeling at this time so I do believe windows will open in most or all of the rooms. The maid service was excellent. Breakfast is busy so get there early or later! Delicious breakfast potatoes! I very much enjoyed the dinner at the Hotel restaurant. Interesting appetizers and main course. I would recommend getting a few more Ca. Red Wines on the Wine List. The Hotel is convenient to the convention center. My husband caught a shuttle across the street or you can easily walk. Walking distance to Union Square and China Town and the art galleries. Next time I will get to the museums which are close by.

review.title: Great value hotel
review.reviewText: Nice rooms, staff, clean, gym, wine tasting in evening, coffee in am. Nice little breakfast/lunch place on next block. Internet cafe and drug store also one block away.

review.title: Great location, nicely appointed room but olded building and it shows
review.reviewText:
Overall I liked the Serrano, at least for the special price I got. It's right on Powell Street, the heart of Union Square and close to a lot of shopping, restaurants, bars and transportation. The hotel is a smaller, boutique type, with comfortable rooms and nice amenities. Free WiFi (though slow!). The bathroom was tiny and clean but could use some renovation.

My only big disappointment was room service. I was expecting something great since Kulettos's is right in the hotel and I love that place but the room service menu is limited and the food was disappointing. you're better off hopping out to one of the many nearby restaurants.

review.title: Great boutique hotel
review.reviewText: Stayed here to be close to a conference I was attending just across the street at the Hilton. Very interesting place. Wine tasting in the afternoon was a nice little touch. Met some interesting folks while doing that. Very neat place. Very SF. I would come back easily.

review.title: like it
review.reviewText: liked the hotel

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Quaint hotel. Great service, but hotel rooms are small (especially bathrooms). Beware rooms next to elevator are quite noisy.

review.title: Great place!!!
review.reviewText: Not the first time that we'd stayed at the Serrano and have been more than satistified on everytime and looking forward to our next stay. The staff are great as is the locations.

review.title: Colder inside than out
review.reviewText: The only negative thing that happened was when I got back to my room in the evening the temperature was set at 65 degrees. Very Very cold and unnecessary. I had to wonder, how long had the A/C been running at that level. What a waste of electricity.

review.title: Great Hotel, Great Location
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed here for a few nights while visiting the city. Yes, there is construction happening on the exterior of the building, but we didn't hear a peep from the workers or the work happening during our entire stay. We were able to sleep in everyday. The service staff was very attentive and the wine reception in the evening was a nice treat. The location is great, just outside of the ever busy Union Square and only a block away from Foley's, a spectacular Irish pub. The room was very comfortable, with great amenities. Yes, the rooms are small - it's a city hotel, but plenty big enough for us. Overall, it was a great stay.

review.title: Solid - but not stellar
review.reviewText: for the money i think there are better. very very small room. kind of rickety. but great amenities. kimpton is so dependable that way. also, staff is great. again, very kimpton-like.

review.title: Great location and great hotel
review.reviewText: Is in an ideal location in Union Square and the hotel itself was unique. Had a great experience, would definitely go back.

review.title: Serrano Hotel is Convemient and Comfortable
review.reviewText: Having stayed at several hotels throughout the Theater District, SOMA and Union Square areas, the Serrano was conveniently located, nicely appointed and very comfortable. The staff were friendly and what you'd expect from a Kimpton Hotel. The only negative was that there was no mention during the booking process that there was significant construction underway at the site. Unfortunately our view out of 2 windows was of scaffolding. However, we would return (once the construction is finished.

review.title: Really impressed.
review.reviewText: The hotel is clean, comfortable and people are really nice. I was a little disappointed because I did not notice my package did not include breakfast, but there are a lot of places near the hotel, where you can have breakfast for a good price.

review.title: Excellent Value in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: The Serrano is a great hotel! The room was small, but had two windows, a 32" flat screen tv, mini bar, desk, and marble floored bathroom. They are pet friendly and the staff was very helpful in our exploration of the city. Neighborhood is nice, and public transportation is only a block away. We would definately stay here again!

review.title: Very good Hotel
review.reviewText: We were very satisfied with the hotel. We got in at around 6 in the morning and we were able to check in with no problem. There was some construction going on but the room itself was very well kept. There is free fast internet available which made the stay even better. It is close to Union Square and Powell Street. Very convenient to get around. Definitely would go back.

review.title: My favorite SF home away from home
review.reviewText: I love the Serrano, having stayed there the first time by accident because it was recommended as a back-up for a booked conference venue across the street. I was smitten with the excellent service, location and charming old hip ambiance. This was my 4th stay, and it was as superb as ever, except too short, and I hope to stay longer sometime when my work allows. The crowd was decidedly different this time - many more tourists - so the glorious lobby wine reception was a bit more grim than in the past, but the excellence of the staff is truly a draw for me. Likewise, the location is literally the epicenter of everywhere I need to reach [art venues], and close to great eating and walking. The search on Expedia was for Kimpton chain hotels solely because of the fine experience I had with Serrano before [I had thought they were booked for my dates], so I was cheering aloud when I understood I could stay a location I am coming to consider a home away from home. In conclusion, as a New Yorker, I would say that the Serrano reminds me of the best place in the world - my home.

review.title: Our favourite hotel so far!
review.reviewText:
We recently stayed at the Serrano for 5 nights. Our room was located on the 16th floor, we had a view straight down O'Farrell and could see the Bay Bridge. The hotel is currently undergoing renovations but we were not disturbed in any way by noise and the building is looking great with a beautiful lobby, updated rooms and a comfortable bar.
The room was big enough, clean and well equipped with extra blankets, an iron and a flat screen TV. The king-sized bed had crisp, white linens, plump pillows and was one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in! The bathroom was small but adequate; nice and clean with hot water, good shower pressure and the Aveda products were a nice touch.
The hotel offers free coffee, tea and hot chocolate every morning in the lobby, along with a good selelction of newspapers which my husband appreciated; in the afternoons there was iced tea and lemonade with all the fixings to make "Arnold Palmers". The hosted wine tasting was very nice; the staff were very generous and the wines were good.
All of these little "extras" add a nice touch but the thing that makes this hotel a real gem is the staff; everyone we encountered from the front desk staff to the bell staff, the doormen, the bar staff and even down to the cleaning lady were fantastic! Friendly, pleasant accomodating and nothing was too much trouble for them; we received excellent advice about trips, car rentals travelling around town etc. They were all wonderful! Keep up the good work.

review.title: Beware of Construction-INSIDE hotel!!
review.reviewText:
So the first night was good. The second morning we woke up to hammering and drilling and jack hammering on our heads!! I thought that couldn't be outside, its way too close!! I completely woke up and realized they were working on the room adjacent to ours!! Completely remodeling the room! I couldn't believe it. I went downstairs to complain and received the response of "we don't know where they will be working" I pressed her to find our if they would be there they next day. Later that day followed up with front desk, Nothing...No answer-they have no idea what is going to be going on with the construction. Nice.
I was floored. Mainly because 1) I have been to hotels that are under construction and it is all over their website and completely disclosed BEFORE you arrive 2) usually there are discounted rooms because of the construction 3) Not disclosing that there is interior construction was amazing to me. 4) No offer to move rooms. I left a message for the manager. Next morning sure enough, 8:45am pounding, drilling same thing. This noise resonated through the room, it was miserable. Called downstairs, they will have the manager call asap. Received a call from manager who was nice and gave us a discount from our bill. I was actually thinking about staying another night in SF but no way in this hotel. We left. Very Disappointed!! **Beware**

review.title: Nice "Boutique" hotel for a weekend getaway.
review.reviewText:
Very nice boutique hotel close to Union Square and the Financial District.
We booked this hotel for its close proximity to the Orpheum Theater where we saw Wicked.
Only thing I would recommend is that the restaurant should stay open past 11pm. makes it hard to go to an 8pm show and get back intime for a night-cap or snack.
Staff was extreemly friendly and welcoming...thank you!

review.title: Old time charm with modern ammenities!
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean and cozy! We enjoyed staying there. The staff was very friendly and welcoming. The beds were so wonderful that you fell right to sleep as if in a cloud of comfort! The only thing we missed was the coffee pot in our room. We get up earlier than the hotel restaraunt, so room service was going to be too late for us. However, we slipped down to the lobby where there was fresh coffee and tea, either hot or iced, with all of the extras you might like to add to your morning cup! (flavoring, cream, etc.) The morning paper awaiting too.

review.title: quiet romantic getaway
review.reviewText: inexpensive with many amenities. quiet, clean with courteous staff. i got many boyfriend points for picking this one.

review.title: neat place to stay
review.reviewText: one of a kind hotel, that's for sure. Once you walk in it's pretty Iimpressive, and you can feel the history in the building, the staff was most helpful and kind, there was some cunstructtion going on on the outside of the building, so we didn't get to enjoy the view. But the hotek room was very clean and everything was there. Ac worked fine hot water the toilet seemed a bit slow if you know what I mean.. And yes as I read other review that the walls were thin this is true, showers, ppl walking by the rom door. But that didn't bother me much to be honest. Maybe cuz I live in a house where you can hear alot going around you. Lol.. We were signed up for wine tasting in the restaurant, however we were never back in time to enjoy this service.. 5 to 6 is a little early when your out seeing the city, and it's an awesome one at that, just a little too cold for me. :)

review.title: gem of san francisco
review.reviewText: the serrano hotel was well located with easy access to public transport including train to airport. Union square was 2 minute walk, great restaurants and shops and the cable cars were all within easy reach.The service was great and the daily wine hour was perfectly timed.It was easy to get local information. We went out till late and always felt very safe. The hotel was very reasonably priced.

review.title: A perfect Honeymoon!
review.reviewText: Me and my husband came to San Fran on our honeymoon. We were pleasently surprised when we walked into the hotel and were greeted by friendly doormen and front desk staff. Within 5 minutes, we were called in our room by front desk staff asking how we liked our room. They also found me a fan within about 10 minutes. Even though the hotel has AC, I need a fan for white noise to sleep and they were right on this. From recommending restaurants, hailing cabs, and greeting us every time we were in the lobby, this hotel was fantastic. It is in a great location but apparently a few blocks from the hotel is a not so nice neighboorhood so take the advice of the staff to take a cab when going to the Orpheum Theatre - it was only about a $6 cab ride! The restaurant was great! Even though there was construction going on, we were rarely in our room so didnt notice it! The cleaning staff was wonderful and very friendly. We took advantage of their complimentary beverages in the morning and afternoon and they were delicious - we arent wine drinkers, but the offer of a wine tasting was nice! I would return to this hotel again and again! Thank you for making our honeymoon so wonderful!

review.title: Under contruction - hard to find.
review.reviewText: The staff was very helpful and courteous. Because of the construction, it was difficult to locate. Otherwise, all was well. Not sure that it was in the best part of town, but had no problems.

review.title: Better Than Expected
review.reviewText: The hotel was cute and the room was better than expected. Last year we stayed at the Mark Hopkins on Nob Hill and for about half the price this made it a really good deal because the atmosphere of our room was better and even the bathroom was nicer and better maintained than at the Mark Hopkins. We were a little disappointed with our stay at the Mark Hopkins last year with it being a 4-5 star hotel.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This hotel has a wine hour every day from 5-6. They also had fresh coffee in the morning and lemonade and iced tea throughout the day. Hotel was in very old building, but renovated nicely. Room was much smaller than expected. Could hear street noise, but not too badly. Location was ideal - within walking distance of everything.

review.title: Good experience
review.reviewText: Liked everything about the hotel except the fact that they did not have the availability of keeping our bags locked up after we had to check out. Most other hotels do have this service at no extra charge.

review.title: Serrano Hotel
review.reviewText: The Serrano was a great choice for our stay in San Francisco. The hotel staff was friendly and courteous; the room and bathroom were clean and spacious; and the location was great, right next to several bus and cable car stops. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: terrific value
review.reviewText: This hotel went beyond my expectations. The room was very nice and well maintained; and they did get me on a high floor as I requested. The staff on the front desk (especially Pam !) and the bell staff were very helpful with dining tips and how to take local transportation. The happy hours' wine event was fun as the lobby was full of interesting looking people. I recommend this hotel--a real value!

review.title: Great Hotel, not so great neighbourhood
review.reviewText:
Serrano is a great hotel. The rooms are clean and comfortable and very quiet. We rarely heard any noise from surrounding rooms or the hallway. The hotel's lobby is beautiful. The staff is very helpful and friendly.

The buildings exterior is under going some renovations, but we did not hear any noise during our stay. My only issue with this hotel is the neighbourhood. It is only a block away from an unsafe neighbourhood and the hotel staff actually mentioned that we should avoid certain streets near the hotel. There were a few moments walking near the hotel when I did feel unsafe.

If this does not bother you and you want a comfortable bed and quiet room then I recommend staying at Serrano,

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Handy location, near Union Square and down, with access to cablecar, street car and underground. The room was large and we had a great view. We enjoy the complimentary refreshments every afternoon. The happy hour at the hotels restaurant was fun. Diverse neighbourhood - but what else do you expect in San Fran!

review.title: Worth to stay
review.reviewText: Close to Union Square and biz central. Nice place to stay except a little bit noisy

review.title: Excellent Value
review.reviewText: Found this hotel clean and comfortable. Enjoyed the central location.

review.title: "My new favorite in SF!
review.reviewText: The personalized care that we received while staying at Hotel Serrano was spot on! John, the tall blonde headed valet, was definately deserving of a tip and a raise!! He made sure that he greeted us by name everytime we saw him. The concierge desk was also a pleasant experience everytime. The lobby is beautiful!! Hotel Serrano is half the price of the hotels right on the square. The bed was extremely comfy and cozy!! This hotel is a must do if you're staying in San Francisco. It is well within walking distance of shopping and entertainment. Daily Grill restaurant , on Geary, is the perfect spot for breakfast, lunch, or dinner. Be sure to try the ahi tuna appetizer. Everything on their menu was delicious!!!!! Fleur De Lys restaurant on Sutter Street has live jazz nightly. We were sitting next to a large family from France. People were singing along with the music and enjoying the food!! The escargot and champayne chicken were 5 star!!! Both of these restaurants were within walking distance and moderately priced. Don't go to Max's restaurant... It isn't worth it! The food is better at Denny's. We did not get great service. The waiter actually rolled his eyes at me when I asked for a coffee refill!! Be sure you bring a light jacket or sweater if you plan on going out at night... It gets chilly even in the middle of summer. I am confident that you will have a memorable and enjoyable experience if you check out these places during your stay in the beautiful city of San Francisco!

review.title: Nice room for the money
review.reviewText: This was a fairly good deal--my room was quite nice, if a bit small, and quiet despite facing a busy street, and the hotel staff was nice and accommodating. There's complementary coffee, tea, and New York Times in the mornings in the lobby too. My only complaints are that the hallways looked a bit worn around the edges and Union Square is tourist central. It was nice to have Macy's and Nordstrom and Bloomingdales and all the rest a short hop away, but in the evenings it was hard to find a good place to eat--it was all driven toward tourists with overpriced mediocre fare. All in all though it was a nice place to stay.

review.title: my kids love it..awsome hotel
review.reviewText: great hotel. My kids love it . The staff people are awsome, we forgot our stroller, right away they lend us one,, the rates are just unbeatible. It was a last minute family trip, and we were a litle afraid. but it turn out to a great trip within waking distance of union square..

review.title: Would definitely recommend
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel for our honeymoon trip to San Francisco. The location was perfect for walking and taking public transit to everything we wanted to do in the city. The staff members were friendly and extremely helpful when we had questions. Our room was small-ish, but very clean and comfortable.

review.title: Have Returned 5 Times
review.reviewText: We have stayed at the Serrano on 5 different vacations to San Francisco. The location is excellent and the staff are very knowledgeable, friendly and helpful. The rooms are well appointed and very clean; not to mentin that the beds are very comfy! I always look forward to a stay at the Serrano.

review.title: Comfortable and Effective for SF
review.reviewText: The hotel was quite adequate for our SF stay. It did border the edge of "the tenderloin" which is not such a nice area of town, but otherwise it was 2-3 blocks from Union Square and the Cable Cars, so it was really a good location. Of course, as with most hotels in SF, it is old, so a lot of things in it are old as well, but they have modernized it and re-modeled to make it quite comfortable for current day use.

review.title: Quite nice, though not stellar
review.reviewText:
Did not know that the hotel was undergoing major renovation, so its signage was not readily visible. We had to drive around a couple of times to find the entrance. Parking was also difficult.
The restaurant/lounge is fantastic!!

review.title: The Serrano was perfect for my first trip to S.F.!
review.reviewText: The staff was really friendly, and the location was good, three or four blocks from Union Square, 10 minute walk from a BART station. I enjoyed staying there. There will be homeless people around but that's because you're in the downtown area, and if your out past midnight be prepared to see some crazy stuff in the area. :)

review.title: Lacking mini-fridge but otherwise, stellar!
review.reviewText: I would say my only MAJOR criticism of this hotel was the lack of a mini-fridge in our hotel room. It was very difficult to keep any leftovers and since II'm vegan it was difficult to order in room service. Other than that, I loved this hotel!

review.title: good time
review.reviewText:
This is a quaint boutique hotel.
At check in we realized we has just missed the complimentary wine tasting hour .It was nice that they gave us each a voucher for a free of wine from the bar. Staff was pleasant and helpful with the exception of the bellman upon checkout. The hotel will store your bags for you after checkout but he seemed rather annoyed to be doing so. By the time we got back to claim our bags, another man was working and was very pleasant.
Room was as expected, clean and cute . The available snacks and drinks in the room bar were healthy and had I needed them would have been happy to partake. location is great. would return!

review.title: Nice hotel, very convenient.
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Serrano Hotel for a conference that was held in the nearby Hilton. I found the hotel very nice. I lived in SF for many years but I didn't know this hotel. I will recommend it to friends and colleagues.

review.title: It's OK hotel
review.reviewText: It's OK hotel. I'd like to recommend.

review.title: Terrific Boutique Hotel!
review.reviewText:
A wonderful little hotel with terrific service. The lobby was gorgeous and the rooms equally so. The desk clerks were unanimously terrific, providing every type of information and quickly getting us reservations at a nice restaurant two blocks away as soon as we arrived.

Re. parking. The Serrano provides valet parking at $40/day... but, there is a parking garage just next door which charges $30/day and approx. $15 for half day.... and by the way.... if you want a wonderful, inexpensive breakfast with atmosphere... go just a few doors down the street when you're there to visit the Taylor Ave. Coffee Shop.... It's tiny, and you may have to squeeze past the counter on your way in.... but you'll get great eggs and hashbrowns served with a huge side of delicious fresh fruit.... sliced as you watch.... The best breakfast we've had in years!!

review.title: Nice place, good deal
review.reviewText: We just came back from a six day stay at the Serrano. The only problem was locating the hotel as it's covered by scaffolding. Although the area to the south is a little sketchy, there's nothing to worry about during the day. Otherwise, the location is great, a short walk to the BART and Union Square. The free morning coffee and evening wine were nice touches. I'd happily stay here again.

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: The hotel is a bit outdated but in a very nice location. Room and bathroom are small and we could hear everything from the room next to ours. Other than that everything was better than expected, no surprises.

review.title: Interesting niche hotel
review.reviewText: Pretty much what you expect from a Kimpton Hotel. Interesting old building that they have made very enjoyable. Good staff, comfortable rooms.

review.title: Very positively surprised
review.reviewText: Nice hotel to be recommended

review.title: Comfortable Chic!
review.reviewText: I loved this hotel. They gave me the type of room I listed as a preference and it was a lovely one. The bed was extremely comfortable, the bathroom clean and the work desk/chair conducive to actually working. The free WiFi was a delight and the gym although small, had good fitness equipment and a nice dry spa. This is one of my favorite hotels in the city.

review.title: great!!! location!!!!!
review.reviewText: An elegant hotel, centrally located and an easy walk from the BART. Rooms are spacious and nice big bed was very comfortable. Staff at the desk were very helpful. There was some construction going on when I was there so I requested a room away from the work which they gave me so I had a quiet room. I would highly recommend this lovely hotel.

review.title: would book there again!!!
review.reviewText: Staff friendly and helpful. Hotel was close to union square, cable cars , Macys, car rentals and great restuarants. Enjoyed the wine tasting evenings, and the hotel bar happy hour had great food. Will stay there again.

review.title: Great walking location for San Francisco
review.reviewText: I chose this hotel based on proximity to Union Square and that it was a Kimpton (which I love). The location was perfect for those who plan on walking around San Francisco. The Serrano was within walking distance to the BART (which we took to and from the airport and to an Oakland A's game), Chinatown, North Beach, fantastic restaurants, etc. Our room was very clean and quiet and the staff was wonderful (especially Stephan, the concierge). I definitely cannot wait to go back to San Francisco and will stay at the Serrano again.

review.title: Escape to Alcatraz
review.reviewText: Hotel was very nice. What you would expect for last minute reservations and price. It is one of the better priced in the city of a weekend in San Francisco. Great location to all attractions, not the best looking area one block down. Hotel had renovations on the outside. The staff was fabulous.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Friendly staff. Excellent location. Free wine hour from 5-6 pm!

review.title: Wonderful Experience - Will Return
review.reviewText: The hotel was amazing. Clean, colorful, and great service. There were only two issues. If you walked down the block from the hotel, the neighborhood was not the most beautiful, rather shady. The other thing was that there was an issue with billing at the end of our stay that didn't make me very happy. But, other than these things it was an excellent experience!!!

review.title: Used to stay at the Prescott but the Serrano was awesome...i know, same chain!!
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was friendly, courteous, helpful, etc. Loved the coffee in the morning and the wine in the afternoon....Overall, our experience was fantastic. I would most defenitely recommend this hotel as well as stay there again.

review.title: very convenient
review.reviewText: Location perfect. Room well appointed. Staff courteous. Restaurant a bit too casual.

review.title: A great experience
review.reviewText: We had not stayed at a Kimpton Hotel before, but will certainly return and look for Kimpton's wherever we travel- it was extremely comfortable.

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: We knew about this hotel was bit dated, but It has a certain charm in it. lobby was nice and the room was very clean and neat. Bathroom is really small, some people may don't like it because of outdated style. it wasn't a problem for us, b/c it was clean. We enjoyed staying at this hotel b/c they offered you free coffee,tea, and has wine tasting time as well as the awesome location. we will go back to this hotel. internet is free, just need to sign in their website.

review.title: Not the best but not the worst
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was great and very friendly and helpful. The size of the room left much to be desired for. While my husband and I got a great price, we felt that as soon as we walked into the room we were already out the window. It was the smallest hotel room we had every been in. Great location in the heart of union square and was near everything we needed.

review.title: Serrano in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Nice place to spend a few days- some renovations going on (all for the good!) so it could be noisy during the day but could sightsee by foot in the neighborhood. Parking is valet but we parked directly across the street in the garage for the 24 hours and was a bit less money, and just as easy to walk across to the hotel. Loved the old style look-would return again! Nice staff!

review.title: can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText: Location was perfect -- very nice staff and clean rooms. Hotel is under reconstruction, but is not a problem. Will stay there every time we go to S.F. Walked to Josh's Steak House (very good) and to a tiny hole-in-the-wall diner across Taylor and 3 doors down -- excellent.

review.title: European Hotel in a very USA city
review.reviewText:
Very pleasant downtown hotel. Rooms were clean and comfortable, although not large. If you like left bank small hotels in Paris you'll feel comfortable here.

Garage next door allows in and out travel for a standard day fare.

We were there only for a day, but would be glad to return again.

review.title: Horrible Renovation
review.reviewText: I stayed in Serrano for 3 nights in total. At check-in on a Friday, I was not informed that renovation works at the external facade was ongoing (although I noticed that part of the building exterior was covered with scaffold). On Monday morning, my nightmare began. Workers were literally hacking the extrenal wall of the room in which I was sleeping at around 8.30am. At first, the hacking was intermittent and I tried to cover my ears and continued sleeping. However, it was no time before the hacking intensified to the extent that I could not hear the front desk after I called and complained about the noise. All the frontdesk could say was we will shift you to another room. How ridiculous that was! Knowing that I'd be checking out in a few hours time, aren't they adding more inconvenience to me by suggesting that they can move me to another room? In the 1st place, they should have the decency to consider the existing renovation works in allocating rooms to guests such that they will be least affected by it. Serrano did not and their attitude towards the entire incident was indifferent. This is a good example of poor customer service. I'd definitely not stay in Serrano again!

review.title: Hotel Review
review.reviewText: Good location for walking and the metro, good service both front desk and recommendations for restruants, quite, great price, room was a bit cramped.

review.title: Good Dowtown Hotel
review.reviewText: Nice lobby. Helpful staff. Rooms are small but refurbished. Very quiet in the room. Convenient location, but a walk from the BART.

review.title: Lovely Serrano Hotel
review.reviewText: We had stayed at the Serrano Hotel previously. It was just as romantic and quaint as we remembered. The rooms are small, but we knew that going in. Only downside was the restoration of the building outside. There was no construction going on while we were there, but it made for an ugly view.

review.title: ADIEL HADAD
review.reviewText: BEAUTIFUL HOTEL VERY GOOD LOCATION

review.title: Serrano Hotel - A downtown gem
review.reviewText:
The Serrano Hotel is right in the heart of downtown SF. Shopping, restaurants and other conveniences are all within walking distance. The hotel staff were polite, competent, enthusiastic and never intrusive.

This building is an historic landmark and the hotel room sizes reflect a different time. That said, my room was immpecably clean and well maintained and very comfortable. The hotel lobby reflects a different time and place and has a wonderful old world feel.

The Ponzu Restaurant and the Grand Cafe on the opposite side of the block are great place to eat and for wine lovers the Napa Valley Wine Exchange next to the main entrance is an absolute treat.

This is a great place for business travelers while family's will need to find more to do outside the confines of the hotel.

The facade of the hotel is undergoing a face life and there is some construction noise during the day time. It was minimal and unobtrusive.

review.title: "would stay here again"
review.reviewText: went to SF for our anniv. this hotel was very nice for the price. Parking was not as much as I expected. $30. overnite, next to the hotel. My only complaint is the pillows were flat and filled with feathers. bring your own pillows. Our view was the side of another building, which was fine it made for a quiet stay.

review.title: Fun stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Didn't quite know what to expect when we arrived. The favorable reviews were correct. We really loved this place. Easy access, decent location, and nice facilities made this a great choice. Especially loved the FREE wine reception every night!

review.title: Not as good as we expected.
review.reviewText: The hotel is fine, but very tired. The furniture is banged up, the baseboards, trim and doors are in bad shape. The bed was comfortable, the bath products were nice, there were two flat-screen TVs in our suite with lots of channels to watch. There is no space in the bathroom to put your toiletries. Very strange layout. The wine reception at night was great but they featured Chilean wines every night which was strange since California has great wines! Coffee and newspapers in the morning were nice. Location is fairly convenient for Union Square but there is an inordinate amount of homeless and panhandlers in the area. They are very persistent and annoying. They are restoring the exterior of the hotel so it's quite noisy during the day Monday to Friday. All the reviews I had read raved about the hotel so it was disappointing to find that it did not live up to the reviews.

review.title: great but need to know..
review.reviewText: The hotel is a great place to stay but a couple of points...the next block is the beginning of a risky neighbourhood in downtown SF, so neighbourhood walks in that direction are not on. Also I can't help but think that having access to hot water in your room / floor would be nice to have an early morning cuppa- currently you have to walk down to the lobby for it. It would not cost a lot to the hotel.

review.title: "Can't be beat for the money"
review.reviewText: Excellent

review.title: Can't wait to stay here again!
review.reviewText: Hotel Serrano is a great little hotel in the heart of San Francisco. The employees are always very friendly and rooms are very nice. They also offer wine to their guests nightly before you head out on the town.

review.title: Great Experience
review.reviewText: I found the staff at the Serrano Hotel to be exceptional. The rooms were very comfortable and clean. I would recommend staying at this hotel.

review.title: was Not impressed but dealed
review.reviewText: The hotel was a little off union square than expected. The room was really small but i have to say that they made good use of their space. Everything is locked. A random door was on a wall but i have no idea where it lead because the walleway was out there. No closet just a little cupboard. The work out room was super small and dark. The room looked liek it was just painted over to look nicer. THe deal breaker though was the surrounding neighborhood. make sure to bring someone you'll feel safe with. Which means someone who will protect you. I lucky had my boyfriend. There is a lot of homelessness and its very dirty. It was scary. OH and there was construction right next to it. I you do stay, theres a really gret priced parking garage next door. Literally.

review.title: San Fran special
review.reviewText: From the outside, the hotel is disappointing and I thought I'd made a mistake. But, inside is real nice. Very friendly hotel staff, and accomodating. Happy hour every night (and can take upstairs), and coffee in the AM. Excellent deal for San Fran!

review.title: Great Hotel; Great Value
review.reviewText: I was very satisfied with this hotel. I did my research, read reviews on this site and TripAdvisor, read other hotel reviews, and picked the Serrano. The hotel was charming and beautiful, the rooms were clean and well-appointed. Small, yes, but they really got the details right. This was a nice room, especially considering the money. Maybe most important was the staff. They couldn't have been friendlier. They seemed to go out of their way to be friendly and helpful, like they'd just been coached. The bellman guy who helped me--I had to store my bags after I checked out and get to them a couple of times--was just great. Again, friendly almost to a fault. And while some have commented on the neighborhood--I guess it's on the edge of the Tenderloin--don't worry. It's across the street from the Hilton and a Fed-Ex Kinko's--how bad could the neighborhood be? It's close to restaurants and tons of shopping. Will definitely stay here again.

review.title: A friendly place to stay
review.reviewText: This is a smaller hotel with a nice friendly staff. Our room was very clean and comfortable. The surrounding neighborhood was a little less desirable, but over all we enjoyed our stay. The hotel is within walking distance of the theatre we were going to, but we didn't walk because of the neighborhood.

review.title: Would stay again!!!
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Love the complimentary wine reception nightly. Beds are very comfortable. Hotel staff very friendly. Close to Bart, Union Square and Westfield Center.

review.title: Great luxury value in SF
review.reviewText:
I suggest this boutique hotel if you are not needing a lot of space, but you want pleasant amenities (just right sized bed, refrigerator, tub, health area, lobby) and if you expect things to look nice and feel nice.

I did not try the restaurant, although I did have a couple glasses of free decent wine every night in the lobby!

The staff was very pleasant.

A minor complaint was that the lobby is "breezy".

Also, the Tenderloin neighborhood adjoins this hotel area. Some might be uncomfortable by the number of roaming street people, but that's SF!

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: Good service. Good room and location. Good everything. I was happy and it was well worth the money.

review.title: A great inexpensive hotel with character
review.reviewText:
When looking at hotels in this price point, this close to union, I was expecting it to be a little dirty, a little sleezy, and a little, well, underwhelming.

I was wrong on all counts. This place had character, everyone who worked there was polite, the room was as clean as any high dollar hotel, there was a seemingly infinite supply of hot water, and the beds were comfortable.

I will definitely be staying at the Seranno again. :)

review.title: The place to stay in SF
review.reviewText: Great place to stay. Clean and close to great restaurants.

review.title: Serrano Hotel-A Gem
review.reviewText: The Serrano Hotel is wonderful. The hotel is well maintained and very charming. The lobby has many historic details. Although my room wasn't huge, it was an adequate size. The bed and room amenities were excellent. Climate control worked beautifully, the windows don't open and the room was very quiet. Location is close to Union Square, which is good. I didn't have any problem with the neighborhood, although skid row is a block away. I just didn't walk in that direction.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Excellent location and friendly staff. Room was small but clean and well decorated and kept. All kind of good restaurant within walking distance. Next trip to San Francisco will include staying at this boutique hotel.

review.title: Wonderful Hotel
review.reviewText: This is a wonderful boutique hotel. The staff at the hotel were extremely friendly, and the decoration of the hotel lobby and room made us feel very comfortable, as if we were staying in a very nice house/mansion. The hotel was served free coffee and tea in the morning and free wine in the evening. The staff worked very hard to make us feel wanted there. The hotel also had free WiFi within the room, which kept us connected with our home base. The hotel is located close to Union Square and Powell station. Therefore, it is easy to visit downtown San Francisco, and easy to go to the airport by BART. We had a wonderful time there, and will definitely consider returning to this hotel in our next visit.

review.title: very conforting
review.reviewText: My three children and I loved the location of this hotel, easy access to sights and bus and cable cars. Helpful staff and clean rooms made our first trip to San Francisco very enjoyable.

review.title: Good Value Option in Good Location
review.reviewText: We stayed here for a full week and it served as a good homebase for excursions around the city. Excellent location close to Union Square and major transit connections. Overall, the staff is friendly, rooms are comfortable, amenities are good (gym is nice for this price range), and the little touches (nice morning coffee/tea in lobby, later afternoon wine reception) were welcome. We rented a car for a few days for longer trips out of the city and there's a great reasonably-priced garage - Best Parking - right around the corner. So, it is definitely not necessary to use the hotel parking service.

review.title: AMAZING
review.reviewText: Great location, amazing hotel with staff that goes above and beyond in service. LOVE KIMPTON HOTELS

review.title: Comfortable Stay
review.reviewText: The hotel overall was very nice. The gym was well-equipped and the room was attractive and very clean. The only problem with this hotel is the room service. Business travelers expecting dinner in the room will be disappointed. Two nights in a row I could not get the hotel restaurant to answer the phone after an hour of calling and had to go without dinner. The hotel staff is very helpful and friendly however.

review.title: Engagement Weekend in SF
review.reviewText: Great Service, Decor, and Room. The design of the hotel was swanky, modern and hip. We even received a free upgrade to an excutive suite since it was our engagement weekend. The location was also great since we were in union square. My fiance was so happy which made me happy. It was a perfect weekend. Thank you Hotel Serrano/Kimpton!!!

review.title: Seranno Hotel SF
review.reviewText: The hotel is a great hotel if you dont mind space issues. The restroom is super small, with no counter space. Aside from that, and the fact that the room itself is a little small the hotel was great. The location is ideal, right next to Westfield Mall, plenty of bars and restaurants, and both cable car and metro stops. The wine and coffee hour is great, and people really do take advantage of them. During those hours people can be seen in the lobby playing one of the many games the Serrano offers. Overall I enjoyed my stay at this hotel very much.

review.title: I will stay here again.
review.reviewText: Hotel Serrano is an older, charming hotel, that feels intimate, rather than overwhelming. It feels like a small European hotel, decorated in a classic style. The staff (literally everyone I came in contact with) was very friendly and helpful. Wonderful restaurants and theaters are within walking distance.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: This great hotel serves coffee and tea in the mornng, hot chocolate in the winter afternoon, and wine reception in the evening. The people work there are very helpful.

review.title: Sketchy
review.reviewText:
The hotel is average. Rooms are small. The lobby is poorly lit. The surroundings are sketchy, a lot of homeless people around. As the area is not very safe, there are about 5 security guards at any given time hanging out in the lobby.

The best feature is a wine hour. Two types of wine are served 4-5 (or 5 to 6pm) free. Unfortunately, I was able to appreciate this happy hour only once during my 4 days stay. The bar next door is nice but mostly empty.

The staff is not very responsive. There was cigarette smell in my room (the hotel is non-smoking) and no-one didn't do anything to prevent it. Basically, my neighbor was smoking in the bathroom secretly and the hotel staff was not able to identify who. Getting an extra towel can be difficult too. You can't really talk to housekeeping and have to leave a message. No-one calls back.
There is no coffee maker in the room.

review.title: Fun Trip
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful stay at the Kimpton. Super quiet, had ipod docks (Doesn't charge i-touches but play them) Nice flat screen which was great for relaxing after all the walking we did. The location was great. Close to shopping, Union Square, Chinatown. A quick cab ride down to the Pier. The only thing(s) I disliked was the bed was very soft, so when you woke up you felt like you had sunk down. The room had no air (Or the thermostat was not working) We turned the heat up on the first night and then I couldn't get it to go back down. We didn't call maintenance. The second thing was the shower. The water pressure was so low I could not get the shampoo out of my hair (I have short hair). I ended up filling the ice bucket with water.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Good hotel in great location. Very decent priced. I have stayed there twice so far.

review.title: Serrano
review.reviewText: The rooms were really small and the staff was rude. The hotel was very close to the Tenderloin, much closer than it was to Union Square. I would have never thought such an expensive hotel would allow for such bad service.

review.title: Great Place Next To Everything
review.reviewText: I chose this hotel because it had favorable reviews and it lived up to the expectation. We were happy with every part of our stay, from the lobby to the room and the location in the city. We were within a couple blocks of over a 100 different retail stores, as well as a good number of places to eat and drink. I would highly recommend this to a friend and plan to stay here again.

review.title: Good location, decent rooms...mediocre service
review.reviewText: The Serrano has comfortable rooms with all the necessary amenities for a nice stay (ours was only two nights). The room itself was fairly clean, but the bathroom had hair stuck to walls behind the door and on the bathtub - and more than just a few...the hairs on the wall appeared to have been there for some time. Didn't really bother me, but a quick once-over by the staff would have revealed the need for some extra attention. Also, we had the need for some special, but quite simple, services upon checkout and the hotel staff couldn't have possibly been less interested in helping. This isn't the usual Kimpton attitude and I found this property to be lower than the Kimpton standard in just about all areas. Fortunately, there are at least five others to pick from in the area.

review.title: Hotel was ok
review.reviewText:
The room was nice, but small....
Over all the service was good and the hotel was ok.
I was not the bet place I've ever stayed but it is a good hotel and I would stay there again

review.title: Close to Union Square
review.reviewText: This hotel was terrific and the location worked well.

review.title: Vey nice, free wifi, free coffee
review.reviewText: Good business hotel, good location, nice restaurant

review.title: Great hotel.
review.reviewText: Had a great time on new years. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

review.title: Affordable getaway with a little hint of luxury
review.reviewText: Went with boyfriend, both in our early twenties. Would recommend especially for this age group. Easy walk to Union Square and Post street, the decor is a little tacky, but in an adventurous way. The beds were nice and the room balanced a cozy warmth with euro-arabian decoration.

review.title: Serrano is muy bein!
review.reviewText: Very comfortable, stylish hotel right in the heart of downtown SF. Staff is ready to help you with all your needs. Comfy beds, nice showers, and a relaxing atmosphere.

review.title: Comfortable, quiet, clean, very convenient to Union Square, shopping and cable cars.
review.reviewText: This is a nicely refurbished hotel. Very nice, helpful people. Very clean and comfortable. Our view was of Nob Hill - nothing to boast about. Short walk to neighborhood restaurants, big shopping at Union Square, catching the cable cars to waterfront. Had a great time, mostly wonderful weather in December! The only uncomfortable moment we had was when we took a different route to the Union Square area - happened upon a section of downtown that was a little "iffy." Easy to avoid, though, once we knew where it was. Consierge very knowledgeable and helpful with booking sightseeing trips.

review.title: Great Trip to San Francisco
review.reviewText: We were very satisfied with our experience. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were nicely decorated, clean, and well-kept. The rooms were a bit small, but that was ok since we didn't spend much time in our rooms. Ask for a room on of the upper floors for a great view. Although the valet was very convenient, it was very expensive ($62.50 per day ) for a van. Use the garage next door or across the street ($36.50 per day) to save some money. Use care when walking at night, as this borders on the Tenderloin area of the City (lots of massage parlors and homeless people).

review.title: Would return without any hesitation
review.reviewText: A very nice hotel with good access to Union Square and many of SF's attractions. Staff was friendly and helpful. Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel

review.title: SF Sorrento
review.reviewText: I don't want to write a review.

review.title: Good hotel, but missing smiles...
review.reviewText:
Great location, good room quality but I always appreciate when you feel the staff really cares about their visitors. I did not feel this at all from the frontdesk staff. No real welcome and sometimes too busy talking to other staff to deal with the guests as first priority. Hardly any smiles on anyones faces and the feeling you were served very generically. Doormen were very kind and professional though.

Listen good staff, the customers pays the bills and salaries, so make us feel special?! A simply warm greeting and a smile goes a long way...

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Staff was nice and helpful, rooms were smaller but very comfortable, near excellent shopping areas, recommend hotel to all

review.title: Great price, great location and great overall service.
review.reviewText: The Hotel Serrano is a great place to stay for a quick trip to the bay area. It is close to all of the shops and restaurants you'd want to go to and is conveniently located near all sorts of public transit. However, the fun of this hotel is that you can walk to most places in and around the Union Square area.

review.title: Serrano
review.reviewText: This is a very nice small hotel in the heart of San Francisco. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the room very comfortable. I've stayed here many times for business and recently for a long weekend in the city. I'm always happy with my stays there.

review.title: Serrano Hotel - San Francisco, CA
review.reviewText: Classy hotel...very efficient and close by to restaurants, shopping, the BART, etc...staff of the hotel were extremely helpful and courtious.

review.title: Very convenient & courteous
review.reviewText: Renovation well done; very comfortable, quaint room; a.m. coffee & p.m. wine a nice touch; very convenient location; reasonable parking two doors away for 1/2 the price of the hotel valet parking.

review.title: Great place can't believe the price!
review.reviewText: Very Very friendly staff. Great service. quite, clean, What else can you ask for.

review.title: Serrano Hotel San Francisco
review.reviewText:
The Serrano was across the street from the hotel I usually stay at in San Francisco. Although the room was much smaller and I had to wait to check in due to an Expedia problem, I really enjoyed staying there. The room was tiny, but comfortable.

I will definitely stay there again.

review.title: Great service
review.reviewText: Hi highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: SF
review.reviewText: The hotel was awesome! It was my first time at a Kimpton and also a Boutique Hotel, and I will definetely go back.

review.title: Two time around!
review.reviewText:
I've stayed at the Serrano Hotel twice. I liked the location, only two blocks away from Union Square. It is a quaint boutique hotel with a very grandiose lobby. The only down side is the bathtub is curved, very difficult to stand up to take a shower.
The rooms are a good size and clean.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel convenient to Union Square, Chinatown and major bus line. Good restaurants in the area. Small inconvenience waiting for a clogged tub and toilet to be fixed. I was told someone would be right there and waited 45 minutes. I had to leave before someone arrived but problems were fixed when I got back later in the day. There's a hotel on every corner in this area of the city. I would probably check out a few more before staying at the Serrano again.

review.title: GREAT STAFF, LOCATION BUT ROOMS ARE WORN
review.reviewText:
I have to say the staff is wonderful at the Hotel Serrano. THe location is superb.

The hotel is a much older structure. Quaint lobby..again friendly staff. The rooms are a bit small but nicely appointed. My particular room had worn ripped wallpaper. Bathroom was tight. Could barely use the commode. Light fixture was rusty and surface mold around the tub.

If the room were in better condition, I'd say it's a perfect Gem.

review.title: Will go back!
review.reviewText: Location is great, close to everything. Beautiful hotel and we enjoyed our stay.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: Great location and clean, comfortable, but very small rooms. Hotel staff was 50/50. Some were exceptional, where other staff members were just OK.

review.title: Sorrano
review.reviewText: Hotel was very clean, staff was wonderful. Me and my girlfriend visited San Francisco for her birthday and it was one of my best hotel experiences. There is a restaurant right next to the hotel where you can order roomservice from without the rediculous high prices. room was very clean. a bit small but very nice indeed. i would recommend to others.

review.title: This was a great stay, The staff upgraded my wife and I to a suite because it was our anniversary.
review.reviewText: I would stay at this hotel if I went back to the city again. The bed was sooooo comfortable and the staff was very friendly. I could not have asked for a better stay.

review.title: Nice, clean, excellent value...
review.reviewText: Although we were tucked away in a corner on only the second floor and without a view, I was very happy with the quietness. An older hotel but the upkeep seems to be good. Rooms are clean but a bit small. Smoke free (yeah) but unfortunately the smokers would congregate outside the front (boo). Just a short walk to Union Square and Market St., we found it a convenient location. Staff was friendly and courteous.

review.title: noisy
review.reviewText: Was awakened at 3am both nights by noise in the hotel. Someone seemed to be working in the room next to us. Heard the sound of machines and running water. Rooms next to the elevators are not recommended if a peaceful evening is sought

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: It is within walking distance of all forms of shopping and transportation. Take the Bart from the airport and it's only two or three blocks away. People at the hotel were friendly and very helpful. I will stay there again next time I'm in the city.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Great location

review.title: Staying at the Serrano again in 2 Months
review.reviewText: Very nice, comfortable room. Quiet room which is rare in San Francisco. (No street noise) Great service from the staff. Beautiful room, bathroom facilities in excellent condition. Bed was great. Elevators are small but fast. Wine tasting in the evening for guests in the lobby.

review.title: Very pleased with Serrano
review.reviewText: Nice hotel very close to San Francisco attractions. Staff were pleasant and helpful, room was clean and well appointed. No complaints whatsoever, and will look here first for availability when I go back to SF.

review.title: Recommended overall
review.reviewText: The room wasn't very big but it was clean and pleasantly appointed. The hotel is generally value-laden. Just one beef: I was happy to see two iMacs in the small business center as i hadn't taken my laptop along with me. However, the charge to use one and go online was exploitive.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: Great location and a very nice hotel.

review.title: would certainly recommend this to someone
review.reviewText: Very pleased with stay at Serrano. Comfort, clean and good service. Rooms were small but very comfortable. Staff friendly and helpful. Good walking location to many sites. Only one bad experience in that we asked concierge to make us a reservation on a Sunday night for dinner. we requested this on Thursday when we checked in and when i called to confirm the reservation, it had NOT been made. I suppose he forgot. most all other dinner reservations i made myself which was a good thing. My sons really enjoyed the fitness center as well.

review.title: Great stay, a perfect gateway to San Francisco
review.reviewText: We were at the Serrano for three days to explore San Francisco and the hotel and its staff were perfectly situated and qualified to help us have a wonderful stay.

review.title: Decent boutique hotel
review.reviewText: Few blocks from Union square.The hotel is old ,bathrooms are quite small but the service is very good and the free internet a plus(have to sign for the Kimpton in touch program to access free internet).Lot of places to eat around,complimentary tea/coffee available in the morning and daily wine reception.There are a number of other Kimpton hotels closeby and some of them looked better than Serrano`s.

review.title: Very comfortable
review.reviewText: After a string of less than satisfying hotel stays the Kimpton was a welcome delight. THe room itself was very comfortable and the staff in all instances were very helpful. One pleasant surprise was their wine festival each afternoon where free wine or sangria was served between 5 and 6 in the lobby. As the hotel doesn't have a bar, this was a welcome way to relax at the end of the day without having to go out again.

review.title: Fun
review.reviewText: Excellent

review.title: Small rooms but great hotel
review.reviewText: The staff here are the most friendly and helpful of any staff we have ever come across. The room was tiny but it was well worth it overall

review.title: beautiful nice location quiet
review.reviewText: enjoyed staying in updated room helpful staff

review.title: Disappointed with Room Location & Windows
review.reviewText: I was disappointed that our room was in a corner with a view to another building's wall. We had an upgraded room and expected better. Also, the windows were sealed shut. It would have been so nice to open them up and get fresh air in the room. Finally, we were supposed to get free wifi but were never given the access codes to do so. I did like the hotel location and the rates were reasonable. The hotel parking was not. You can self-park in the garage right across the street for half the price. I would stay here again because the price is right, the location is excellent, and the room itself was very clean and nice.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel

review.title: Good Bargain in SF
review.reviewText: Well-situated about 4 blocks from Union Square and accessible to BART/cable/bus lines. Complimentary happy hour every night. Staff is helpful to tourists.

review.title: nice
review.reviewText: If you are looking to save a little money and stay close to Union Square this hotel is perfect. If you get a room near the stairs it will be noisy, also the rooms are small, but the staff was really friendly.

review.title: Serrano Rocks!
review.reviewText: The Serrano is in a great location, has a great vibe, and offered a great price. What more can one ask for? Oh, yeah--it's named after a delicious ham! (Well, maybe not, but I liked the idea of it!)

review.title: yap!
review.reviewText: i think this hotel has awesome service, but the lady who clean our room was sooooo annoying!!!!

review.title: Nice hotel for a weekend break.
review.reviewText: This past weekend we were tourists in our own city and stayed overnight at the Serrano. Overall, we were very satisfied. It was very clean and the staff was very welcoming. The king bed in our room was very comfortable. We had a city view room on the 15th floor. The wine reception hour was quite nice as well. We arrived at 5:05pm and were lucky to get a seat though. There was a white wine sangria in addition to white and red wines available. The "bar" closed promptly at 6pm when we were there. (We had thought it was a 2 hour reception, but apparently it goes from 5pm-6pm only.) The coffee in the lobby the next morning was tasty, but my first cup (only small paper cups were available) had a lot of grounds, which I didn't expect. The cream did run out and was slowly replaced.

review.title: Service is excellent
review.reviewText: It was a girls trip and we used the concierge desk for many of our outtings. Excellent service! Loved the nightly hosted reception and board games in the lobby. Great time to unwhine or rest.

review.title: A hidden gem
review.reviewText: A hidden gem

review.title: First time in San Francisco
review.reviewText: A very clean, comfortable, and positive experience. All the staff that we encountered were very helpful. The location was nice and central with a good range of restaurants nearby.

review.title: Would go back; prefer Monaco
review.reviewText: Good hotel for the price.

review.title: Comfortable and quirky
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed my stay at the Serrano. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We were upgraded to a one bedroom suite for our stay which was a welcome surprise. The evening hosted wine receptions were a nice touch, and they had a Nintendo Wii in the lobby for people to play during wine time. The only downside was the excessive charge for using the business centre's computers. The hotel rooms had free wi-fi, but since I didn't take a laptop on my holiday - this didn't benefit me. It was a small downside considering the rest of my stay was wonderful.

review.title: Good but not over the top
review.reviewText: We had no complaints, the staff was very friendly.

review.title: intimate and delightful
review.reviewText: The Hotel Serrano is located conveniently in Union Square. It's small enough that all of the staff recognize you as guests and greet you and ask if you need anything, but it never felt cramped. The lobby and rooms are lovely, very classy.
