Beds are incredibly comfortable. And my tall companion really appreciated the high ceilings and tall shower spray head! High on comfort and cleanliness.

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: great hotel- expedia discount rate made it very affordable- good location would stay again - slow check out

review.title: Very Satisfied
review.reviewText: If you want a comfortable room and great service without a lot of fuss, the Serrano will not disappoint. It offers all the usual ammenities and services that Kimpton Hotels are known for, yet still has the feel of a small independant hotel. Good value, good location, and great staff!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was great. Staff was outstanding, room was small but very comfertable. The coffee service in the morning and the wine service at night were both nice.Not to mention the price was nice.This will be the place I stay when I go to the city!!

review.title: Fine for the price
review.reviewText: For a comfortable room that's relatively central, this is a solid choice for the price.

review.title: What a marvelous hotel!!
review.reviewText: My friend and I stayed here for 3 awesome days, and the hotel was the best! Perfect location from the BART stop, central location to everything, super-comfortable bed...this is now my favorite hotel in SF!! Staff was super nice and accommodating, and the wine reception delightful. Good times!

review.title: Super concierge staff and location
review.reviewText: very comfortable hotel, friendly staff and a nice location.

review.title: Good hotel for price - watch the area if you are walking around
review.reviewText: Good Hotel. Kimpton's never disappoints but the front desk could be more proactive. Not really very friendly. I have stayed at the Clift right across the street, don't know why someone would pay for an expensive room there when this is right across the street, same type of room and a fraction of the price

review.title: Absolutely Fantastic! Cannot believe its only a 3* hotel, exceeds all expectations!
review.reviewText: From first setting foot inside the Serrano Hotel, i knew that i had made the right choice. After reading hundreds of excellent reviews from many different sources i decided to 'give it a go'. Wow, the reviews were right! The lobby (where complimentary morning beverages & evening wine is served) was plush and tastefully decorated. The bedroom (i booked a deluxe king and was given an executive suite) was nothing short of fabulous. A gigantic comfortable bed, a sofa, two huge widescreen TV's, one with a DVD player, fridge plus separate honor bar, huge bathroom with a jacuzzi bath for two, super luxury (brand new) bathrobes, Aveda toiletries................ the list goes on! The decor was immaculate; no chipped walls or scratched furniture here. The rooms were cleaned to the highest of standards every morning (you'll find no dust on skirting boards or inside drawers at the Serrano). Plenty of fluffy soft white towels and toiletries were replaced daily; as was the bed linen. Everything you could possibly want was to hand; ice machines, cold fridges, selection of glasses in room, very well stocked honor bar, selection of pillows etc. I seldom stay at a hotel and have nothing to moan about; however the Serrano ticked all of the boxes and surpassed all of my expectations. I honestly cannot believe it has only a three and a half star rating. Grab it while you can!

review.title: Quiet Comfort in the Heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: Hotel Serrano offers the self-reliant traveler the attention and service you need without being overly intrusive. This older hotel has been well-maintained and updated, and room size, while not spacious, was sufficient. The front desk was responsive when called upon, and the lobby morning coffee, afternoon wine, and free New York Times were unexpected touches. I recommend this place without hesitation.

review.title: Ok
review.reviewText: Hotel is nice, would need some food in the morning to be really nice :)

review.title: Comfortable, charming, inexpensive boutique hotel
review.reviewText: The neighborhood was a little seedy but easy to get to other locations quickly. We had a great view, the bed was extremely comfortable, hotel staff accommodating... all in all, a nice place to stay.

review.title: Awesome!
review.reviewText: I've had absolutely fabulous stay in this hotel!! Everything was worth every single penny! The location is very convenient.

review.title: Reasonably priced and located hotel in San Fran
review.reviewText: nice friendly staff at check in. some rooms don't have greatest views, but better to be outside walking around anyway. room was a bit cramped but managable for single occupancy.

review.title: Great Place!
review.reviewText: I have no complaints. Clean rooms, great lobby, free wine reception and coffee!

review.title: Great location, beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was wonderful!! 2 blocks from Union Square and all the great shopping. The staff was very helpful! I love these kimpton boutique hotels. It is convenient to have an iHOME so I can play my iPOD!! I always hate that other hotels don't have something to play music! The Ponzu restaurant attached to the hotel was wonderful as well. Great food and great waitstaff!

review.title: Would Recomment this hotel to anyone!
review.reviewText: My husband and I just returned from our stay at the Serrano in San Fran. and had a great time. The location was ideal (2 blocks from Union Square), the hotel staff was extremely helpful and the room was not only updated and clean but very quiet. As well, from 5-6pm the hotel provide a free wine reception in the welcoming lobby. This was one of the nicest hotels we have stayed at and would stay here again in a second.

review.title: Could be fun!
review.reviewText: Good location within walking distance of Union Square; the hotel provides board games, wine tasting in the evening, coffee in the morning. A nicely refurbished old hotel with courteous and pleasant staff.

review.title: Really pleasant stay
review.reviewText: We've stayed at the Serrano twice, and have been very happy both times. The building is very attractive, especially the lobby. The Serrano is affordable, clean, comfortable, with friendly staff. Oh, and there's free internet.

review.title: Parking is a Joke
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice, good location, but parking was a joke. The lot next door charged me an extra 15 dollars for 15 minutes.

review.title: What a way to relax
review.reviewText: Very Nice hotel, Great Staff, Great location. Yes the rooms maybe smaller then most, well apointed and very comfortable beds. Your only going to sleep in it right?! Great to have an Ipod dock in the room gives that extra home like feel to the place. Nice large flat screen TV too. Comp coffee in the lobby from 5am till 10am

review.title: Perfect SFO hotel for the Christmas holiday season
review.reviewText: I've stayed at Kimpton Hotels in the past, and been impressed. This was no different - even though I reserved the room on short notice only days before we traveled, and had never stayed at this hotel, my wife and I had a wonderful stay on a December weekend just before Christmas. The hotel location was ideal, only two blocks west of Union Square, and three blocks from the BART Powell Street Station. Even though the weekend was rainy, the staff more than made up for it. From the doormen, to the front desk staff, to the cleaning staff, they were all fantastic, professional and friendly. The daily complimentary wine happy hour is not to be missed, especially after a long day of being out and about. It was special especially with the hotel lobby decorated for Christmas, and other travelers were quite social. The check-in process was smooth, and the hotel staff set us up in a corner room with a view to the south/west. While the rooms were small/cozy, we were very impressed w/ the modern, colorful decor, wonderful pillow top bed, large screen LCD tv, and other amenities, including a IPOD player. All made for a very romantic weekend.

review.title: our kind of hotel
review.reviewText: we will definately come back to this hotel. so close to everything and the people are wonderful.yes rooms are small but also very cozy. we will be back next year for our annual trip to San Francisco @ christmas time.definately recommed it to everyone. The Barnetts & grandson Dylan

review.title: Annual Holiday Shopping Trip
review.reviewText: I have met my 2 best girlfriends in San Francisco to do our holiday shopping each year for more than a decade. We have stayed at several Union Square Hotels over the years, and always had fun, but haven't always loved our accommodations! The Serrano is Charming and comfortable. Though without any kind of view, our room was quiet(San Fransisco is noisy!) and well appointed. The staff was kind and accommodating. We enjoyed the wine reception in the lobby, and appreciated the fabulous shower in the bathroom! We'll definitely come back!

review.title: Comforty, classy, and friendly hotel. A gem around Union Square
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Serrano Hotel for 4 nights and had excellent service. The theme of the hotel is Morrocan and the deco reflects as such. I got a corner room and got plenty of natural light. The two tiered curtains were great to keep the room dim when I want to. It is a boutique hotel so the room is not big but I got everything I need. The furniture is nice and well laid out. The Aveda toilettries were a nice touch. I got a good deal on Expedia and was very happy during my entire stay. The front desk even supplies yoga mat and blocks for you! The gym is clean, equipped with treadmills, weights, and not busy. Good location too. I will go back there again.

review.title: Hotel Serrano - Just off Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel had a very upscale feel, with its plush lobby and 2nd level meeting rooms, and its evening wine reception every night. The rooms were small. The beds were very comfortable, and the toiletries and television channel availabilities were good, but not phenomenal. This is a perfect hotel if you want quiet. This is a perfect hotel if you just want a place to sleep at night, that is just off union square, that isn't as expensive as the marriott or the hilton (which is just across the street). Be the one who pays less, and parties in your buddy's room in the Hilton, then have a nice quiet place to come back to with that special someone afterward. everybody's a critic.

review.title: Affordable, comfortable & great location!
review.reviewText: The room was comfortable & we had no complaints besides the smaller bathroom. The rate they we got through expedia was great and the location of the hotel was very convenient to shopping in Union Square.

review.title: Serrano hotel - San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great hotel. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Great location right off Union Square. We'll be returning again to this hotel.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: we booked a non-smoking room. The bathroom, the pillows and the sheets were stinking of smoke.

review.title: Nice Boutique Hotel with convenient location
review.reviewText: Staff was extremely nice and helpful. Rooms are a little small but comfortable. Good location for getting to Union Square and other popular spots in San Fran. Love the evening wine! Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Wonderful Service
review.reviewText: My partner and I flew down to San Francisco to get married and thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Serrano Hotel in SF. The staff was delightful and very helpful. Our room was cozy and nice. As it is an older hotel the rooms aren't terribly sound proof so we did hear an early morning cry from either a wet or hungry infant (thankfully the parents were attentive and it didn't go on for long!).

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel and staff were great. Close to shopping and restaurants, but a fair way from the Wharf.

review.title: very accomodating
review.reviewText: While I'm sure this is not the case all the time, they were able to accomodate my request to check in early as well as a late checkout on my departure date. The front desk even had a good suggestion on a restaurant.

review.title: Quaint Hotel in Great Location
review.reviewText: The Serrano is located really close to Union Square, making it ideal for touring. It is almost getting to be a seedier area, though. Inside, it is really pretty and luxurious in the lobby. Their theme is "games", and they have many in the rooms and to borrow. The rooms are really small, bathrooms are minute. But again, very nicely decorated...flat screen tvs, mini bar, all the perks.

review.title: Very friendly, helpful staff
review.reviewText: Very impressed with the how friendly and helpful the staff were. The lobby is beautiful and our room was very clean and had very comfortable beds! For the price - nicest downtown SF hotel I've stayed in so far!

review.title: Would go back
review.reviewText: Would recommend this hotel to other people. the rooms were clean and well fitted out. they were maybe a little smaller than some other places we stayed around the USA, but in San Fran this seems to be fairly common. It was still very comfortable. Some people comlpained about the street noise but we were on the 4th floor and didn't hear a thing. One thing it's only 1 block away from the Tenderloin District - but in saying that we had no problems at all with any of the homeless around and just made sure we didn't venture further than that point.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Serrano for 11 days. The service was great and all the staff were very helpful. Everyone would acknowledge us and smile when we passed by. We wanted to change rooms during the week (we wanted 2 beds instead of 1) and they happily accomodated. The gym was clean and there were clean towels everyday. They provided coffee and tea every morning and had a wine reception everyday from 5-6pm. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

review.title: Fine Hotel; Good Location
review.reviewText: Everything was fine and up to expectations except better breakfasts can be found in restaurants in the neighborhood. Historic lobby a plus.

review.title: Acceptable
review.reviewText: Pricy but acceptable accommadations for SF

review.title: Small, but comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: We just returned from SF for a 8-day vacation and had stayed in the Serrano Hotel. The room there is quite small, but clean and comfortable. The staff were very helpful to all the questions we had. The wine and beer reception at the evening was great though we're only able to enjoy 2 evenings. The hotel is close to all attrations, shopping centers, within reasonable walking distance. For example, it takes about 15-20 to Ferry Building.

review.title: An atmospheric hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was excellent. Bed room spaceous & clean, plus staff very friendly and whitty. The main attraction for this hotel is its splendid reception area, worth popping in to see. Excellent to relax and just watch the world go by! It is ideally situated for the shops and cablecars, and easy to reach all the main attractions. I definately stay there again.

review.title: Fun hotel in a convenient location
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I stayed for 3 nights at the Hotel Serrano and were very pleased. The evening wine reception was a great place to meet other guests over a game of Jenga and we found the hotel to very conveniently located near the Powell St. BART stop. The hotel is on the border of the tenderloin, but the seedier parts of the neighborhood are easily avoided by being just a little bit careful about the routes you take.

review.title: Nice option
review.reviewText: Nice boutique hotel which was clean and the staff friendly. It does lack a few ammenities such as limited dining opportunity and no sundry shop. They do offer a nice lobby coffee service in the mornings.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel, on the edge of the main areas. I was traveling alone and the staff made me feel very welcome and reassured. The room was very comfortable and clean. The hotel is generally in a nice area, although I'd avoid the neighbouring Tenderloin area at night.

review.title: Okay for the price in SF
review.reviewText: Originally booked for the king room and was put in a queen room (they didn't tell me prior). Bed coverings were damp and smelt of wet down. Hair dryer was missing out of second room and had to call at 530 am for one. Otherwise, clean, friendly staff. Noise can be heard from adjoining rooms but seemed acceptable for the price and age of hotel.

review.title: Hotel is quite nice and quiet
review.reviewText: Walking distance to most of the attractions in SFO

review.title: DIstinctive decor with a fun attitude
review.reviewText: I liked this hotel, it has a very beautiful lobby that is quite distinctive. The free afternoon wine tasting is a real treat. I loved all the games in the lobby. We played Scramble and Sorry in the lobby on a couple rainy afternoons. The hotel is in a 'edge' neigborhood however, you don't want to take a right out of the front door. But that said, we didn't take a right and it's close to great restaurants and Union Square and we got a great deal combining the hotel with our airfare. I'd stay there again.

review.title: Impressed my wife.
review.reviewText: Very nice, clean boutique hotel with helpful staff. Found out after we got back home that our son had stayed there and enjoyed it also. I knew from the favorable reviews I had read, that my wife and I would be favorably impressed. Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Eclectic San Francisco Hotel
review.reviewText: This is a historically renovated San Francisco hotel. The lobby is inviting. The elevators are quick but be prepared to wait your turn during peak hours, as the elevators are old fashioned, while fast, they are quite tiny. The rooms are very small. Some of the wall paper needs a bit of work, but the old wood work and a few scratches here and there add to the ambience. Don't try to share a room with more than two people. You will have difficulty moving around. The bathroom is quite small, and be organized. There is not much in the way of shelf space to put your toiletries. The rooms were quiet. The downtown noise is minimal. I would have liked to be able to open a window, though. The district area is typical large city atmosphere. It has your mix of business people, tourists, locals and of course there are homeless and transients wandering around especially at night. However, this is in any city. I allowed my 16 and 18 year old to go off on their own without hesitance. Of course they live in a big city and know what to do. All in all, I would recommend this hotel, unless you really like to spread out.

review.title: Convenient and comfortable
review.reviewText: We had a deluxe king on the second floor (really third by North American numbering) facing O'Farrell St. Despite the proximity to the street, the room was very quiet. Hotel staff were very friendly and the lobby is beautiful. The hotel's fitness facility (basement) is rather cramped but serviceable.

review.title: Issues with cleaning
review.reviewText: The hotel was ok, but there was a used band aid on my bathroom floor (not mine) for the entire week I was there. And when I want a coffee- really, it doesn't have to be burned and coffee for one will suffice. Maybe add it to the menu.

review.title: Location, location, location
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel, friendly staff and an awesome location. Very close to everything we needed. The room was pretty small even though it was a 'King DeLuxe', thankfully we didn't bring lots of clothes to hang up as the closet is tiny. However, the bed/bedding was glorious and it was very clean. Loved the freebie wine in the evenings, great chance to wind down after a day of walking the streets of San Francisco.

review.title: Comfy and cozy...
review.reviewText: This was a perfect hotel for my husband and I to spend our 8th anniversary in. Yes the rooms are a bit small but they are very comfy. The staff were all so friendly and helpful...We would stay here agian for sure:)

review.title: Charming oasis in the city for a great price.
review.reviewText: The Serrano is a very charming hotel situated in a classic older San Francisco building not too far from Union Square. If you like huge soaring lobbies with lots of glass and chrome this is not the place for you. The faux painting and Moorish details exude old world elegance. The detailing flows into the rooms with playfully appointed furnishings and expected amenities. Flat screen T.V. Very nice bedding. Hosted in the lobby you will find very good coffee in the morning and wine in the afternoon. The staff was exceptional - Very helpful and friendly.

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: Nice hotel at a good price. Close to shopping and the cable cars.

review.title: friendly, convenient, clean, decent sized rooms.
review.reviewText: We had heard to expect hotels near Union square to have small rooms so we were pleasantly surprised to have a large room, closet, fridge, room bar, large plasma, and a decent enough view. We had a King bed which was very comfortable and was made up each day. The doormen always greeted us and asked if we needed any help/advice. And a nice touch was a free wine/beer tasting at 5-6pm each night. We stayed 3 nights and have no complaints at all.

review.title: friendly and helpful staff
review.reviewText: went to san francisco on vacation. stayed at the serrano hotel. very helpful and friendly staff. the rooms were very small but it was an older building and we only stayed in the room to sleep. very clean rooms and loved the aveda products they provided. didn't run out of hot water. would probably stay at another hotel next time just because my daughter wanted to stay where there is a pool. highly recommend this hotel as a luxury hotel for people who won't mind the small rooms. can't speak highly enough about how wonderful the staff was.

review.title: Enjoyed our stay
review.reviewText: The staff was friendly and helpful. The location was convenient. Its close to lots of shopping. The room was twice as big as Sir Francis Drake where we stayed last year, without giving up any of the charm. And it was less expensive. I would definitely recommend the Serrano. We'll stay there again next year.

review.title: Small, cute and cozy
review.reviewText: Small beautifully restored older hotel right downtown. Away from the noise of Union Square but it's only a short walk to Market Street. Room was small but clean and nice. Staff was great.

review.title: Great Boutique Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was very comfortable and all staff very pleasant and helpful. Early morning coffee service until 9am with a newspaper of choice was very appreciated. Some problems with wireless but overall service was great. Only problem is walking down Taylor to Market....definitely not recommended. Heading up Taylor or over to Union and Powell are both ok any time of day or night. I would stay there again!

review.title: Off the beaten path, but close to the subway.
review.reviewText: There were a lot of restaurants that I wanted to try, but I was afraid to walk out at night by myself, because I'm really little. The hotel was great, but the location was not the best.

review.title: Reasonable hotel at good location.
review.reviewText: Good central location, nice small hotel with character. Very comfortable bed.

review.title: exactly what you would expect in a hotel
review.reviewText: I love the conservation measures this hotel chain employs.

review.title: Best showers!
review.reviewText: Their shower heads are actually high enough that I can stand under neath them (and being 6'6", this is quite a trick) _and_ they have shower head that actually allows for a decent amount of water (as opposed to the usual "low flow" trickle of water that seems to evaporate before it reaches your feet). Plus they've got Aveda products as their comp. shampoo

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: I stayed at the hotel for 1 week for a meeting at the convention center. The location was close enough to walk to the convention center, but it could take 15 minutes to get there, so I often ended up take a taxi back and forth. The staff was pleasant. Room was clean. Room service did confuse my order or forget a few things 3 out of 4 times though. It is an older hotel, but cozy.

review.title: A very nice small hotel
review.reviewText: This was the second time I stayed at the Serrano. Both times I have been very pleased with my stay. The rooms are quite small, but contain lots of amenities. Everything was clean and well cared for. I had a corner room and the two large windows made for a nice, bright room. The staff were always friendly and doorman always said "welcome back". I didn't try the restaurant, but I did get to the daily wine tasting a couple of times. It was 10 to 15 minute walk to the Moscone Center, but the weather made it a pleasant walk.

review.title: cute hotel
review.reviewText: I prefer a smaller, boutique hotel...and this one is exceptional. Friendly service, comfortable rooms, convenient business services and facilities...and a great location! Worth a visit!!

review.title: good location, fun, clean
review.reviewText: good hotel, good location, clean and fun

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: Great weekend at the Serrano - for the rate we, the quality of the room was great. The bed was very confortable and bedding was wonderful. Only 2 negatives: our room was close to the elevator and we could hear a rumbling noise but we got used to it - request a room away from elevators. I also was not able to connect to internet from the room - had to use the business center and $5.00 for 15 minutes is a bit steep for internet usage but there is an internet cafe right across the street. Would absolutely go back to this hotel.

review.title: Darling little jewel box of a hotel
review.reviewText: I just completed a six day stay at the Serrano. The staff is so professional and attentive. Breakfast restaurant is first class; coffee and the NY Times and local papers available every morning in the lobby. The hotel rooms are small but luxurious for the very affordable rate. Great location in terms of access to transit anywhere in the central city. I look forward to going back for a vacation stay soon.

review.title: I'd stay there again
review.reviewText: My room was on the smaller side but comfortable. Hotel is close to everything. Staff was extremely helpful.

review.title: Not impressed with tiny room
review.reviewText: While staff was kind and all, the size of the rooms (so very tiny) and battered moulding in our room was a real turn off. Also, our tv failed to work and got tired of complaining.

review.title: were to eat?
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice but the Elevator made a noise we heard throught out the night. making it a not so good stay. also no breakfast was avaliabel due to construction and no arrangment were made so we had to go out and find some unknowns place to us to eat.

review.title: Great Time
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a great location. Easy to walk to everything or catch a trolley. The hotel staff was friendly. We did not eat there, however. Great Trip!

review.title: cozy hotel in center of downtown with reasonable price
review.reviewText: I like this hotel in overall. Hotel room is not big but it is very comfort and clean. The hotel location is very convenience for us to travel around. We get all we need with reasonable price.

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText: This hotel was an excellent find. The staff were friendly, the position great and the rooms though smaller than others, were clean and comfortable. Would certainly stay here again.

review.title: More than satisfied
review.reviewText: Convenient location, affordable price, and superb hotel service with very friendly, helpful staffs that are always willing to assist with a smile. Typical downtown with panhandlers but it didn't really bother us and was fine walking in Union Square at night. The room was small but clean with an added bonus of aveda products. I would gladly return to this hotel in the future when I'm back in SF. Once again, greatly appreciate assistance from front desk staffs that never failed our expectations.

review.title: Serrano Hotel
review.reviewText: Small but well-appointed rooms. Friendly and helpful staff. Fine location as long as one gets one's bearings and knows which way to turn when exiting the hotel. Close to very good stuff; not far from... the rest.

review.title: Old and somewhat shabby hotel and service
review.reviewText: Although I enjoy the atmosphere of older historic hotels this one could have used a good dusting. The room was clean although we did find a dog biscuit under the bed - we have no pets! The elevator was out of service one day which caused excessive waits. My biggest concern, however, was when our flight got cancelled the morning of our departure and we inquired about adding a night to our stay. The front desk told us that the current room rate was more than double what we'd paid per night up to that point. Needless to say, we checked out and found other accommodations for that last night.

review.title: Amazing experience
review.reviewText: The staff was friendly and helpful. From the moment you arrived, they welcome you in and you'd never know that you were staying at a hotel-but you lived there. The cleanliness of the hotel room was very good. The rooms were really comfortable. And the fact that the hotel was not so far from Union square or fisherman's wharf was a plus, b/c you could just take a cable car. Overall, i will for sure be staying there on my second trip to San Fransisco.

review.title: Will definitely stay at Serrano Hotel Again
review.reviewText: Very friendly bell hop, door man and chambermaid. Value for money. Close to everything. This is our 2nd time staying at the hotel and we will definitely stay at Serrano again.

review.title: Nice Getaway
review.reviewText: Great location to walk and shop in all the great stores. Hotel room was very comfortable & clean. I loved the games located in the room to play with! We had a corner room on the 12th floor with a great view out of both sides of the room. The staff was very helpful...

review.title: old school comfort
review.reviewText: central location is great. no need to to stay in the high price spread to get a great room. always treated with a smile...

review.title: Great hotel - love the service
review.reviewText: Wonderful service, bell man was so nice, great wine/beer happy hour and a.m. breakfast. Loved our stay!

review.title: Cozy hotel with warm atmosphere
review.reviewText: We stepped out of the crisp San Francisco air into the warm, cozy lobby of the Serrano, and we knew we were home! The room, while small, was very clean and quiet. Almost no street noise on the 12th floor. The decor was cute, and the bed was comfy. The staff was wonderful, helping us find local attractions and giving us ideas for things to do. This hotel is also pet friendly. While we did not take our pooch, we saw plenty in the hotel, but never heard a peep from any of the pets. Easy walk up O'Farrell to Union Square and the trolleys that take you to Fisherman's Wharf or Ghirardelli Square. Great little boutique hotel - we would definately stay again!

review.title: Terrific Hotel and Service !
review.reviewText: The Serrano is a beautiful boutique hotel a short walk from Union Square amongst other things, and only a $7 cab ride to the Wharf, Broadway, Filmore and Mission. The doormen and concierge are extremely helpful and personable - in fact, they add some of the character to the place (you know who you are gentlemen). Terrific bang for the buck at this hotel !

review.title: return
review.reviewText: we've stayed many times. always clean, courteous and welcoming.

review.title: A Gem in SF
review.reviewText: I live in the Bay Area but love to spend the night in SF. I've stayed at many of the smaller boutique hotels and generally find that you can't go wrong with a Kimpton property. The Serrano did not disappoint. You have to expect a small room in the city, especially for a good rate, but the ultra-comfy king bed and Aveda bath products more than make up for it. The hotel is in a good location, close to the theater district and Union Square shopping, but still manages to have quiet rooms.

review.title: Very Friendly Staff
review.reviewText: " I was impressed with the Hotel staff. Every staff member from the Bell personnel to the people parking your vehicle, were extremely courteous. For those with pets, this hotel may be of some interest to you.

review.title: Would definitely recommend the Serrano
review.reviewText: I was at the Serrano for a business conference. I saw the hotels where colleagues stayed - The Serrano was a million times better. A small, but very comfortable room, excellent service and friendly staff. It was a pleasure to return there at the end of the day. I never got to try out any of the complementary coffee or wine tastings.

review.title: Near Union Square
review.reviewText: Nice place to stay near Union Square. Room was comfortable. A little noisy during the night because of the pipes or HVAC system...not sure which. Wine reception in evening was fun. We would definitely stay here again.

review.title: San Francisco in Style!
review.reviewText: This is a lovely hotel in the heart of San Francisco close to wonderful restaurants, bistros, wine bars, theatres and transportation to farther sites. The room was comfortable, exceptionally clean and the whole property beautifully maintained....and all around an outstanding value!! We will definitely stay at the Serrano on our next trip to San Francisco!!!!

review.title: Love San Francisco - Can't Wait to Return
review.reviewText: My son and I stayed at the Serrano for four nights. We loved the hotel and San Francisco. The room was very comfortable and extremely clean and well-maintained. The counter space in the bathroom is slightly small, but not really that big of a deal. We managed to fit in all of our stuff just fine. I really have no complaints and only good things to say about it. We were extremely pleased. As for San Francisco, we absolutely loved it and can't wait to go back.

review.title: Nice hotel for the price
review.reviewText: Our room was comfortable, clean, etc. Great linens, overall a lot for the $$ in San Fran.

review.title: Second Time Here
review.reviewText: Second time I have stayed at this hotel. Excellent location at excellent price. Don't walk around south of here too much. Area OK, but not great. Very convenient to everything. Service is solid, room is small but nice.

review.title: Kimpton Again
review.reviewText: I will look for another Kimpton Hotel when I travel anywhere again. Before this trip I heard of them but never stayed. I will try not to stay at another hotel again.

review.title: A fantastic hotel - 4 star amenities at a 3 star rate!
review.reviewText: A fantastic hotel - 4 star amenities at a 3 star rate. During our stay at the Serrano, we were extremely comfortable. Brand new king sized beds and luxurious linens. Bathrooms were a tad small but to be expected for a historic building. Very close (within walking distance) to Union Square, the Top of The Mark (breathtaking 360 degree views of the city), theater district and the cable car turnaround. A complimentary wine hour was offered every day and was a nice way to relax before dinner after a full day of walking around the bay area.

review.title: the staff are among the friendliest and most helpful I've experienced in 3 decades of travel ...
review.reviewText: Hotel is convenient to theatre, clubs, restaurants, Union Square, etc. Staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. Room was comfortable, quiet and well maintained, albeit on the small side, though as a regular traveler to Europe, this is not at all an issue for us ... the comfortable, King size bed more than made up for it! And the hotel's happy hour is a REAL happy hour - wine and beer are free, visitors happy, staff friendly. Keep up the good work ...

review.title: Great little boutique hotel
review.reviewText: Overall, very pleased. Service was great, the rooms were a tad small and the bathroom was very small. But the hotel was close to everything, very old but clean. Parking garage is next door. Lots of shops and reseraunts close by.

review.title: Nice place for adults
review.reviewText: Great service at this hotel, the staff is very helpful. Location is good if you want to stay close to Union Sq but not pay top dollar. Not great for kids but real nice for adults.

review.title: Great stay at Serrano
review.reviewText: My wife and I stayed at the Serrano for my birthday weekend in July and were not disappointed. Hotel staff were pleasant and helpfull. The hotel location is in close proximity to great shopping and lots of wonderful restaurants. We love the ornate lobby and the afternoon wine tasting is a great touch. The only issue we had was with the small size bathroom but that's expected from boutique style hotel. We'll stay at Serrano again the next time we're in the Bay area.

review.title: great location, great hotel
review.reviewText: The Serrano really is a great hotel to stay in. I travel to SF often and so far, this is the best I've found. For the decent price, the room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. The room was not very big, but it did have A/C. The restaurant downstairs, Ponzu, was fabulous and the wait staff was fabulous. The only staff that did not impress me were all those working behind the desk as well as the door man. I did not find them to be extremely accomodating nor friendly. Nevertheless, its a couple blocks from union square which means a couple blocks from the trolley, cable car, or bus line. All in all, easy access and very clean.

review.title: Over valued
review.reviewText: Overall, staff was wonderful. Morning check in staff snooty and unfriendly. Beds were very comfortable. Restaurant is a definite negative. Have obtained better value at other hotels, and was a bit disappointed since this was a Klimpton run location.

review.title: Great Deal for a Gorgeous Hotel!
review.reviewText: The hotel is very close to Union Square - but by accident we went down the hill and found ourselves in a very sketchy area called Tenderloin. Overall the room was clean, but there are some details that need to be adjusted (i.e. door frames, ceiling panels things like that). It was a great deal for the quality of the room. The only downside of staying here is room service. YOu can only order breakfast in the mornings and that is it. We wanted to have an "in-room massage", but the room was way too small - so we decided against it. If you want to have hotel luxuries - stay elsewhere, but if you are a no fuss traveler that just wants a great bed to stay in and no one to bother you - stay here! I would definitely look into another Klimpton hotel in the future!

review.title: Service is Amazing
review.reviewText: Very happy can't wait to go back.

review.title: Great place to stay!
review.reviewText: This hotel was a great value for the price. What separates this hotel from others is the friendly, attentive staff. They go out of their way to make you feel very welcome and at home in the middle of the city. The hotel itself is very clean, the rooms are nice, and it has all of the amenities of a big hotel chain.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Clean, great customer service. Loved the board games they had available to check out and play. Convenient to BART and Union Square with all the shopping!! Would definitely stay there again!

review.title: Good Value
review.reviewText: The room was clean and the atmosphere was excellent. The rooms are small relative to American standards, but very usable. Very good for a couples weekend.

review.title: Fun hotel, great value
review.reviewText: This hotel offers great value considering the location and service it provides. It was close to BART, many bus routes and the cable car stations. Having a "fun" theme, the hotel offers to play black jack with you upon checking in. If you win, the hotel offers you some sort of discount/deal; if you lose, a voluntary $5 will go to a nonprofit organization. The hotel also offers all sorts of board games for you to check out for free. The staff was friendly and the hotel was clean, though a bit small. The only minor thing I was not satisfied with was that we had made plan to dine at the hotel restaurant on the last day of our stay there which was the memorial day, but the restaurant was closed and we were not notified until the night before.

review.title: Great Small and Conveniently Located Hotel
review.reviewText: Kimpton's reputation for excellent small, conveniently located hotels with great restaurants priced reasonably stays firmly established with the Serrano! Our room was very comfortable, not too small and the amenities were great. Coffee in the morning and a wine reception at night with plenty of time to mingle in the lobby made it all that much more enjoyable. We were right in the heart of shopping and the theatre. The staff was friendly and helpful. The best part of the stay was that we were only 20 miles from home . . . a weekend getaway just a BART ride away!

review.title: Convenient, quiet.
review.reviewText: I stayed in this hotel in 2000 and remembered that it was a pleasant place. Booked it again in 2007, and was very happy that it is still a pleasant place to stay. Staff are helpful, room is comfortable, the place is well-kept.

review.title: Practical base for exploring San Francisco
review.reviewText: We only stayed for 3 nights and managed to enjoy the free organic beer and a glass of wine on the first evening we arrived. Free tea and coffee in the morning. The complimentary Aveda products in the room are useful, however we thought we had paid for a slightly larger room, but disappointly it was very small. It was fully equipped with everything we needed including a radio/speaker for your ipod, but we were quite cramped in the room and 3 nights were enough. The 'mini bar' included a SF map and some other useful items that you usually realise you have forgotten to bring with you!

review.title: Cute little boutique hotel
review.reviewText: This is a great little boutique hotel in a fantastic location in San Francisco. The hotel has a very unusual lobby. Quite different to most hotels I've stayed in. I especially liked the "games" theme in the hotel. Upon arrival you are invited to play a hand of blackjack against the receptionist to win a prize, if you loose they ask that you make a donation to charity. There are board games in the lobby to play and even games in your room. I was especially taken by the minature etch-a-sketch! It took me back to my younger years. The hotel was nicely decorated, rooms were clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is close to parking and within easy walking distance to Union Square. I would use this hotel again and recommend it to anyone looking for a reasonably priced hotel in downtown SF.

review.title: Good service but little breathing room
review.reviewText: The service at the hotel was excellent, from free evening wine and beer tasting to free tea and coffee in the morning. The staff was very courteous and willing to assist you in any way. The room itself was clean and neat but suffered from a small size and lack of open windows. The only source of air is from the A/C because the windows do not open. That was a bit dissapointing but overall I enjoyed my stay and would recommend it to anyone who does not suffer from extreme claustrophobia.

review.title: Great value
review.reviewText: We waited until that day to book a last minute adventure to the city. Not having stayed here before, I had no idea what to expect. I was impressed with the service and attention to detail. Although the hotel is somewhat small, the service is HUGE. In fact I will probably stay hre next time we travel in place of our usual haunt.

review.title: Right next door.......
review.reviewText: This hotel is right next door to all kinds of things a travler from out of town is looking for. You are just a few blocks away from the Powell street cablecar turn around, and union square. You can walk to plenty of shopping nearby or take a short cab ride to Pier 39. Chinatown is also nearby and full of things to see and buy. The staff at this hotel is very friendly and more than accomodating. The doorman called me by name everyday, and everytime he saw me. You feel like royalty!! You can also enjoy a town car ride to the airport for a very fair price! Overall, this hotel was great. There is also a restaurant connected to the hotel, Ponzu. It has a limited menu, and if you don't care for seafood then this isn't the place for you.

review.title: A wonderful hotel experience
review.reviewText: The staff was extremely courteous and helpful. The doorman referred to the guests by name and always used the honorific. The rooms are well appointed and charmingly decorated. Only one small issue is the fact that there is very little 'vanity' space in the bathroom. Overall, a delightful hotel, that I will re-visit on any future trips to San Francisco.

review.title: Great Bargain, convenient location
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay at the Serrano, friendly staff, wine happy hour, nice plush robes, good size room. Quick (5-10 min) walk to Powell St. Bart station, close to all the great shopping of Union Square. On the edge of the Tenderloin district, so as long as you don't head right out of the hotel front door, it's a good neighborhood. Great bargain in San Fran!

review.title: Great location and very friendly service
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay with Serrano. The people there were very customer oriented. They really took care of anything we needed. Rooms were not big but satisfactory...very clean.

review.title: Would book another room
review.reviewText: The Serrano is just what I wanted. Close to the Curran Theater,Valet parking clean and very friendly staff. We enjoyed our stay. We had breakfast at the restaurant in the hotel. Prices were in range for the Theater District. We were two single women in a large city and felt safe and secure. The Serrano staff were very accomodating. I would stay again.

review.title: Quite Impressed-Great Value
review.reviewText: Our recent stay at the Serrano was fantastic. It is just a beautiful hotel and the staff is top notch-- friendly, attentive, and very helpful. They were able to store our luggage the day we left on the red eye and the front desk will even print out boarding passes for you! Other surprises: nightly happy hour with free beer and wine, aveda bath products in the room, they will even arrange transportation to-from the airports. Good location near union square/powell street. It's a good 3 block walk from the Powell St. BART station so I would recommend a cab if you have lots of luggage and plan to use BART. Also near the cable car lines, nice restaurants, bars, shopping, etc. We would definitely stay here again as it we got a great value for what you get and look forward to staying at another Kimpton hotel!

review.title: Great Deal Downtown
review.reviewText: The rooms are very small, but that's to be expected from SF hotels. They've made the most of the space they have. The location is great for easy access to Union Square and public transportation, but be careful at night, you are on the border of the Tenderloin. The rooms are very clean, comfortable and quiet and the complimentary internet and wine are a nice touch. My entire company stays at Kimpton Properties whenever possible, they're never a disappointment. We would stay there again.

review.title: Comfy spot.
review.reviewText: Very pleasant stay. Helpful staff.

review.title: Great hotel; Great location.
review.reviewText: The hotel has lots of character (in a good way!), the staff is very professional and eager to help. They even have a free cocktail hour from 5-7 in the lobby. Many guests who didn't know eachother were readily striking up conversation during this time. Granted, the rooms are small but very well appointed. I loved my iPod ready alarm clock! Also, if you are in Union Square in S.F. you shouldn't be spending much time in your room!

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: With two us traveling for fun, we found this hotel to be very adequate for our travel needs. From the minute we checked in, the staff was extremely friendly and accomodating and even upgraded our room at no charge. The room and bathroom were a decent size, although probably not very comfortable for a family with kids. The location was fanatastic, only blocks from the trolley cars, bus line and metro and within walking distance of Chinatown and any type of restaurant you may want. We would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Very Cute
review.reviewText: The room was so cute. We stayed in a corner room so we could see downtown very well. The room was small but I knew that by reading these reviews. The rooms are very comfortable though.

review.title: Excellent Boutique Hotel
review.reviewText: I selected this hotel based on the site reviews. It is an excellent hotel, with very reasonable rates for downtown SF. Area is very convenient, hotel staff is very attentive, and it is a real "home away from home". Early evening wine tasting is a very nice touch, gives you a chance to meet other guests. Lobby is gorgeous. Rooms are excellent - a bit smaller than the typical "big box" modern hotel, but infinitely more interesting. One downside is that the room heat / AC unit is pretty loud when it kicks on, but in SF you can get away without using it much. I will come back here next time in SF.

review.title: Decent place to stay
review.reviewText: As with most reasonably priced hotels in San Fran the Serrano's rooms are quite compact compared with rooms in other parts of the country. That said, they are well appointed and clean. The hotel staff is very helpful and takes good care of the guests.

review.title: Good but could easily improve
review.reviewText: The room is very nice, the furniture looks good, but there is no bedside table. The wifi network didn't work; the tech support was polite and solved the problem after I told him what was wrong (overlap of wifi signals with another hotel). Clearly nobody ever tested the wifi connections in that room / on that floor.

review.title: Outstanding value
review.reviewText: Great value, with outstanding service. Upon arrival, greeted by the doorman by name...very impresssive.

review.title: A nice little place
review.reviewText: Our goal was to have a home base near Union Square from which we could do plenty of Christmas shopping. Mission accomplished. This hotel is clean, attractively decorated, and the staff is friendly and helpful. There is nothing particularly extravagant about the place, and the rooms are small, but after a long day of walking from shop to shop, the bed and TV are welcoming.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: Good location. Good service, nice rooms but small

review.title: A very nice hotel.
review.reviewText: A very good location and I had a very nice stay there. I was totally satisfied.

review.title: Great deal, friendly, with charm; excellent location
review.reviewText: Small room, but the friendly staff, charm and location made this an excellent vacation. Just 2 blocks from Union Square and the cable car to take you to China Town or Fisherman's Wharf; 1 block to cross town bus to Golden Gate Park, the Presidio, De Young Museum, Legion of Honor.

review.title: Charming
review.reviewText: This hotel has a kind of 1920s charm that is quite delightful in San Francisco, particularly with all of the high priced large competitors nearby. We loved the the lobby and enjoyed playing board games there.

review.title: Good Value DT San Fran
review.reviewText: Rooms are small, but well appointed. Very nice hotel and terrific value for the dollar.

review.title: Serrano Hotel
review.reviewText: Nice ambiance, small rooms, decor a bit over the top, but not annoying. Conveniently located, but parking is very expensive. The lot directly across the street is efficient and handy, but costs $28.00/24 hr. period.

review.title: Good service, but uncomfortable
review.reviewText: This hotel definitely stood out for its friendly staff and service, and it was in a great location for shopping, restaurants, etc. It was also very clean and had nice shampoos and soaps. However, we did not sleep well because the bed was very hard, the room was small and not well-ventilated, and it was very noisy (we couldn't hear street noise, but we could hear the TV playing and people talking in the room next door.)

review.title: great stay
review.reviewText: spent four days in san francisco and the hotel was truly a great stay...location was perfect for using trolley and bus line to access all parts of the city...also walking distance to most attractions...we like staying at quaint places with character yet well serviced...you will find both here...

review.title: I don't like old hotels
review.reviewText: I'd rather go to somewhere else. Forget about the history of the building or whatever. Who cares. I want upscale, valet parking readily available, newer tubs not ones that were refinished and when you step on it it dents in. The refridgerater needs to be quieter. Front desk people are not friendly.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: My teenage daughter and I stayed at the hotel for two nights the first week of September. The staff gave us a warm welcome feeling from the moment we arived. The hotel is very pretty and clean. I enjoyed coffee both mornings in the lobby while my daughter got an extra hour of sleep in the room. The room and bathroom was small, much like hotels in London and Paris, however, the room had everything we needed and this was really not a problem. There are two parking garages in the same block as the hotel so you do not have to use the valet service. The hotel is well located one block the Curan theater and just a couple of blocks from Union Square. I will stay there again.

review.title: Nice hotel, with better service
review.reviewText: The only real "negatives" were the location was a bit dicey (near Tenderloin), and the business center could use an upgrade in equipment. The service by the concierge and hotel staff overall was outstanding. Nice stay.

review.title: Excellent Location
review.reviewText: The Serrano is a European style hotel. Small and quaint. The rooms are adequate in size, but with a lot of amenities packed in - small refrigerator stocked with an "honor system" assortment of goodies, iron board and iron, hair dryer, etc. Plus the free morning coffee is the best I've had at any hotel. The location is excellent - close to Union Square and the start of the cable car line which gives an easy ride to Chinatown and Fishermans's wharf. The concierge was very helpful in helping us negotiate around the city and surrounding areas as well. We enjoyed this hotel and would certainly recommend it.

review.title: Beautiful but tiny
review.reviewText: The room was small, but well stocked and equipped. The lobby was gorgeous. Very Moroccan and exotic.

review.title: Excellent location, great service
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a great location close to Union Square. Service is great, all requirements were met and we were even greeted by name. Valet parking was quick and efficient. I have become a Kimpton fan since staying at this hotel.

review.title: Great location for less $$
review.reviewText: This small hotel has a great location with a great price. Just steps away from the Grand Cafe, great French cuisine, and the Redwood Room, the very happening club. And Union Square was approximately 3 blocks away. Nothing extravagant...but some nice details like Aveda products. I'll definitely be back.

review.title: Would Stay Again
review.reviewText: Not far from the cable car, trolley, or BART. Great resturants all around just ask the bellhop or front desk for advice they gave great suggestions. Extra pillows were not available the first night but were the second.

review.title: Highly satisfied!
review.reviewText: Very courteous, friendly staff! Great shower with TV in the suite. Forgo the valet parking and self-park in the garage next door to save $.

review.title: Its all about the service
review.reviewText: Perfect walking distance to Union Square, shopping, China Town. Parking is expensive. Hotel shows its age, and the rooms, although clean, catch all the noise from your neighbors and outside. However, they sincerely try to make up for all of that with their service. Bellhops, front desk, they all treat you as if you owned the place. They even include complimentary wine tasting before dinner. It's an ok place to stay if you're looking for convenience and service.

review.title: Hotel Serrano
review.reviewText: This is a great little hotel centrally located near the theaters and Union Square. The rooms are small but tastefully decorated in a non-hotel/motel theme. We'll definitely stay there again.

review.title: A great boutique hotel
review.reviewText: First the bad...the room could have been bigger for 4 people. That's it. Now for the good...beautiful room, exceptionally clean, comfortable beds, quality shampoo and soap, big fluffy towels, good shower, quiet at night, efficient ventilation, attentive staff, and great location. I'd recommend it in a heartbeat...and hope to stay at other Kimpton properties soon.

review.title: incredible
review.reviewText: incredible experience. I love kimpton hotels, the monaco on the same block is also as nice. they give you a paper in the morning and everyone there is happy to be working there. the tenderloin/union square proximity to me is a plus, to some it may be a negative as there are a lot of panhandlers.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: I enjoyed the fact that the outside noise was minimal. I have stayed at several hotels near Union Square and the noise level was atrocious. The Serrano has an extra window pane that reduces the noise drastically and I was able to sleep at night!!

review.title: Clean, but small
review.reviewText: Great customer service! Very pleased with the condition of the hotel. The rooms were very, very small, but still comfortable.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: everyone was very courteous and helpful coffe and teas in morning in the lobbyand wine in the evening in lobby

review.title: Great for the price
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was extremely friendly and the hotel was clean. It's located pretty close to some little diner's and deli's for breakfast or a late night snack. One of the reason's we originally picked this hotel was for the free internet!

review.title: Loved this property
review.reviewText: The Serrano was a great place to stay, and I would definitely return. It was within easy walking distance to Union Square, and I even walked down to the Ferry Terminal and Embarcadero Center. Close to China Town, also. The room was very tastefully done, and, although small, provided every comfort. It was so cozy. I loved the Aveda products in the bathroom. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The game tables in the lobby were a nice touch. Very reasonably priced for such a wonderful location.

review.title: Good location, Cozy room, Noisy heating system
review.reviewText: The location is pretty good. I could go to shop and to eat anywhere in downtown by walk. Though the room was small, it was cozy. One thing I don't like is heating system was too noisy to sleep.

review.title: Excruciatingly clean
review.reviewText: Room was very clean with a nice view

review.title: Very nice service and clean facilities
review.reviewText: It was very comfortable, the premises are very clean and well taken care of and the location is very convenient.

review.title: Friendly atmosphere
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location. The staff is welcoming, and always helpful. High speed internet, and the small gym were free of additional charge. The room may need to be remodeled, and the loud air-conditioning system was a bit of a nuisance. But overall, we had a great time there

review.title: OK
review.reviewText: Good location (that's what you pay for)! Nothing to complain but need a bit more professionalism at the front desk.

review.title: Nice enough
review.reviewText: Old hotel - nicely redone - I had a comfortable stay there. Staff were very helpful. The "game" theme of this hotel is endearing. The counters in the bathrooms are really small and not very useful.

review.title: Don't forget the parking...
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel. The only part I wasn't impressed with is that they made no mention of the fact that parking was nearly $40/night. That would have made a significant impact on my decision to stay at the Serrano. Most hotels indicate parking charges so you can make a decision based on the full picture. I felt a little mislead.

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: The only draw back was the pricey parking.

review.title: A great value in the heart of the city.
review.reviewText: This hotel is a real value for the money. It is a small botique hotel that is well located in the business district. The rooms are beautifully decorated and well maintained. My only concern would be the small size of the bathroom. It is limited by the layout and couldn't be enlarged, but there is little room for your toiletries, let alone extra room for you.

review.title: Quaint and Friendly
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel experience for me! The staff was friendly and knew me by name. The services and amenities were exactly what I needed and was looking for. The bathroom was a little small but the room was very beautiful and comfortable. The hotel was quiet and I slept well there--not always my experience when I travel! I highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great deal!
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were very helpful and knowledgeable about the area. The room was standard size and nicely appointed. I requested a room away from the elevators, and this was accomodated. It was very quiet. I found this hotel to be a great deal for the money, and I'd definitely stay there again.

review.title: Excellent!
review.reviewText: Beautiful lobby and rooms. So tasteful. Super friendly and helpful staff. Excellent location. The complimentary umbrella in the room came in very handy. The Aveda bath products were a nice bonus also, as were the terry cloth robes.

review.title: Great area
review.reviewText: Everything and every detail was taken care of. Staff is very helpful. My only complaint is that the room was very small. The bathroom seemed to be made for a midget. We laughed at it and enjoyed the rest of the hotel immensely.

review.title: I love the Kimpton Hotels!
review.reviewText: I've recently discovered these charming boutique hotels with their eclectic decor and stylish amenities. The selling point, however, is how wonderfully the staff makes the traveler feel! I've stayed in a lot of hotels and nowhere does everyone from the desk staff to the bellmen to the bartendars in the restaurant make you feel so welcomed and special. These hotels and their staff deserve high marks.

review.title: Gem of a hotel
review.reviewText: Great little Boutique Hotel from the Art Deco lobby to the cheerful rooms. staff couldn't have been friendlier and more helpful. Wine tasting in the lobby eveningtime was added to the comfort

review.title: Very Small, but otherwise Fantastic place to stay if you wanna be near Union Square
review.reviewText: Very very very Small, but otherwise Fantastic place to stay if you wanna be near Union Square.

review.title: Small rooms, but great service!!
review.reviewText: Fantastic service - staff couldn't have been nicer!!

review.title: A good choce near Union Square
review.reviewText: A soild choice for a reasonable price. Rooms are small yet well equipped, clean and comfortable. Be careful of valet parking rates of $39 per night!

review.title: super service nice location.
review.reviewText: Great hotel with exceptional service, lobby is nice as is nightly wine reception.Would stay here again for sure !

review.title: Nice but small rooms.
review.reviewText: The hotel was very pretty and well decorated, but the rooms were quite small. Also, they initially put us in someone else's room and then didn't have enough foam pillows (I'm highly allergic to down). But the service was very nice and we enjoyed our stay and the convenience of the location.

review.title: Cool decor and friendly, homey service.
review.reviewText: Gorgeous, funky lobby and the room was adequate though a wee bit small. Great service, felt like home...a happy home.

review.title: Won't go back
review.reviewText: Hotel has a beautiful lobby and friendly staff but our room was very disappointing. There was mold on one wall and refrigerator that made so much noise during the night it woke my husband up twice and he usually sleeps through everything. They were sold out and we got a room right next to the elevator - we could hear that too!

review.title: Very nice inside
review.reviewText: We were very impressed with Serrano but just be careful at night, one wrong turn and you're in a bad area of downtown.

review.title: Fantastic hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel was exceptional. The staff was friendly and helpful, the rooms were great and the location was very close to Union Square. The wine hour each evening in the lobby was a lively affair and a great way to unwind after a day of meetings & seminars. I would stay here again in a heartbeat if I were back in San Francisco!

review.title: Quiet hotel centrally located
review.reviewText: The rooms in this small hotel were renovated nicely to have an elegant feel. Bathrooms have marble floors and accents. Showers drained well. Has a vey old world feel.  The food at the attached restaurant is excellent. Caveat: there was no coffe machine in the room and the lobby is uncomfortably drafty.

review.title: Serrano Hotel
review.reviewText: For the money it's an ok hotel.  Park yourself it's easy and much cheaper.  It's clean but not in the best of shape.  The free wine in the afternoon is nice and the hotel staff are very nice.

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText: This hotel was comfortable, the staff friendly, and all of our needs were met.  We felt that we were definitely getting great value for our money and would definitely go back to the Serrano in future visits to San Francisco.

review.title: For people who like small hotels
review.reviewText: Small European-type hotel a few blocks from Union Square.  Hotel restaurant, San Francisco funky with fanastic contemporary Asian food.  Will stay there again -- great small spa at sister hotel at the end of the block -- try the four-hand massage.

review.title: The Serrano is the best place to stay in San Francisco!!
review.reviewText: You cannot go wrong with The Serrano in San Francisco in fact just being in the "City" is an experience not to be missed.  The Serrano is the best in hotel in SF!!

review.title: Small Rooms - Great Service
review.reviewText:
The pictures of the Serrano on the website suggest an elegant, historic hotel with large, luxurious rooms.  These were the primary reasons for trying the Serrano.  

What we found was a very old hotel, located on the edge of a seedy neighborhood, with very small rooms.

The service was great however and the staff very pleasant and helpful.  Next trip we will try a better location.

review.title: Should have a coffee maker
review.reviewText: It would be nice to include a coffee maker in each room, especially because the hotel doesn't have free coffee or breakfast as a part of their service.

review.title: In Shady Area
review.reviewText: The hotel was mostly fine, although the massages in the lobby and other more environmental factors did not lend itself to a comfortable experience.

review.title: Nice hotel.  Great location.
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed staying at the Serrano.  The evening wine reception also included compimentary massage.  It is close to Union Square.

review.title: Kimpton Hotel a sure bet
review.reviewText: I loved the Serrano.  The staff is very attentive.  They serve wine between 4 and 5 pm, and were happy to allow me to invite a guest who was attending the same business conference.  I have recommended the Kimpton hotels to friends, and I'd gladly try another one!  The Serrano was also close to good dining and theatre.

review.title: Would not hesitate to return!
review.reviewText:
Our stay at the Serrano was wonderful.  I'm fairly picky about hotels, particularly with regard to cleanliness.  Not an issue here.  The building is clearly older, and the rooms are a bit small, but I guess that's what a "Boutique Hotel" is. However the lobby, elelvators, hallways, and our room were all very well maintianed. I was very, very comfortable.  They offer free coffee and tea in the mornings, and wine in the evening in the hotel lobby, and it was great  fun to socailize with some of the other hotel guests. And the restaraunt Ponzu!  I have been generally skeptical about of a lot of the new asian-fusion cuisine, but Ponzu has broadened my mind.  We usually try to avoid the hotel restaraunt in our travel, but this time we  couldn't pull ourselves away.  Staff was helpful, warm and very freindly, and the concierge Stephan helped us with all of out tour arrangements.

All-in-all, a wonderful stay.  Thank you Serrano!!

review.title: What an incredible find!
review.reviewText: We had a terrific time at the Serrano Hotel.  The staff was friendly, courteous and helpful and the place is beautiful - combination of chic, hip and homey.  We read an Expedia review suggesting a high floor and requested an upper floor with a view and our wishes were granted.  Beautiful view - from two sides!  Can't wait to return.

review.title: You Don't Want To Miss Out on Staying Here!
review.reviewText: The Serrano Hotel is located in the heart of San Francisco. The staff is extremely accomadating from valet parking to the wonderful evening wine hour. You will find smiles greeting you throughout the hotel along with the local newspaper at your door step each morning. The room and bathroom are very spacious and you wont be able to beat the price, either!

review.title: The Serrano in San Fran
review.reviewText: It's a nice place but if you're looking to stretch out and relax, this isn't the place.  The rooms are tiny!  Cozy but VERY tight.

review.title: Very cool
review.reviewText: My stay was very good. Hotel has alot of character. it was very beautiful. I can never mark anything paerfect cause nothing ever is. But i would recomend for you to stay at the Serrano, its pretty cool

review.title: Serrano Hotel
review.reviewText: The entire four-day experience of the Serrano Hotel  atmosphere, the staff, and the room accomodations were exceptional, and at an affordable price....
